From the amazing architecture and history, to the landscaping and amenities, we were very happy with our choice as we booked this hotel as a package with Southwest Vacations. If you would like a coffee maker in your room, just request one on check-in. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alcwHouston
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for business and really enjoyed the property! Meeting rooms were great. Wonderful pools. Food was good. Service was excellent. Rooms were a little worn, but it is an old hotel. The shops on the property were great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury~ for a price”
Reviews.Author: Joan9101
Reviews.Content: Luxury ~ for a price My husband and I attended a conference at the Arizona Biltmore. The setting is beautiful, full of history, and well maintained. Here are a few things I would like to have known before checking in: 1. Self parking- $12 a day. Other fees amounted to more than $60 a day above the room rate. 2. No coffee maker in the rooms, however, if you ask, they will provide a coffee service (tip from another review) 3. Tours of the resort are only conducted Tues, Thurs and Sat. at 10 am. Well worth the time! 4. We only ate at Frank & Albert’s while at the resort. We chose to eat outside near the fireplace. The food was delicious, priced just right, great service (Mike), and the setting was wonderful. 5. We had a great room in the Garden Wing. It was very large, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was small. The heating/AC unit works very well. 6. There is a free shuttle to the Biltmore Shopping outdoor mall- leaves on the hour, with return trips about 10-15 minutes past the hour.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Architecture”
Reviews.Author: SlickWilliam
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for four nights in the Ocatilla club wing of the resort and had a great time. The resort is aesthetically appealing and the grounds are very nice. The only drawback had to do with the timing and availability of dining options at the resort. In the Ocatilla club, continental breakfast is offered only until 9:30 am during the weekday and until 10:00 am on weekends. Given that many people come here to relax and unwind, I thought it was odd that we missed out on the complimentary breakfast since we arrived at 9:35 am on our first morning. It would seem more reasonable to extend the times by at least a half hour for those who like to sleep in a little. We also tried to order light snacks at Wrights bar at 10 pm and were told that the bar restaurant was closed. Fortunately, we were able to order off the room service menu. A similar situation occurred when we wanted to get a snack for our daughter at 3:00 in the afternoon and we were told that we would need to go to their "Frank and Albert's" restaurant. The food there was fine, but I thought it was a little odd that the lobby bar had limited kitchen hours for light snacks. Otherwise, the property was very nice and well maintained. I will submit reviews of their restaurants separately.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great service”
Reviews.Author: jogar1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Biltmore. We got an air / hotel pkg through West Jet. The 4th night was free and the resort fee was waved. The resort is huge, 39 acres. They have every type of room imaginable. We were in a very nice cottage. It had a mini fridge, bar, patio, large bathroom & great bed. Service everywhere in the resort was top notch. Our room was upgraded because we had never been there. We asked for a coffee maker and it was delivered in 10 minutes. Frank & Alberts restaurant was very tasty and great service. Grounds are beautiful, there is a putting green you can use for free, pools everywhere, tennis courts, beautiful fountains. It is a busy resort, conferences, meetings, weddings and more. The Biltmore puts on high class events to regular business meetings. It is very large, so it is never crowded. It has alot of history, and the buildings and architectural features are amazing. A must see.

Reviews.Title: “Would return for dinner and spa, probably not to stay”
Reviews.Author: ellis38103
Reviews.Content: This property is gorgeous, well manicured and historic. Architecture and design on grounds is very unique and special. Rooms need to be redone, although older structure may limit what they can do- my room was large, but very dark. Pool, spa, tennis courts, gym all very nice and well designed. Poolside service a little slow... Guess you shouldn't be in a hurry to leave 75 degrees and sunny by a gorgeous pool. Otherwise staff very attentive. Fish Tacos at Frank & Alberts top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great renovations at the Arizona Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: ldugon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my annual visit to the Arizona Biltmore (annual conference for work). The first night I was in a room in the main building which was quite large and beautiful but the echoes from outside made it nearly unbearable to sleep before midnight or after 4 am when they were moving furniture around outside. So they moved me to the Ocatilla Wing. Great renovations to those rooms. The bathrooms in particular were very nice. The greatest improvement at the hotel was the wifi available in the rooms! It is always a beautiful place to stay with a great gym and spa. Just avoid getting a room on the 4th floor of the main building if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: jscottjoplin
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend a night at the Arizona Biltmore because we were going to a charity gala there. The public areas are worth the visit - - really beautiful. Check in was great; the room was large and quiet; room service was punctual; and the bed was great. Only complaint is that for the rates that the hotel charges, we were surprised that there was not any turn down service. Also, a resort fee is added to your bill even if you do not use any of the hotel facilities. A newspaper was supposed to be included in the resort fee, but we never received one. Nonetheless, we would stay at the Biltmore again. However, next time I would call for turn down service before we go out for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: daddio1960
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days in February. Tha place is simply spectacular. My visit did not start so well as my reservation for a king bed was not met. Because of this I was upgraded to a larger room with two queen beds. The following day the hotel called to tell me a king bed was available but we were already settled and satisfied. A fruit and wine basket was sent to my room from the hotel to appea any hard feelings. The grounds and location are stunning. Flowers every where, Camelback Mountain is always in view and nothing ever seemed to be out of place. I don't think I walked past any staff or employee of any type that did not offer a smile and warm greeting. That is unusual in my travels I only ate in one restaurant and the food there was good. Due to schedule, I never ate in any of the other facilities This place is very expensive but we felt that we got what we paid for in terms of service, staff and accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “A Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: whitleybh
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore is simply a large convention hotel. It is not a luxury hotel. The staff is indeferent and it's very obvious they are just moving you a long their conf tion pipeline. The physical building is impressive and the grounds are nice but it simply does not make up for the ground list otherwise. The Biltmore is mediocrity at its best. For a real luxury experience in Pheonix, try the Four Seasons or Sanctury.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Marissa88
Reviews.Content: We hosted our Winter Convention at this property in February. The grounds were beautiful. Everything was clean, the staff was very nice and accomodating. There was one main pool (with a water slide) and several smaller pools through out the property. There is a free shuttle that runs about every hour and takes you to the little Biltmore strip mall. There are several restaurants as well as shops. Macy's and Sak's were also in the strip mall. The two restaurants on property were nice. The property itself is a bit pricey but I would reccomend this Hotel to any family traveling in the Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, great resort”
Reviews.Author: okatty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biltmore for a conference and it was really fantastic. I have to say if I had been paying the rates we paid with my own money I might have thought it was pretty pricey but all in all it was a very cool place. It was our second time there in the past 10 years and it is worth multiple visits. Fantastic grounds, pool, spa, golf course, tennis. Great areas for walks, bike rides, runs, etc. Location was good and overall a nice place. Try to stay outside the Inn part out on the grounds. Rooms were really just average but if you can get a patio to sit on you will be fine! Too nice to be inside anyway (at least in the winter months).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort grounds with comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bloomsbury2001k
Reviews.Content: A comfortable stay in a King room facing the pool, we enjoyed the quiet environment in this resort-like setting. The bathroom was nicely designed with granite countertops, marble floors -- very clean throughout. Food service was good, and prompt. We were there Christmastime, and Christmas eve they served tasty hot cocoa and Christmas cookies in the lobby, which was a wonderful. We did have to open the window to cool off the room, as the thermostat did not seem to go cooler than 70 degrees. Also, the television would revert back to the "welcome" channel every 15 minutes. I asked the front desk for someone to repair this, but no one ever came during our 4 night stay. So engineering service was poor, if at all present. Or they never got the message from the front desk. The concierge admitted that there was nothing to see in Phoenix, and I would have to agree. But my relatives live here, so oh well. Overall, a nice stay, and I'd come back.

Reviews.Title: “Taste of History”
Reviews.Author: wstphl
Reviews.Content: Recently spent 8 lovely days at the Biltmore. A little bit of business,and a lot of pleasure. The staff was very professional and usually invisible. The room ( complimentary upgrade to a suite ) was perfect for an almost century old hotel. I think it could have used more furnishing, but perhaps it doubled as a hospitality suite. And the view, as you can see, was wonderful. We spent 2 days at the spa, and while expensive, was very fulfilling. We did golf at the old course and while very enjoyable, it lacked the distinction of some of the newer courses. The dining was well above average, as were the prices. But for convenience and quality it can't be beat. Family came in to enjoy the pool and the location is very central to all of Phx. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay and to top it off we went and visited Taliesin West and learned even more about FLW.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular grounds”
Reviews.Author: mv92691
Reviews.Content: Poolside service - superb. Frank &Alberts restaurant - delicious. Rooms - well appointed. Comfy beds, good bath products. Loved the spa and the ladies locker room - well stocked I just wish they had a shuttle service or better negotiated rates to the main shopping area nearby.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, RUDE BELL CAPTAIN”
Reviews.Author: Heatherc1125
Reviews.Content: I was on visit recently to the Arizona Biltmore for buisness..overall great hotel, great location, and great service! Only one negative thing was dealing with one of the bell captains(Chris). I came down to the bellstand for some help and was dealing with Chris. The way he talk to me was very discourteous and demenor was very unfriendly. I Just don't understand how a Waldorf-Astoria property has a employee that acts like this, very unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Easter? Please know this...”
Reviews.Author: BCparent
Reviews.Content: I delayed by close to a year, my review of the Arizona Biltmore, because my observations are seriously based on the Easter week/weekend. I am going to tell you what the hotel did NOT tell me, that they should have: An enormous group books almost the entire property for a "Passover VIP" event (apparently many many years running). The issue for any innocent individual family is the following: 100% of the cabanas are booked by this group. So, during your entire stya, even if you wanted to spring the $200 plus (we did) for a cabana, it is not an option; the stunning main grounds on the interior of the property are set up for this group. So, if you want to have a drink, you won't be overlooking the gardens and walkways, you will be overlooking a group that is probably close to 800 people. The group I had no issue with: families enjoying their time as a group. But the "full and fair" use of the Biltmore I have a huge issue with. We didn't get to use many many of the amenities because of such a large group. A small (honestly maybe 10-15 families) group of us just sat shell-shocked by the pool because the resort was clearly scrambling to deal with their biggest paying customer of the weekend. Fair enough. But when we made the reservation, I can't imagine why they wouldn't have said "Full disclosure...we have an enormous group here Easter weekend every year. No cabanas will be available during your stay, and most of the chairs by the main pool will be reserved (in advance) by this group. The tiny upside: this group ate all of their meals in the various banquet facilites, so all the restaurants (except for by the pool) were very serene. We probably won't return (and certainly not at Easter). Just a friendly heads-up that you won't get from the resort itself.

Reviews.Title: “A Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: ciampetti
Reviews.Content: Truly an amazing resort. Every nook and cranny is a work of art. The architecture is amazing and while it may be daunting at first since it is heavy on the concrete, even non-fans of Frank Lloyd Wright can appreciate it. The main pool is amazing, and the lights and fire at night create quite an ambiance. Will 100% go back and will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Launch pad”
Reviews.Author: drneideffer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night - just before we left for a three-week trip to Greece. Nice place to stay just before a long flight. Lovely hotel and grounds. Helpful staff and decent restaurants and bar. Drinks a bit pricey, but it goes with the territory I suppose. Would gladly stay here again. Its a one time must hotel if you've never stayed here before. A Phoenix icon, and if you dig Frank Wright's architecture, you'll like it even more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: indydiver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 3 nights at the Arizona Biltomore where he was attending a conference. Our room was spacious and newly renovated. We had a king-sized bed, large TV and 2 sinks in the bathroom. We had a patio that overlooked one of the pools. The linens were lovely and the bed was comfortable, although a bit too soft for my liking. There was a clock radio that was also an iPod docking station which was nice. The room had a typical mini bar with overpriced items, but that was to be expected. Instead of a coffee maker there was a hot pot and French press. The food and service were good. Drinks were overpriced we thought. There were many places where groups could sit and chat, inside and out. A few areas had large gas fire pits which were nice during the cool evenings. This facility felt more like a business conference center than a resort hotel. There were two or three conferences going on most of the guests seemed to be involved in one of those. The pools were fairly deserted, I never saw anyone playing tennis and there were very few children. I rented a bike for an hour one day and rode along the canal. All I saw were the backs of some very uninteresting houses. There didn't seem to be any interesting places nearby to ride to. My husband loves this place -- probably because he usually has meetings in office buldings or boring conference centers. For him it was a real treat to spend three days in such a lovely setting. I think everyone in his group felt the same way because they all decided to hold their conference there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property and well maintained.”
Reviews.Author: sftraveling1
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel; it’s like a piece of art. The grounds are well maintained, the rooms are spacious and there’s plenty to see and do. There’s golf, spa treatments, tennis, hiking, you name it they have it. I had a car service take me to the hotel, Phoenix is hard to get used to their surface streets. There’s an Enterprise rent a car on the property which is way more convenient than trying to get to and from the airport. Ok the only thing that was strange to me is there’s no coffee maker in the room. I mean they thought of everything here except coffee. I found out this morning that, they could bring me a coffee maker, there’s a café and free coffee at the spa. It would have been really nice to know this say 8 hours ago! Otherwise this or the Phoenician and maybe the JW Marriott are the only places to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Comments about recent stay”
Reviews.Author: bettyIllinois
Reviews.Content: My husband attended a conference at the Arizona Biltmore and ask that I share his experience. This is an incredibly beautiful hotel what is well maintained and with a very friendly staff. It apprears to be seriously understaffed. The wait line for Frank & Albert's Restaurant for an 8 am. breakfast was much too long with a number of empty tables. A dinner at your top end restaurant took 3 hours on Sunday evening. The wait was longer than normal at your main bar. On Monday night, sitting on your patio we had a prostitute and her pimp brazenly sit down at our table and get into awkward and inappropriate conversations. On Monday the maid left two wet rags sitting on the bed side stand. One of the toilets in the men's room overflowed during the conference causing a constant line to get into the rest rooms during breaks. Finally, I was disappointed that we did not have wi-fi in the conference center on Sunday and learned from other participants that they were wanting $40,000 to turn it on. While, it is a wonderful resort, I was seriously disappointed in the level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: ChefJoshua
Reviews.Content: No water first night...construction/renovation in room adjacent to mine next day. This hotel reminds me of Undercover Boss, but in this episode the employees try their hardest, and managment can't get out of their way. The construction next to me was an all-day buzz so - management feigned not being aware of the (ongoing) construction project. Excellent restaurants, excellent front line staff, but management leaving magazines in every room in which Conrad Hilton declares that the Biltmore is a five-star experience do not make it a five-star experience. Would not stay here again, but would dine here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in all phases”
Reviews.Author: namedeplume
Reviews.Content: Three day stay as part of a business trip. Stay was five start in all respects. Particularly memorable was reception outdoors. Food was fantastic - service to match.

Reviews.Title: “Great Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Bezaire
Reviews.Content: What a magical place of history, beauty and comfort, Great location to get around. Golf walking distance, Every President since 1932 has stayed here. Marilyn Monroe enjoyed this place too. Gardens and grounds in wonderful shape. Orange trees, grapefruit trees, lemon trees, putting area, pools, spa, exercise room, great restaurants, out door fire pits, hot tubs, Too beautiful to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated.”
Reviews.Author: Bixamus
Reviews.Content: I checked in at 5pm, and my room didn't have water until 9pm. The people at the front desk were pleasant but didn't offer another room or any concessions. I alerted them to this right after I checked in, and they claimed they were working on it. WILL NOT stay here again. The window in the bathroom also has some weird crusty grime on it... The restaurant is great. But even without the water issues, not worth $250/night (e.g., bed sags badly). Disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best there is”
Reviews.Author: ptolemy8
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels in the world, and it shows. Beautiful grounds, wonderful rooms, excellent food and staff. We stayed several days while on business in Phoenix and it became very hard to want to leave the hotel grounds. The staff is exactly what you want: always available, never intrusive. The food at Wright's is outstanding. In a word of deteriorating service and dull food, it is a true delight. The Frank Lloyd Wright connection is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff, nice ambience made my stay a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveller99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Biltmore this week as part of a leadership retreat for work. I found the hotel staff to be the best part of the stay - in every interaction, they were attentive, curteous and genuinely seemed to care that my need was addressed. The hotel itself is pretty cool too - lots of history (president's stay there, though apparently Obama has not yet, AND he was in AZ this past week - I feared a lock down.. thank goodness he took a pass). Parts of the hotel were designed by Frank Lloyd Wright and that gives the hotel a very unique feel. My room was large, bedding was "Westin-esque" (Excellent) and all amenities were there. I most enjoyed the atmosphere on the patio, sitting by the fire pit in the evening with my team mates meeting people from all over the world. Great stay, thanks Biltmore!

Reviews.Title: “typical resort hotel, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: cantravnut
Reviews.Content: I was booked here for a conference and was quite excited about the Frank Lloyd Wright architecture and history. There are old photos all around the hotel and the lobby is interesting, but overall it was a disappointment. I don't think the modern iteration with its 8 pools and condos all over the place likely matches Frank's vision. My room had a vaguely "mission" decor but the furniture was not even real wood and the veneer was chipping off - quite a disgrace given that this style is all about function, honest materials, etc. My room was absolutely tiny with a small window, a dirty skylight and worn carpet. I had to have the service people in to repair the broken safe and the heat that didn't work (service was very responsive however, and problems were fixed promptly). It's a sprawling resort with gym, spa, tennis, golf, 2 restaurants, etc, but everything is pay as you go, and it is not close to anything, so once you are here, you are trapped and forced to pay outrageous prices (they have a small cafe with starbucks coffee at more than twice starbucks prices!). The restaurants had average decor, average food and slow service. If you have a rental car and are here mainly for the golf, it may be OK, but otherwise I'd skip it. However, I did have an amazing massage in the spa - ask for Brad, he was great!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, expansive property with much history”
Reviews.Author: pd2think
Reviews.Content: The room we were given upon arrival was a far cry from the upgrade, King room that we expected. The attendant at the desk initially indicated that there was nothing he could do to help us. With a bit of clear encouragement, he was able to find a beautiful room that met our needs. We sampled most everything on the room service menu -- to our delight :) needless to say, there are also a plethora of restaurants on property or nearby. All in all, an elegant property with many attributes!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay In The Off Season”
Reviews.Author: kalster65
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in the beginning of August - their hot (and off) season. I was concerned about the heat, but I actually enjoyed the dryness. The buildings are spread out and in the art deco style, which is very pleasing to look at. My room was huge and nicely appointed. However, my favorite thing about this place was the main pool. It's huge and beautifully landscaped, so I was able to be in the water and shaded at the same time. It's surrounded with cabanas and this gives it a definite upmarket feel. I spent a few lazy afternoons sitting in the water at the swim up bar, which included a chef doing a demo/taste test of different salsas. For a refreshing cool-off they have a slide. Check out the website. I cannot wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Biltmore is a Gem”
Reviews.Author: Charlestonfamily
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Arizona Biltmore in late October of 2011. The weather was incredible. I attended a convention and it was very nice. The first 2 nights I stayed in Cottage L. It was very quaint and I liked it but it was somewhat dated and musty. It was very convenient to the convention center. The hotel manager was more than helpful and moved us to an upgraded room for the last 2 nights of our stay - a Catalina Pool Villa. It was a huge room and we enjoyed it immensely. All in all we loved the Biltmore. The Spa and pools were amazing. We enjoyed the restaurants too. Our day trip to Sedona was great and the concierge was also very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but otherwise average”
Reviews.Author: Mark A
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for the Biltmore, but was disappointed. The grounds and the room (Ocatilla bldg) were both very nice. However, I could not get a good night's rest while there because the air return vent made a strange crackling noise. Also, the staff seemed almost too busy to provide excellent customer service. BEWARE THE ROOM SNACKS. They are not free, although they appear to be. I had to pay $10 for a tiny container of dried fruit. Pathetic! For a hotel this nice, SOMEthing should be included--a bottled water, a small snack or chocolate, etc. Not at the Biltmore!

Reviews.Title: “Golf Villa at Arizona Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: SedonaMeri
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to one of the golf villas after booking a regular room at the Arizona Biltmore Hotel in Phoenix. The villa was a good distance from the hotel's main building, but worth the walk (or they could shuttle you.) A ground floor unit, this spacious villa had a dining area, full kitchen, living room and the master suite had a walk-in closet with a huge bathroom. Outside, semi-private areas in front of the living room and master suite were well-landscaped and the winter sun felt wonderful! The only drawback was the very tired carpeting that needs to be replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Stop Over”
Reviews.Author: kels1948
Reviews.Content: We drove over to Phoenix from Rancho Mirage, Calif. and planned on staying for just 2 nights but ended up staying 4 nights. We were celebrating a 65th birthday & so had booked a "special room", the Presidential Suite, which was spacious & very comfortable. The hotel is absolutely delightful & the grounds are gorgeous & the staff were all very helpful & pleasant. We ate at Wright's 2 nights because it was so good! We enjoyed our stay there & hope to return again, but it will probably be to a more "modest" room! Now that we're 65 & retired, we will live on a fixed income. :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Warm and friendly”
Reviews.Author: vettefinderjim
Reviews.Content: I attended the motor-sport movie "THE QUEST" on Sunday January 15, 2012. It is a documentary 84 minute movie on the discovery and restoration of the 1960 model # 3 Corvette Briggs Cunningham LeMans Race car, and its return to LeMans 50 years later in 2010. We spent Saturday and Sunday evening at the Resort and found the complete experience very positive and professional. Many race car driver celebrities were present and a little 25 race car concour preceded the movie in the morning. The movie was shown in the Grand Ballroom, and was like an Oscar presentation on a large screen with perfect sound. The reception after with great food, service and drinks provided the 400 guests with a very positive feeling. The 82 year old facility is old history and worth a visit on its own. Food and service at the Fred and Albert were very good as well, which often are lacking at these types of hotels. The room , which was ADA Handicap accessible was very comfortable and clean and had a 32 inch flat screen TV and well stocked fridge. The shower facility was wheel chair accessible and worked perfect. I did bring my shower chair which was needed, however the hotel more than likely had one if I had asked. All in all, a great way to start AUCTION WEEK in Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “New Year to remember!”
Reviews.Author: joanne W
Reviews.Content: We had only booked for two nights but decided to stay two extra nights because we were enjoying the experience so much.The hotel and grounds are beautiful,we had a bungalow near the mini golf course ,it was quiet and very comfortable and surprisingly spacious .The all inclusive with breakfast lunch and dinner is amazing value and dinner in Wrights restaurant is highly recommended,it was superb! My 10 year old son really enjoyed all the amenities,we biked,swam,played chess,golfed and walked the grounds,we were all sad to leave. We shall definitely return one day!

Reviews.Title: “Good staff and beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: DACWDC
Reviews.Content: The staff I met were certainly pleasant enough. Housekeeping did a fine job as well. The resort grounds are very well maintained. Plenty of flowers, neat and tidy gardens, and well groomed lawns to keep your eyes happy. With respect to the buildings, I don't think the website does justice to how nice the interior is and the buildings exteriors certainly don't outshine the landscaping. My room was in the Ocatilla (or something like that) building which was just renovated according to the front desk. The room didn't leave anything to be desired. Nice touch - a French press for your morning coffee. Big bathroom - well provisioned. If you ask the front desk for directions to the running path(s), be specific about what you're looking for. i was about to hit the trail that went 'around' the property but thought to ask how far that is before departing - 24 miles.- yikes. I am glad I asked. I guess I look more fit than I thought. Unfortunately I didn't get to try the restaurant on the property but my associates who did said it was very good. Cab to and from airport was about $30. Would I go back to this place? Sure. I'd also look around the area at other resorts just to see how they stack up. I hear there are some really sweet resorts in Scotsdale. Bed was comfortable and AC allowed the fan to be adjusted to a loud enough setting to cover any hallway or neighbor noises.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious, architecturally interesting”
Reviews.Author: CHCNV
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay in the Ocatilla wing (a separate area) of the AZ Biltmore. The room was a nice size, and the amenities (breakfast area, lounge open all day with coffee & drinks, wine available in early evening) were worth the extra cost. We were in and out all day, so didn't interact much with staff, but whenever we had questions or needed assistance, our requests were met promptly. The hotel is huge ("resort" is not a misnomer) and somewhat removed (Phoenix is spread out anyway); you will probably need a rental car.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: M A
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Ocatilla in the Biltmore over Christmas. It was fantastic. We loved having the executive lounge to hang out in. The free breakfast, cocktails, and dessert were all great and we saved a ton of money as a result. We also had no need for a suite because all of the family could just hang out in the lounge. The bonus services are worthwhile -- I got the free chair massage in the lounge; my brother and dad had their shoes shined for free and it took just an hour. The pork chili at Frank & Alberts was super tasty and very memorable. The fitness center, spa, salon, and fitness classes were a blast and reasonably priced. There are only two negatives: 1. The Ocatilla part of the hotel does not accept pets. 2. The reservation system was a HORRIBLE NIGHTMARE. We were charged twice for our rooms, double and triple booked, etc., despite having tried to fix the problem -- and being told it was fixed -- numerous times. Ultimately, we were able to figure the mess out and the hotel comped one night's stay and shipped our presents home for free. Room and service wise, it's no Four Seasons, but you're not paying Four Seasons prices, either. We will return. It's a beautiful hotel. It's truly one of a kind.

Reviews.Title: “Past meets present in delightful ways”
Reviews.Author: caroljoss
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were fortunate to spend holiday week here. The look and feel of this resort is unique. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We could easily access downtown Phoenix and Scottsdale locations and there was a shuttle to the shops and restaurants nearby on the hour. Try to take the history tour if possible. Lots of families and football fans here at this time. We did not make reservations ahead for Christmas dining and had very limited options. Glad we had the opportunity to stay in this lovely setting.

Reviews.Title: “New Years at the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: BobBarb
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel.... we were busy the entire stay so we didn't use the facilities much. Room was upgraded to a cottage but it was next to the service area,very noisy. Called housekeeping for a clogged toilet early in the morning and it wasn't fixed until almost noon..Non-smoking room smelled of smoke. We've stayed here before and will again just not in the cottages. Loved the hoilday decor..

Reviews.Title: “Good but definitely not great”
Reviews.Author: Luke58
Reviews.Content: Highlights: generally good rooms, service, restaurants. Lowlights: lack of attention to detail, has some of the feel of a chain hotel, overall experience definitely not stellar. This is a fairly detailed review of our recent stay (12/26-30) at the Biltmore. My wife and I have stayed at several high-end hotels belonging to various "groups", and the Biltmore unfortunately rates lower than most in this category. We're not picky or pretentious, but we do value attentive, outgoing service and quality, so this review should be considered from that perspective. 1) Ocatilla Room We stayed in the Ocatilla wing of the hotel, on the first floor. What was good: - Spacious room. - Very comfortable king-size bed. - Nice decor. - Deep soaking tub with faucets placed to the side, which allows two people to soak together. The supply of a candle was a nice touch. What wasn't so good: - The bathroom should be called "The Door Puzzle". The main door, shower door and toilet closet door all open onto each other. It's actually possible to inadvertently "lock" someone in the toilet closet by leaving the bathroom door open at some angles. - The bathroom does not have a lit make-up mirror; this is almost inexcusable for a high-end hotel. - The room door does not close flush against the door frame such that whenever any of the other rooms' doors open or close, it rattles back and forth against the frame and this can wake you up. - The safe is *very* tiny. 2) Ocatilla Lounge - The lounge is too small for such a large wing with so many rooms / guests. The food display area is too small and is easily overcrowded. The serving dishes are also too small and this requires the waitstaff to constantly go back and forth to the kitchen to refill them. - The lounge serves continental breakfast until 9:30 on weekdays and 10 on weekends / holidays. Does anyone *really* get up that early when on holiday - or any day when on vacation? This isn't a business hotel after all, and it's a stretch to call it a resort with hours like that. 3) Pools - The pool water is too cold. Maybe the temperature is OK for mid-summer, but certainly not December. We tried going into both the Ocatilla and main pools, and they were simply too cold. We saw several people go in and come out rapidly. C'mon, this is a Waldorf-Astoria property, and the water is colder than at some economy hotels! - There was a good quantity of chairs and towels. 4) Restaurants - Frank and Albert's had both good service and food. The food was fresh and really delicious. Several dishes were remarkably good. - Wright's, the premier restaurant, had very good food, but the service was rather disorganized. Our amuse-bouche were not delivered before the main dishes, and the waitstaff did not seem to understand their respective roles (e.g., we were asked by both the waiter and the busboy if we wanted coffee). 5) Gym - There was plenty of exercise equipment and all of it was in good condition. - Towels and water are supplied. 6) Grounds - The grounds are well maintained and all trees/bushes/plants are nicely arranged. 7) Staff This is maybe the most important aspect of a hotel/resort experience so this is where we are the most critical or appreciative. - We found the administrative / clerical staff to be somewhat aloof and unwelcoming. None were warm or engaging. - The valet, bellhop and restaurant staff were good. All were helpful and attentive. - A few of them stand out: - When we arrived late to the Ocatilla lounge on our first morning, the desk staff simply told us that breakfast was over. Diego, one of the waitstaff overheard the conversation: he approached us afterwards and thoughtfully offered to go to the kitchen and collect some remaining pastries and fruits for us. - We decided to take a walk to a restaurant a couple of miles away, and one of the bellhops at the front entrance described a shortcut to us, and when we started to walk away Spencer asked if we would like some water bottles to take along, which we gratefully accepted. It was a small gesture, but the thoughtfulness one expects from good staff. My wife wondered if this was because the latter staff understand the relationship between their attitude and tips ;-) Lastly, while we understand that housekeeping staff are not generally the best paid, only one of the five we encountered could speak any English. This made for at least one challenging situation when we were trying to explain to one of the housekeepers that she should come back to the room in 20 minutes. Please note that this is not a racially or nationality motivated comment - rather, it's simply an observation that Hilton should ensure at least basic English speaking skills for all of its staff (or provide training). 8) In Summary - Room: 4/5 - Food: 5/5 - Facilities/Grounds: 4/5 - Service: 4/5 9) Final Verdict We've stayed twice before at The Phoenician and this was our first stay at the Biltmore. Our verdict is that The Phoenician it's definitely a notch above the Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: BrigidC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 day stay at the Arizona Biltmore. Overall the standards were lower than what we expected for a hotel of this class and reputation.The suite we booked was outdated with a lengthy and dark outdoor walk back to the hotel and parking lot. Our patio was small with a 5 feet wall around shielding a view of the maintenance facilities. All in all very disappointing accommodation but the staff were all extremely friendly and the grounds were beautifully maintained and landscaped.

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Wallytheplumber30
Reviews.Content: This is a return to he past updated all modern amenities. Service is impeccable and the staff is beyond expectations. What a refreshing pleasure to enjoy such luxury and a level of friendly service unmatched in today's service industries. The buildings and beautiful grounds are manicured, housekeeping services are excellent. Parking is a real low point and the resort is spread over a large expanse that will require lots of walking. The architecture is maintained and stays true to Frank Lloyd Wright's concepts. There are some trade offs and all of the fines do come at a price, maybe even an overprice, but a balance is achievable for the good traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to love the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: ResortMeg
Reviews.Content: My sister and I traveled to the Arizona Biltmore for a 4 day weekend in October to celebrate my birthday (and it was the closest resort to the Jimmy Buffett concert! :) We had both always wanted to visit the historic resort and we were blown away!! From the moment we pulled up we felt like we were treated like royalty, everyone from the valet to the front desk to room service, the spa, the pool staff were just awesome! We were wary after a less than fabulous trip to another Waldorf resort in Key West this summer but the Biltmore met and exceeded all of our expectations. Upon arrival the front desk personel was superb, he told us all about the property and even upgraded us when we explained it was our first visit and we were celebrating my birthday. We had a beautiful room with balcony, huge bathroom with tub and shower and our favorite part--a makeup table and vanity! The room was clean, beautiful and fit in perfect with the Arizona surroundings. My sister had also ordered a gift basket from the resort to be in the room with champagne on ice and everything was perfect as she ordered! We headed straight to the pool and spent almost our first entire day there--the pool staff were very courteous, checked on us for food and drinks and we loved the water slide :) The food at the pool was absolutely superb! We ate on property our entire stay and love everything from happy hour bites to late night room service (after the concert!), and our formal dinner. The food was all superb and the service could not be beat! Our entire stay in Arizona was wonderful and it was all because of the Biltmore. The property itself was gorgeous and we loved exploring. On our last night we noticed the property had 4 or 5 weddings/events going on but being in the restaurant we had no idea and were never disturbed by noise/invitees. I can't count the amount of times we said to each other "wow, this place is awesome." We very much enjoyed the spa,the only drawback being the small/sparse waiting area, but the staff and treatments were superb. At night, our favorite was having drinks on the patio with the bonfire pits. We met some interesting people and the bartender did a superb job on all of the specialty drinks. Overall, an amazing experience--great room, food, pool, spa, beautiful surroundings and deserving of the Waldorf name. We went to Arizona from across the country on a whim to see a concert but ended up anxious to pack our bags for a trip back to the Biltmore. If you are debating if its worth the time and money the answer is yes, yes, yes! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Friend Couples Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Shin-Jeff
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this distinct and special resort, but there's some room for improvement, specifically: - No free morning coffee, in fact a small coffee in a paper cup cost $4.10 - horrible self parking options (e.g. long walk with bags) - no ice near hotel room (guests must call room service and wait long for delivery) - fitness room too small/ crowded - no ability to make tennis reservations prior to arriving at resort - lots of reserved signs on poolside lounge chairs that never got used (at least 20%) - significant daily resort fee Even with the above issues, it's stll a really nice resort: - buildings, grounds, fountains and artwork are top notch - service was professional, efficient and friendly - food at Frank & Albert's was very good - loved sitting by firepit and fountain - free 18 hole putting course was fun and good way to enjoy grounds - nice tennis courts - comfy beds - lots of pools

Reviews.Title: “kind and peaceful environment”
Reviews.Author: private33
Reviews.Content: Amazing experience. 6 stars, ******, too indescribable with words. They provided us and all their guests with an environment where all our needs are met with out seeing or hearing very much from employees and made us feel welcome. Being able to be friendly, naturally so it seemed. Kimberly at the Ocatilla Club ( sooo worth the extra few $ ) made all of our reservations, tee times, spa appointments... and gave us pointers and reminders to make our stay perfect. All a few days before we arrived and mostly on line from the two of us. We met so many nice people every where we went at this resort. It is arranged for maximum privacy and pleasure for all guests. We are planning on coming back ASAP! Really. If you like to travel and appreciate the finer things in life with out all the stuff that sometimes gets in the way this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of missed potential”
Reviews.Author: RoyGowler
Reviews.Content: I went with my daughter on a late November vacation and we stayed our first three nights here. Overall the Biltmore is quite wonderful, in terms of the lobby area, the grounds, the buildings, available facilities and its unique layout and character. Unfortunately, there were a lot of fine details that just didn't seem to work the way you would expect when you stay at a place with the Waldorf brand behind it. On the plus side, when I discussed these disappointments with the manager, he was very helpful and did his best to make things right, without hesitation. So, kudos to him. They just need a little fine tuning to make it the place that it either should be or once was. From a pure value perspective, the room rate was outstanding but it was likely due to the time of year. Would I stay there again? Very likely.

Reviews.Title: “very close to perfect”
Reviews.Author: joano170
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a four day weekend a few weeks ago in December hoping for a change from New York winter weather. The buildings and grounds of the hotel are very interesting and and we really enjoyed the beautiful lobby, which had a contest and displays of Frank Lloyd Wright architecture made out of edible materials--cakes, candies, icing etc. models of the Guggenheim museum, Falling Water, and some other examples of FLW designs. The place was decorated attractively for Christmas, and felt very festive. Our room was lovely, clean and large, but located in a distant building which required walking over uncovered walkways, which would have been pleasant in good weather--but unfortunately we had rain and a temperature in the low 50's. To add to our unique discomfort, there were two very steep ramps on the way to our room from the main building, and since my husband was in a wheelchair, which I was pushing, the inclines and the sharp turn at the base of one of the ramps were vary difficult to negotiate. Service was professional and attentive. Overall, it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “refined elegance and outstanding personalized service for vegans”
Reviews.Author: amb333
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the hotel after an exasperating series of delays with our flight. Our sons, 6 and 13 were tired and crabby. At 2am, room service was the only option. As vegans, room service can be quite a challenge but not at this hotel. Our boys are not vegan and they had a marvelous thin crust cheese pizza- the crust was delightfully crispy and my boys were happy with a sufficiently gooey cheese that was not tired and dried out as room service can be. For my husband and I, we revised the chicken burrito into an incredible black bean burrito with fresh salsa, guacamole, and a spicy black bean sauce. All of us enjoyed mixed green salad with tomatoes dressed with a balsamic vinaigrette. The sourdough bread rolls were warm and crusty on the outside, soft on the inside. For dessert, we had a marvelous fresh platter of assorted fruits- pineapple, watermelon, cantaloupe, blueberries and blackberries. Prices for these fresh and healthy alternatives were very reasonable. the service did not stop there. The next evening for dinner, my son and husband had developed a cold with fever and chills and simply did not wish to leave the room. Thinking to surprise them with something enticing when they woke up, I searched the casual restaurant menu of Frank and Albert's for some vegan faire but was disappointed that there were very few alternatives. When trying to fashion existing faire into a corresponding vegan meal with the hostess, she volunteered that it would be better for me to speak with Chef Jason since he would simply make whatever we wanted..and make he did. First he queried our likes and dislikes pretty extensively and then asked if there were any special things we wanted to eat. He prepared a hearty black bean soup garnished with pickled carrots, onions and mild peppers, stuffed red peppers served with a delicious roasted red pepper coulis and a carpaccio of portabello mushrooms served with with a julienne of mixed vegetables, a mixed salad with fresh seasoned artichoke, two types of olives, and heirloom tomato dressed with a white balsamic vinaigrette. He meticulously packed it up to go including extra roasted red pepper sauce, extra stuffing, extra pickled garnish, and the vinaigrette and placed the soup in a thermos to keep it warm. He did not stop there. When I told him my 6 year old wanted bacon and broccoli, he prepared one of his favorite dishes- thinly cut french fries tossed with pancetta and two other types of diced bacon held together by melted cheddar cheese. And in case my son did not like it, he added a few strips of bacon on the side for him. Much to my son's delight, the broccoli was fresh and perfectly cooked- not mushy or crunchy and he loved the french fries concoction! Chef Jason gave me his card and told me that he would be pleased to meet our food needs at any time. He also introduced me to another chef who could also be contacted in the event that he was not available. It really was an amazing and kind service that is quite lacking in this automated world. The amount of care that was offered was quite unlike what we have experienced before- my husband and I are million mile travelers and we have seen our share of cursory service, but not here. Kudos to the Biltmore!! We shall certainly return to this elegant hotel for the impeccable service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy S
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nites. Wish we'd had more time there. I accompanied my husband to his architectural conference because after having seen this historic masterpiece, while visiting for lunch several years earlier, I knew I had to go back & spend more time at that gorgeous property. Both my husband & I enjoyed our large, nicely appointed room in the Valley View building. The staff were very friendly & helpful. A guided tour of the property provided interesting historic references & was well worth taking. It's only offered 2 days a week so plan accordingly. We ate at all of the onsite venues & were never disappointed. The Cafe has some of the best muffins I've ever eaten. Frank & Albert's was perfect for lunch (inside or on the patio) or for tapas & drinks. The fire pit lounge areas were perfect for enjoying a coffee & a good book, conversation with friends or for just being lulled by the sounds of the splashing, central court's fountain. Wright's Restaurant was an amazing dining experience with perfect cuisine & service. Along with the tasty French bread offered before dinner, they also served a chewy, cherry & chocolate bread that could be addictive. Just leave room for the exquisite soups, salads, entrees & desserts. The complimentary, cotton candy at the end of the meal reminded me of childhood carnivals but even better since that night it was banana flavored. The beautiful grounds with multiple swimming pools, fountains & flower rich gardens were mesmerizing & relaxing. The evocative architecture of this property, once only visited by the rich & famous, shows how imaginative design can create a timeless treasure, ultimately enjoyed & appreciated by all. Take a camera.

Reviews.Title: “Great architecture, but...”
Reviews.Author: RXCONSULTANT
Reviews.Content: The lobby area of this resort is very, very cool if you like Frank Lloyd Wright architecture. (If you are not a fan, do not stay at this hotel.) A lot of other rooms and condo-like suites have been added over the years, so if you want to stay in an "authentic" Frank Lloyd Wright room be sure to tell them when you reserve. Be cautious about the room rate. I thought it was $235. but by the time they added resort fees, maid fee, bell boy fee, taxes the room rate jumped almost $100. Not a bargain. You are also outside Phoenix, and trapped eating at the resort restaurants unless you get a rental car. All of this results in a pleasant, but expensive stay. Service was generally very good, but they struggled with room service breakfast times. Next time I'd probably opt for the 4 Seasons, and pay a little more for real luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: amarch
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Arizona Biltmore, I have always wanted to stay there. It did not dissappoint me. Check in was great and we had a room in the Paradise Villa on the 4th floor overlooking the big pool. The room has such old charm you could almost believe you were back in the 1930s. Wanted to go in pool/jacuzzi but was a bit too cold. The grounds are amazing and loved the huge chess/checker game on the grass. Since it was during Christmas Holiday the hotel was decorated so festive. Did not eat at the restaurants, but did have a Biltmore Buck near the firepits. So enjoyed it want to go back in June for my birthday!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Spa Weekend”
Reviews.Author: awesometown
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Ocatilla, which offers a club-like experience -- the rooms were updated and we enjoyed complimentary happy hour with great food and wine outside by the fire. We also liked the smaller pool near our rooms, which was empty besides us. We ordered lunch poolside and enjoyed it under a cabana without extra charge. The grounds and architecture definitely make the place -- there are so many photogenic places, no wonder there are so many weddings there. The restaurants were only okay; we enjoyed taking a car into town to try other places. The spa services were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay in luxury, this is the place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Lineman1196
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate to have the opportunity to stay almost a week here. The hotel is very historical. The grounds are beautiful, and well maintained. I don't even think I had a chance to explore all of it. I especially enjoyed sitting out on the patio, by the fire pit at night enjoying drinks. This is not a place to worry about $$$. Everything is very expensive here. But for a once a life time experience I highly recommend it. Where else can you stay at the same hotel where almost every president has stayed. Very Cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great service”
Reviews.Author: Gatekeeper9939
Reviews.Content: We are mostly interested in the Arizona Biltmore because of the connection with Frank Lloyd Wright and his designs. The building is interesting and the entire experience was exceptional. The grounds and the atmosphere were inspiring.

Reviews.Title: “2 Very Nice Hotel Stays”
Reviews.Author: topgun151
Reviews.Content: Ok here is the lowdown on this property. I stayed here 2 times within the 6 months, both stays were for 5 days. Some of the accommodations are luxurious, and some of them are a bit dated. The first stay, I was in the valley wing on the 2nd floor with a balcony. It was nice, modern, and comfortable. This past stay, I was in the Ocatilla. It was even more modern and luxurious. Some of my colleagues stayed in the villa's which were nice (although a bit of a hike). I would say, stay out of the the Terrace Court wing. That area feels like a motel. The staff are all very friendly and helpful and will say hello to you when you pass them. However, the front desk staff seem a little presumptuous almost like you are bothering them to check in. A colleague of mine also mentioned this unsolicited. If you had to choose between the two restaurants in the lobby, go with "Wrights" The food was absolutely fantastic and cooked to perfection. The complimentary cotton candy at the end of the meal was a fun treat. All in all, this hotel is worth the stay. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I thought”
Reviews.Author: cyberta88
Reviews.Content: The parking was too far from the wing they put us in (Valley Wing). The exit door would not shut and it was cold in Phoenix that weekend. With the door open we could smell wood burning smoke through our hotel door. The people were very loud, until 1am in the morning. They need longer doors, the bright lights from the hall was shining into our room from underneatht the door. The sheets were dirty when we got there! Not a place I will ever stay at again. Needs revamping.

Reviews.Title: “a little getaway”
Reviews.Author: ileen56
Reviews.Content: we had friends in town and we picked the biltmore for the historical aspect-glad we did!we live i phx but this place makes you forget!there is a hotel ambasador that will give you a 11/2 hour tour of the property-i we totally loved it!(we tipped at the end) we had a poolside room so that was fab!rooms a aliitle older but had everthing you could want

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with a great provenance”
Reviews.Author: beentheredonethat56
Reviews.Content: The grounds and the architecture are absolutely gorgeous, esp if you love Art Deco & Frank Lloyd Wright influence (as I do). I was in the Garden wing which had a lovely balcony overlooking the equally lovely gardens below; very close to the main pool area as well. The rooms was a nice size, and although furnished nicely enough, it wasn't necessarily spectacular. Generally, I find hotels of this size too overwhelming for my taste, but I got a special price ($149/night in November) so I'm not complaining. But if you're a boutique hotel kind of person, this would not be for you (I got lost several times at night because it's just too big). Also, was a bit disappointed that the restaurant would not provide room service (although I could and did order ahead of time and went to pick it up). The Cafe was convenient, but overpriced for a cup of coffee & a nothing-special yogurt parfait ($14+). Overall, for the price, it was spectacular

Reviews.Title: “Simply Elegant”
Reviews.Author: travelswithfashion
Reviews.Content: We had high tea in the lobby next to Frank and Alberts. It was so delightful, the tea was scrumptious as well as the food. The best was the service from Kevin. I love when people love what they do and he is a prime example. He took the time to explain the ingredients in everything and what would taste better with certain food. What a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Conference center masquerading as top-line hotel...”
Reviews.Author: stxmld
Reviews.Content: Caveat emptor: my stay was one year ago. I also got sick and was heavily jet lagged from flying in from the other side of the world. With that said, I will attempt to be objective. The Biltmore was clearly once a great hotel - you can see it in the quality of the room fittings, architecture, etc. Presumably many well-off Americans would winter here; play golf & enjoy the clear Arizona air. Unfortunately, the Biltmore seems to be more of a conference center these days - expect to be dodging be-suited, networking types. I checked in for 3 nights. I found my double bed to be completely awful: the mattress was very soft - basically worn out (it was pretty old - I checked the manufacturers label), and I could feel the springs. I ended up pulling the sheets and 'mattress protector' onto the floor in an attempt to sleep. Went to the front desk next morning to complain - but, sorry, hotel was full. I managed to get a better bed in a twin room for my final night. I complained vigorously to the manager on my departure. She was good enough to give me a discount.

Reviews.Title: “Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: Eve K
Reviews.Content: I held a meeting at the Biltmore. The staff were unbelievable. Ask for something within minutes you had it. They were a pleasure to do business with. The meeting rooms were good and mostly large. There is a little walking to do between hotel and meeting rooms, however the weather is nice so it is nice to have sometime outside! The resort is great, many pools and lots of outside places to sit and enjoy the view.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Disaster Ever”
Reviews.Author: Car0line061
Reviews.Content: So I spent the last few days traveling and sleeping on my friend's air mattress. It was horrible and my back was sore and I decided that today my boyfriend and I should splurge and get a really nice room. The Arizona Biltmore looks really nice in the pictures on their website, but it was about the worst disaster I've ever had in any hotel. My boyfriend and I get into our room. It was a nonsmoking room with a balcony that you were allowed to go out and smoke on. We were super tired from driving and went outside to smoke cigarettes and sit down. This psycho lady two floors up from us screams down - and i kid you not- ARE YOU SMOKING? um, yes. we're allowed to. NO YOU'RE NOT. STOP. NOW. um.... no? So I went inside to call the front desk because I was afraid that maybe we misunderstood and it was a fully nonsmoking hotel. They said it was fine to smoke on the balconies. (I found out later that they actually sell cigars in the front lobby - it was a pretty smoker-friendly hotel). So we go back outside to try and finish out cigarettes, and this absolute lunatic of a woman starts screaming at us again: ARE YOU SMOKING AGAIN. yes, we called the front desk and they said we're allowed to. WELL I JUST CALLED THE FRONT DESK TOO AND THEY SAID YOU'RE NOT ALLOWED TO. um, i'm not sure what to tell you. we called and you're allowed to. NO YOU'RE NOT. I HAVE A BABY UP HERE. STOP SMOKING RIGHT NOW. can we please not have a screaming match in this nice hotel? STOP SMOKING! (mind you, i would never smoke next to a baby. but her room was two floors up from us with a sliding door to close off, and there were several other people on their balconies that were also smoking. they were also kind of staring at us). So i called security, and he had to verify with the MOD about the smoking policy, and i'm getting pretty frazzed because we seriously walked in and had this psycho lady start screaming at us, and I think the room cost about $300, and I really just wanted to sit down and relax. Security went and talked to the crazy people, but then we were basically asked if we wanted to just move rooms. While this is going on, the lady upstairs dumps water over her balcony onto our table outside, with my boyfriend's wallet, cigarettes and lighter. We move rooms, and then head to the bar to get a drink. I sit down and start reading some of the material that they gave me when I checked in, and see, to my absolute horror, that we've gotten this letter saying that the water is going to be turned off from 10 pm to 5 am for the two days that we were staying here. Like, if you want to brush your teeth you need to use the $8 Fiji water in the mini bar. ARE YOU KIDDING? No one said anything about there not being water in the room while we were booking the room or checking in, it was in this super secret envelope that they slipped to you with a bunch of other stuff when we checked in. Back to the front desk to try and move to a room that maybe has water so i can have the luxurious amenity of a SHOWER. they moved our room and gave us a discount, but the verdict on the room that we're in now: IT TOTALLY BLOWS. It's a "suite" which is a code word for a gigantic room with very little furniture in it. There's a bed and a couch and chairs, and this HUGE empty space in the middle of the room. The bathtub sucks and the water doesn't get hot enough. The room seems really dated and old, just with new sheets and towels, but the wallpaper is kind of peeling and the fixtures for everything are all really old looking. so my verdict on the whole hotel: the grounds are very beautiful. everything else is lame. stay somewhere else. And to the crazy lady upstairs: DUDE. CALM DOWN. You need to seriously take a valium or something. I hope that tomorrow people are super mean to you all day long and scream at you and make you feel awful.

Reviews.Title: “old, tired and outdated.”
Reviews.Author: travellerjohn04
Reviews.Content: The service in this hotel is terrible. Thy just dont have enough staff and having stayed here before it will be my lasttime. Phoenix and Scottsdale has lots of choices and this certainly shouldnt be one of yours! Everything is just done poorly. The service at the bell stand is terrible. The wait for taxis is interminable as the hotel must have an arrangement with the limo service stationed outside. The check-in is all about making sure that you dont like the experience and just dont bother with the restaurants unless you have hours for any food service as it takes forever! The coffee bar is dramatically understaffed and they are definitely harassed so plan on a long delay. Rooms are very dated, the lounge is very dated and the quite honestly, at one point this was probably a great hotel. Its definitely not now!

Reviews.Title: “Slipping”
Reviews.Author: smurphymn
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Biltmore about 10 times in the last 15 years, and it is slipping. The main building and grounds are stunning. Great architecture and landscaping. The restaurants and meeting facilities are top notch, as are the front desk staff. The rooms are hit and miss. Some of the newer wings are bland and boring. Some of the older areas (like the terrace wing) are huge, interesting and comfortable but are in need of maintenance. Check your room out before you unpack. Still a very unique property, just not as special as it used to be. Oh, and a $12 fee for the bellman, who does nothing but open the car door? C'mon man.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pamela F
Reviews.Content: The resort was easy to find from the airport after a long flight and very handy for the shopping malls. It has loads of history attached to it and all around were pictures of the famous people who have stayed there. The gardens were immaculate and the outside seating areas had fire pits for when the nights turned a bit chilly. We stayed in the Ocatilla Wing which were the Club rooms and we really liked them, our room was spacious and being on the ground floor had a patio which overlooked the pool. Being in the Club room it included breakfast, snacks and drinks in the evening which was well worth the extra and we had our own lounge and in here there was a really cool waiter serving us who had a great sense of humour. I would definitely stay here again next time I visit Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent meeting venue”
Reviews.Author: EandAMom
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent experience here at a recent meeting. The staff are well trained, friendly, welcoming, and the food and drinks at the event were great. Love the glass soda bottles at the breaks reminded me of when I was a kid and how much better soda is right out of the bottle.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth to be called a Waldorf Astoria - Rooms are Motel 6 level”
Reviews.Author: dotilla
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference and booked a room as a Hilton Honors Diamond member. Usually, you receive room upgrades to the executive level with free breakfast and any other Hilton I stayed in tries to accommodate the wishes of their members with regard to room location within the property. Not so the Biltmore: I was given a standard room (they said it was an upgrade but in that case the basic rooms must be a hole in the wall) that, despite my request, was located at a street so that I had to close the window at night not to be disturbed by traffic noise. No free breakfast either. All you get is a two-drink coupon limited to $14/drink. Overall a miserable check-in experience especially in light of room availability and available upgrades to other HH with entry level memberships. The bed was substandard with a worn out mattress. The balcony was dirty but could not be used anyway due to the cold location (no sun at all). There was not even a coffee maker in the room. See other comments on the rooms in the terrace wing ("Needs work"). The spa was another negative highlight: the exercise equipment can be called prehistoric and the sauna is not hot when one arrives (during standard traffic/business hours). The grounds are kept neatly but the entire building needs a bit more TLC to be called "in excellent shape". The bar and the restaurant served excellent drinks and food with good service although, despite housing several conferences, the main restaurant was closed for lunch, which led to up to 30-min waiting time: totally unacceptable. Another point worth to mention was the business center: extortion! $7.50 for 15 minutes computer use, and on top of that $1 per printed page. Fortunately, the clerk at the business center printed my pages from my USB drive, and I did not have to use their computer.

Reviews.Title: “The Jewel in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: 1212check
Reviews.Content: We have a book, ‘A Thousand Places to See Before You Die’ which suggested the Arizona Biltmore Hotel was a place to visit. It has played host to every president in power since Hoover (except, so far, president Obama). The hotel is like no other I have ever stayed in. The place is a work of art. Frank Lloyd Wright had a great influence on its design and construction. Every wall is decorated with moulded blocks in intricate patterns. There are so many fine details to lights, to walkways and decorations. What added to our pleasure and appreciation of the hotel was a 90 minute guided (free) tour of some of the remarkable features of the estate, including an ‘acoustically perfect’ octagonal room used by previous owners, the Wrigley’s, as a movie theatre. There is the magnificent ‘gold room’ where the Wrigley’s and hundreds of guests dined. More gilt was used on the ceilings of the Biltmore than any other building in the world except the Taj Mahal. Our room was large, clean and comfortable and windows opened up on a manicured courtyard. Service was very professional. We spent the entire weekend at the resort. The food was very good. There was enough to do. We strolled around the resort and dipped in the nearest of the pools. It wasn’t the pool that was Marilyn Monroe’s favourite or where Irving Berlin wrote, ‘I’m Dreaming of a White Christmas’. But it was a great place to have a dip, relax and chat with other guests. The resort was, truly as described; the Jewel in the Desert.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent place if you shop and get a sale price”
Reviews.Author: heatseekerVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in October and got an exellent deal from them for the premier building. We went on a budget and they offerd continental breakfast, happy hour with complimentary wine and beer from 5 to 9pm and also had appies from 5 to 6:30 and deserts for 8 to 9pm. We did not use the in room bar or had house keeping as it was not needed. Beautiful grounds and pools.Tons of history all over the walls to see and the restaurant we went to was very reasonable and good.( hand made guacamole is awesome , made at your table and plentiful).Service was good and freindly.

Reviews.Title: “The "Wright" place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ZMyers
Reviews.Content: Because of a mix up with my company...my group was moved to the Arizona Biltmore at the last minute. I did no research on the property..and felt like we were getting the short end of the stick. To my surprise - this Waldorf Astoria location was even better than any story I could have be told. I felt like we were staying in Hollywood in the 1950's. The Frank Lloyd Wright inspired architecture is too cool for words. The staff was great and I could not have been luckier! Save up and make your reservations here...I promise that you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: S P
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 nights for business. Pros- great service, big rooms with refrigerators, pretty landscaping/grounds. Cons- you are stuck at the property if you don't have a car and everything is very overpriced, from the rooms to the restaurants to the $8 bottles of water! Plus, there are a lot of fees -bellman service (which I didn't use), maid service, plus a $30/day resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “"Chip" was really great as my mountain bike guide!”
Reviews.Author: chronofix
Reviews.Content: Having a great anniversary with my wife here at the Biltmore/Arizona. Great meals and friendly staff. I have to give one great thumbs up to "Chip" who was my guide for a 2 hour mountain bike ride today (11/12/11.) I arrived at about 2:45pm and Chip was ready for me. New bikes too. Great guy, paced according to my skill level which I think is average, and had some nice conversations with him. Give him a raise or bonus, he is an asset to the recreations department, and hotel in general. Greg M.

Reviews.Title: “I Had High Hopes for the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: JFSD
Reviews.Content: The Good: Architecture is beautiful, staff is helpful and the grounds are lovely. We enjoyed walking through the Biltmore Estates every afternoon. The Bad: Many of the rooms are dated and need to be renovated. Conference rooms are far from the main portion of the hotel and appear to be an afterthought. $12.00 mandatory charge for bellman service, whether you use it or not. The Ugly: I got food poisoning while staying at this hotel, and I am not the only person who got ill at this conference. Wi-Fi service was new and did not work properly. No free Wi-Fi in the conference rooms, when I asked for the password I was told there is a $350.00 charge. I had such high hopes for this hotel. I stayed at the hotel as part of a large conference, and it quickly became clear that the hotel was not equipped to handle a conference this large. We got to our room and discovered that the wireless was not working, when I called the front desk they acted like they did not know what I was talking about and claimed that they had not received any complaints. The next morning as I started talking to other conference attendees it became clear that there was a problem throughout the property as at least half of the conference participants had experienced issues. I then went to the front desk, it turns out that they had just upgraded to wireless service and they were having implementation issues, however, they agreed to move us to a villa, at no extra charge(where they said the wi-fi would be working). I was pleased with this as there was a huge discrepancy in the rooms, many people were complaining that the furnishings were worn and that outlets didn’t work or pictures were falling off the walls (I personally know 2 people that had the same issues). The villa they moved us to, although very large and well kept, had not been updated since the 80’s (both the bathroom and kitchen while clean and well kept desperately needed updates). If I had paid full price for the villa, I would have been annoyed. I was annoyed when 12 hours after moving into the villa the WiFi stopped working. The conference center was poorly laid out and difficult to both get to and navigate. The food was marginal, and as I mentioned about I came down with a case of food poisoning halfway through my stay and since I had only eaten on the property for 48 hours preceding my illness, I am positive it was related to the hotel. The staff is the one bright spot in my stay and while they did everything they could to be accommodating, it is clear that the hotel is simply was not set up to handle a conference of our size. IN fact after our flight was cancelled (die to whether) we elected not to return to the Biltmore and instead went to the Ritz Carleton across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Generally bad service, nice rooms and grounds”
Reviews.Author: MDG02186
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at this hotel on three occaisons; generally we have found that the grounds, rooms and food are great, although it does resemeble a public housing project. But the hotel often poses a comedy of errors/disasters on service issues. Examples include: on our last visit in June, we weren't allowed to check in until hours after official check in time and the bellman lost our luggage. We were told the hotel had a lot of VIP guests checking out and they had priority - if they don't want to check out, too bad. The thing was, housekeeping told us our rooms were cleaned already. We were hassled going to the main pool while waiting for the room, forced to prove we were hotel guests because there was a draft party going on at the time. My young children were hassled by drunken guests at the pool while we were trying to enter (during daylight hours in 115 degree heat). Once we checked in, our building lost water for hours and the hotel couldn't give us an explanation of what happened or the expected duration. During my husband's most recent stay, the hotel moved him to the Ocatilla building but wouldn't allow him access to the lounge. Given the minimal refreshments available in the lounge, access doesn't really cost the hotel much but they definitely don't care about goodwill. If you stay here, be prepared for the high likelihood of something going wrong, and minimal effort to correct the problem. The wait staff and housekeeping staff are wonderful, very nice..

Reviews.Title: “We've missed it's hey days . . . Pity!”
Reviews.Author: Stonington-Sue
Reviews.Content: This address is probably one that most people associate with the glitterati of day's gone by. I took today's History Tour, free from the Concierge Desk, and it was very enjoyable. I could easily picture Frank Sinatra, Liza Minnelli and Sammy Davis Jnr at the piano, waking those who'd gone to bed early! The gardens are spacious and well tended and there are fountains here and there, adding to the atmosphere. We were here for a conference and had a pleasant room at the rear of the Terrace Block. I was romantically hoping for something rather out of the ordinary and whilst we have (I'm in the room as I write!) a spacious bathroom with walk in shower, the separate bath is bog standard and the basins are housed in plastic work top. Not exactly high end like Sofitel at T5, for example. The room has more than a nod to Frank Lloyd Wright with nice wooden Arts and Crafts style furniture - just a pity that the bedside tables haven't been protected and so have been water damaged, for example. However, there's a balcony with seating and the bed's comfortable. The large armchairs are nice, if somewhat crammed into the corner. Friends were given a Fountain Court suite, somewhat like a mini apartment. Again the space was great, with kitchen, lounge and dining area as a plus, however, this particular one was in need of a refresh. The carpet was grim. Not that they were complaining as this was an upgrade for them at no extra charge. However, if they'd paid a load extra for it, it honesty didn't cut the mustard. The fourth floor was being refurbed and, I suppose, with 740 odd rooms, it's a constant battle. What really set this place apart, for us, was the dining.
