Excellent food is available, the breakfasts are incredible with piping hot and delicious stacks of pancakes and delicately flavored French toast of epic proportions! For dinner we had beef Wellington, which was very good indeed. The lunch menu is good too. Cobb salad at the pool arrived in a cocktail shaker! It allowed the dressing to be mixed well! We had planned to share lunch, however, and just this once this was a single serving! Heyho! I helped our friends with their mega salad. It's a hard life! Go if you're curious and enjoy the historical aspects and good food but, unless you're booking the presidential suite, you might be disappointed that the room isn't very Hollywood! On the plus side, you'll be well fed!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to relax”
Reviews.Author: caryn p
Reviews.Content: We were here for 2 days and loved the experience. We stayed in the Ocatilla area that had a private salt water pool. Since it was a Sunday-Monday stay, we were pretty much alone and got to enjoy true peacefullness. The room was spacious, the bath was great...really loved the bath salts that were provided and took full advantage of the luxurious bath and the shower! The main pool had a swim up bar that we had a cocktail at along with some afternoon snacks. The best part was the food at the Frank and Alberts. We had breakfast there when we arrived, lunch one day, drinks the next and dinner the last night. We had left the property for one meal and wish we hadn't because the food was so yummy at F&A's. Can't wait to come back!!

Reviews.Title: “A bit pretentious but great for conventions”
Reviews.Author: Peterjules
Reviews.Content: Loved the look of this property when booking but did not feel at home when staying here. There were obviously conventions on and the place lacked a sense of privacy as the bars were very full as well as the lobby and foyer. Felt like a number and not necessarily a name. Stayed in the Ocatilla Section of the hotel and was expecting a view as we booked a Deluxe room (this said views of garden or mountains) but could only see the bungalow in front. The Ocatilla lounge was welcoming but we did have an issue trying to get the concierge on a couple of occasions. The menu at Wrights was very limited for such an upmarket complex and we were a little disappointed in the variety offered. Frank and Alberts next door offered a far better choice of menu. Overall, I possibly would not stay here again as I felt it lacked a one on one experience. Great for a convention or a golfing party but lacked a little personal space for a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed three times, gets better every time!”
Reviews.Author: dipti29
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Arizona Biltmore three times now for work related conferences. It is a lovely property with the best architecture in Phoenix! Last visit I was upgraded to a suite. A lovely large one bedroom at the edge of the complex with a gorgeous sunrise facing view of the mountains. The small but close by pool was perfect for a relaxing early morning dip before a day of conference meetings. I always had it to my self which was perfect and relaxing for me. Huge patio was a relaxing place as well for sun rises and sunsets. Restaurants were fine but did prefer to eat at Biltmore Fashion Park restaurants - best one: True Food Kitchen. The grounds and conference facilities are some of the best around. Love the Frank Lloyd Wright sculptures and all the little water features located around the grounds. Friendly staff. Fine gym.

Reviews.Title: “Not crazy about this place”
Reviews.Author: nyjetsetter
Reviews.Content: Stay here if you can get your room for $100 (ok, may be $150) or less. This hotel made me think of Disney World hotel properties. Actually, it's probably worse. The hotel is massive and hotel room buildings are randomly scattered throughout the property. It felt like a compound. Rooms are nondescript and plain (surprising, given all of Frank Lloyd Wright influence talk) All of the rooms that I saw appeared old, drab, and dark. Fixtures/furniture were cheap cheap cheap and haven't been updated in decades. I saw mold (and many mosquitoes!) in the bathroom and the toiletries were basic, like those that you would find at a Holiday Inn. What did I like about this property? Well, there's a coffee bar adjacent to a nice outdoor seating area. I liked having that option in the morning and the coffee was decent. The swimming pools were also large and great for kids/families. Drinks and food didn't seem outrageously priced to me (it's a hotel, after all). The resort fee that they add to your bill, however, was astonishing and hilarious. This is a hotel, not a resort. Overall, I feel like we overpaid for our room given how basic it was. If you're looking for an elegant hotel, this place isn't for you. If you need a place to crash and have kids who love pools, this place could work out for you.... just don't expect a luxe experience by any stretch of the imagination.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: 1301chadwick
Reviews.Content: The grounds are extensive and magnificient. I had a resort premier room and it was large, well maintained and had a large patio overlooking the pool. I read many of the reviews that complain that the place is getting shabby, but my room did not reflect that. The bathroom was not five star, but it was clean and the water pressure was excellent. The gym had lots of excellent equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Really lovely AZ resort for business or pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: jmp1975
Reviews.Content: I traveled to this hotel to attend a business conference on site. The property is stunning. Top notch everything. One perk is also a bit of a drawback: The resort is a bit out of the way. I didn't have a car on this trip so leaving the property was not possible. I had no reason to leave the property but the trade off is that everything is very high priced at the resort. $4 for a cup of coffee - not a latte - a cup of coffee. There is shuttle service to the nearby mall. Taxi to the airport was about $40 each way. This resort is absolutely beautiful - highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: USAMaineTravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on late October for two nights. The front desk service was very prompt and friendly. Service in the restaurants and bars was good as well. The grounds were well kept but after dark there was not enough lighting on the paths to the cottages. The room was dark. There was one window that faced the walkway and another building so the drapes needed to be kept closed. The room had a separate tub and shower. The shower was 36" square and pretty small. There was a phone jack next to the john but no phone there. Only one side of the bed had a bedside table. There was a dead bug in the bathroom. The grounds are nice but away from other areas on Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “Full-service desert spa”
Reviews.Author: DCJetGirl
Reviews.Content: I was here for three days for work and I wish I had more time to spend. Yes, everything on the property is ridiculously overpriced ($42 for a room service breakfast of dry cereal, a muffin and a pot of tea?). But credit over-extension aside, this place is fantastic. I will spare the usual "desert oasis" commentary and say that this is a lovely, well-manicured property. It's a bit dated - my room was large and extremely comfortable, but some of my colleagues found their rooms a bit down at the heels. My bed was huge and comfy, the room was silent and I was incredibly relaxed the entire trip. I took advantage of special pricing on their spa packages (on a Tuesday, the rates are discounted) and LOVED my massage and personal training session. If you want some supervised time in the gym, ask for Chip. He's a character - really warm and personable - and gave me a great workout. Everybody here seems very laid back and nice. I loved the atmosphere. The events rooms were standard fare, but it was nice to see the sun shining through the windows and enjoy lunch out on the beautiful lawn. The food was terrific at lunch, but surprisingly awful at dinner. The dinner was a formal one, and I'm surprised that with the fantastic restaurant they have right on the property that the event dinner was a hot-box plate of overcooked steak. A slab of steak, really. Not so great. Absolutely get one of their executive cars to take you to the airport. I paid $30 (not including tip) for my cab and $33 for the exec car back to the airport. The car might be the only luxury for which they don't overcharge. I would definitely come back here!

Reviews.Title: “Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: Arnoldk56
Reviews.Content: Great property. Excellent location Overpriced breakfast Pools are great

Reviews.Title: “Unique, enjoyable hotel, but not worth the high price.”
Reviews.Author: Exurbanite
Reviews.Content: Rather than repeat descriptions from many other reviews, I will just say that I loved the unique architecture, history, and the beautiful grounds of the hotel. It is an experience worth having even if it is not perfect. I went along with my husband to a business conference, and the rooms were around $200 a night. Our room was a bit small, and while comfortable, it did not have a view but looked out onto a rooftop directly outside our room. The bathroom was nice, and as a female, I greatly appreciated several things: 1) a lighted, extendable makeup mirror 2) an extra shelf above the vanity to keep items out of the way and from getting wet 3) a really nice quality hair dryer was supplied with multiple heats and speeds, rather than the cheap ones they usually provide in hotels. 4) nice quality amenities like shampoo and conditioner Also enjoyed having a bathrobe. We got complimentary internet access in the room and that was great too, as we used it a lot. But other than that, the room is very plain and ordinary. Bed was comfortable, and housekeeping service was very attentive. On the downside, the bathtub did not drain so we were standing in dirty water every time we took a shower. So, the room was average, but the rest of the hotel, fabulous. The lobby and public areas are the nicest of any hotel I have seen. So many different areas to sit and relax, talk or read. Gorgeous architecture and really nice renovation. The history of the hotel is so interesting, and I highly recommend the free onsite history tour. We had a great meal at the main restaurant and also ate at Albert and Franks, the more casual eatery. Just know that food and wine are pricey here! We also both got a massage at the spa, and it was wonderful, if not expensive. We also very much enjoyed the beautiful main pool, and the grounds are just lovely, although confusing because the place is so large and rambling, so it was a bit hard to find one's way around. It would be easy to get lost there. I felt the service throughout was excellent and attentive. The ambience of the hotel is one reason to stay there, it is just so unique and different from any other place I have stayed. It reminds me of something Disneyesque, except that it's the real thing, which is really cool. So many hotels try to create a feeling of elegance and history, but this place has it embedded in it. Overall we were very pleased, but I would just have preferred a larger and nicer room. Guess the conference crowd gets the less desirable rooms since we get a lower rate. Anyway, I wouldn't let it stop you, this hotel is definitely worth trying, and is an experience you will not forget.

Reviews.Title: “Great property”
Reviews.Author: MichiganSue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ocatilla within the Biltmore and were very pleased. The club room and food servings was very well done and the food throughout the hotel was very good. Service was great and the hotel was very well maintained. We had a club deluxe room and the patio was disappointing as it looked over a hotel service road.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but overly priced”
Reviews.Author: Beewacker
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Biltmore in '98 and loved it. Maybe it was because it was for business, but I loved it then. Just stayed on the weekend and just marginally liked it. Why? Service was not personal, too many weddings and crumbling concrete. Stayed in the Paradise wing and the furnishings were the same as in '98, in other words, they were the same. Same old chairs. Same old panelling. Only difference was the LED TV. Maybe I was looking for the same service. No, it wasn't. Linen changes were anytime between 10:00 and 5:30. For a room costing $400+ after taxes, this was unacceptable. WiFi wasn't working. Only a number to AT&T was provided to get it working. That didn't work. After mentioning to the front desk, the response was they might look into it and you could use the lobby connection. Not acceptable. Realize the campus of the hotel takes up about 1000 acres and it is a good distance walk just to get email. We had a private patio with our room divided by concrete walls. On the end the concrete was literally falling of. A little history. The Biltmore was designed by a student of Frank Loyd Wright and built in the late 20's out of concrete. Over the years, the old not coated rebar rusts and bursts the cement. That's what has happened and over the years no repair has been done. The restaurant was good, goodly expensive. The bar was expensive, $17 hamburger and only angus not Kolbe. Yes I knew it was expensive. But what we got for the price was not worth the visit again. One thing about the place is the fact that every building complex has a pool. The landscaping is mostly lawns with shrubbery around the cottages.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend stay at Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: BeavertonMIke
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with courteous staff. Place is full of history and you enjoy amazing archtechture and history, this place is for you. The food was great, the grounds and pool were spectacular as well. Also, they have a limo service that is very reasonable to/from the airport. In fact, I left my laptop in the limo and hours later was able to retrieve it. Don't think that would have happened if I took a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property, luxurious accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne200
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed our stay at the Arizona Biltmore. We booked a two bedroom villa with a kitchen and living area. The pool was a lot of fun for the children, however, the pool area could use more seating. On a busy day it was difficult to find enough chairs for the whole family. The food at the Biltmore was very good and we enjoyed our evenings very much.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, classic old hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Palman13
Reviews.Content: Was going to Phoenix for a business conference that was scheduled at the Biltmore, made my reservations early which turned out to be good because others in our group didn't and ended up having to stay off property and drive in or take shuttle buses. When I arrived at 1:00 told twin rooms were available or could wait for king. Opted to wait and because a smoker asked for a balcony room. Took about an hour and found a spot to make some calls and do some work, when I got to the room big room with large alcove work area, double balcony and large sitting area. Room was well appointed and looked over garden area, with small hilltop just off the grounds. Walking to the meetings each day was very enjoyable, just long. It had nice outdoor sitting areas throughout the grounds where you could eat, drink or just visit, that in this day of smoking police let you smoke cigars in comfortable surroundings. Had good wifi in room and conference had the $29 daily resort fee comp but could not get wifi in meeting areas without meeting room code. Food was good in meetings, baquets, room service and restaurants. While staying on beautiful grounds with many resort options, frustrated I had too many meetings and could not enjoy. Because of the location and meeting schedule didn't get off the campus so did really get to see Phoenix either.

Reviews.Title: “Good bones, but service issues dampen the experience”
Reviews.Author: Taxlass23
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, designed by Frank Lloyd Wright. The buildings and grounds are equally gorgeous. However, there were just too many service issues to make me want to go back again. For example, dirty drink glasses remained in common areas for days and days, there was broken glass on the walkways, the wifi in the rooms did not work the entire five days we were there, etc. The two biggest frustrations: although the room was decently sized and could have accomodated a king sized bed, the bed in our room was the smallest queen (maybe even a double) I have ever slept in. I did not sleep at all well. Secondly, we received a 5:30 a.m. wake up call one morning, even though we had not ordered it. When we called the front desk later in the day to complain, we did not get so much as an "I'm sorry," Same with the problems with the wifi--when we called to get resolution, we were first told that there was no problem (not true as we called A T + T on two separate days who were able to determine it was a hotel issue), then told that some of the rooms were dead zones (again not true as I had five bars on both of their networks). This is very sad as this has the potential to be a world class hotel. Maybe Astoria could take some notes from the Ritz Carlton on guest services . . .

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!”
Reviews.Author: FunTravelerForSure
Reviews.Content: This place is THE WORST! What a shame what Astoria has done to the Biltmore. A beautiful property with lovely architecture, but the worst rooms, service and dirty on top of it! Not to knock another hotel, but this was barely one step above a motel 6! I was a bit skeptical after reading the many negative online reviews but really wanted to see the property and stay in what I thought was a piece of Arizona history. The hotel is in a lovely area of Phoenix and the grounds are magnificent. Because of reading many less than positive reviews I wanted to check out a few rooms before I chose one. I had booked through American Express Fine Hotel program so expected something special. Wow, what a disappointment! Steve at the front desk was very nice, efficient and professional and gave me several choices of room options. A very nice security guard took me around to show me the rooms he had selected for me to see. One was shabbier than the next! I finally chose a room in the “concierge” section Ocotillo I believe they call it. It has a lounge, which was very nice with food and drink service and that was very nice. The room was THE PITS! Shabby furniture, tiny bathroom, skimpy towels, poor bath amenities and looked dirty. The bathrooms “have been remodeled” I was told. Wow, they need to send their CEO to stay in a room and test it out. The shower didn’t even have a place to put your shampoo! The toilet area was so small you practically had to go in sideways. No first class AT ALL. The furniture was chipped, fingerprints and stains and very skimpy amenities. A robe, but no slippers! Cheap pads and pens and no bottled water included. There was NO turn down service, none! And this was the “concierge” building! Amazing that they are still in business. The bed was uncomfortable and the lines less than first class. Mind you the room rate was over $300 a night so I expected first class everything. Even the fan in the bathroom was the cheapest possible and noisy! The “improved” (so I was told) Internet did not work; fortunately I had an air card on my laptop. The property is beautiful, very spread out and poor signage to direct you around. I do have to say the food in the restaurants was excellent; however again, the service was hit or miss. Every day I had breakfast in the café and there was no salt and pepper on the table and had to ask for it each time. The service was not at all 5 star. All in all, I would say this was the low point of my visit to Phoenix and I had such high hopes, a real disappointment! Also, watch your bill, they add on a “resort charge” for nothing and charge for self-parking in a cramped far away lot, amazing that they are still in business! My advice, stay in one of the many wonderful resorts in the area and not at the Biltmore!!

Reviews.Title: “Has it all.”
Reviews.Author: Fysmd
Reviews.Content: I love the Biltmore. This was my fourth stay and will definitely visit again. This was my first stay in the main building and except for not having any outdoor space with my room I loved it. Vist the history room and get a feel for the places history. There are also some excellent pictures throughout the public spaces in the conference area. Worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT POOL SERVER JAMEE!”
Reviews.Author: diann w
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting the Arizona Biltmore for over 35 years. It is a great getaway place for me to relax. One of my favorite things to do is have lunch pool side. I love the menu, however, more importantly, the servers are attentive and courteous. No busy how this pool side restaurant becomes, Jamee, one of the hardest working servers, always manages to find an orange for my iced tea. She brings a platter full of orange slices! This young lady remembers what you like to eat, addresses you by name and always has a beautiful smile to go with her great service. Jamee, you are a doll! Everyone should ask for you when having lunch poolside...just so I get a seat and you keep brining me orange slices :) Diann Wilson

Reviews.Title: “Spa Review”
Reviews.Author: AZFan
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal fan of another resort's spa in town, but received a gift card for the Spa at the Biltmore and booked a facial. I was told i could check in early, so i was there 5 hours prior to my appt to enjoy the amenities, pool, sauna, etc. A nice touch was that one of valet/bellmen personally escorted me back to the spa area since it is tucked away in a corner of the resort, which was so considerate and i appreciated it. It is a small, but nicely appointed spa. You get the secure locker, robe and rubber sandals. Great lotions, soaps, etc. for all to use, loved the coffee and tea carafes that were gratis for spa guests. I enjoyed the Cabana Cafe pool area, received wonderful poolside service for my beverage and then lunch, both were great, the Greek Salad was ample and fresh. The facial was nicely done, very professional and personalized, i left with that "ahhh spa" feeling, which is the ultimate goal. It is a great service for guests. A few things that were somewhat uncomfortable were the "one size" sandals that did not fit and "one size fits all" spa robe was for a size 8-10, which i am not. I saw many women and men too tugging on their robes. And the waiting room for your service is co-ed, which i guess i am just too traditional, but that was uncomfortable and i do not think i was the only one feeling that. Kinda weird all of us sitting in a small little room with your (uncomfortable) robes on. I was supposed to get a glass of champagne, which was never served and the spa staff person checking me out offered it as i was leaving...champagne while you drive? So a bit awkward (i declined), but i still enjoyed my day and would recommend it if you were staying there or if i got a "good deal" on a service, but i am still loyal to my "other resort" and that is all good.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience I've ever had by far!!”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: From the concierge "Leo" in the Ocatilla Lounge to the service by Cheryl at Frank and Albert's - an all local produce and partially organic ingredient menu. The chef is amazing! The sports massage wasn't deep enough though, I should have said something to the masseuse. The gentleman in the men's spa lounge gave impeccable service from drinks to having the newspaper ready for me to read. I love this place! Beautiful views, great food and great service! I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Still a Classic”
Reviews.Author: Lounim
Reviews.Content: A Frank Lloyd Wright-designed gem, this resort is so architecturally-unique that it's worth staying there just to appreciate the design. The rooms are very comfortable, and the staff does a very good job. I was frustrated that there wereno silly, little in-room coffee makers, but a call to the front desk had one deliveredpronto. A nearby supermarket saved me $100 in morning room service charges. The bars are plenty and varied, and although we never ate on the property, Frank & Albert's is supposed to be great. Enjoying an after dinner drink at the fire pits is a great way to end a day.

Reviews.Title: “Over charged twice so beware.”
Reviews.Author: darryl1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in october and had a few problems but first I don't understand why you have to pay a $20+ per day fee to use the pool or gym..I know it included wifi but when we were there the wifi didn't work until the third day we were there. One night I decided to check my folio on the tv and found that there was a $30 charge for the minibar which we never touched anything from in, I called down to the front desk and they reversed it. So got the invoice on the last day and then today we checked our credit card statement and it was more than what the invoice said, so I asked the hotel to email me an updated invoice and that's when I noticed another charge for the mini bar that we never used. I contacted the hotel and so far no response from them. A hint for you.. They do not have coffee makers in the room so you must go to the cafe onsite and pay $5 for a brewed coffee. Also the hotel is far from anything unless you don't mind walking 1/2 hour to anything. The grounds really well looked after so that's was a plus but the pools were freezing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort!”
Reviews.Author: LLC0325
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Arizona Biltmore while on a business trip. The resort is just beautiful and the rooms were lovely. I had a private wraparound terrace that overlooked the pool. The toiletries in the room were wonderful (I'm still enjoying the last of the lotion from the room!), and every staff member was friendly and helpful. If you go don't miss enjoying a meal at the onsite restaurant. Our was fantastic! Check out the room rates in off seasons. Our rate was not much more than local chain hotels. Do be aware, however, that there is a $28 per day resort fee that is added to your bill.

Reviews.Title: “Frank Lloyd Wright inspired property with peaceful grounds”
Reviews.Author: Jaewriter
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with super on site restaurants, helpful staff, glorious grounds, a wide assortment of pools, including the main pool with a swim up bar. A wonderful oasis in the desert.

Reviews.Title: “Liars, Tramps and Thieves.”
Reviews.Author: onetwoko
Reviews.Content: Awful...just awful. I stayed here for a week at the end of July. A MAID STOLE MY COMPUTER, IPHONE, AND DOCUMENTS FROM MY ROOM!!! After meeting with the manager and security I was assured I would be reimbursed by their insurance company and have a night deducted from my folio. When the bill came not only did they charge me for the 'free' night, they also charged me for my free AmEx platinum night. Then the insurance company declined to pay for ANYTHING. I should've filed a police report right then and there, but i (mistakenly) chose to believe their employees. Stay here at your own risk.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property, but slips on some of the details”
Reviews.Author: sfaaron12345
Reviews.Content: I recently shared the following feedback with the manager of the hotel, however I've not heard back from him. ----------------- Dear Manager, I wanted to share some feedback from a recent stay at your resort. I was in room 6143 in the Ocatilla building. It was a delight to spend a couple of nights at such a lovely property. The room and grounds were immaculate. I do have some specific things to bring to your attention. Here they are, in no particular order. I * Hair dryer didn't work; had to request replacement when I was already running late. * Outlet in bathroom didn't work * Glass light in one headboard could not be turned off via switch * Wireless Internet access did not work * Outlet next to bed did not work * Phone line was crossed with another room, received calls from adjacent room (6141) * Sliding plantation shutter door stuck * Front door latch loose * Small item- maid left cleaning rag on back of chair This is a list of small items, but there are so many issues it makes me wonder what kind of inspections are done to ensure things are well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful from nearly every angle!”
Reviews.Author: Tedkid
Reviews.Content: If you are a fan of Frank Lloyd Wright or just enjoy historic architecture you should plan a stop at the Arizona Biltmore. This hotel is beautiful in nearly every aspect. We stayed in the Paradise wing and our room was just average. It was very clean and the bathroom was really nice with a great tub and nice shower. I stayed here in 2003 and was lucky enough to stay in one of the historic cottages. That was fun. If you enjoy history take the hotel history tour. Skip the tour of the adjacent Wrigley House, it is not worth it. The food at the Biltmore was good and a bit pricey but about as expected. The hotel grounds are spread out. If you have mobility issues allow extra time to get around. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location-helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mrscherry2000
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore is a great resort with beautiful buildings. The hotel is designed by Frank Lloyd Wright and is the oldest resort in Phoenix but does not have that worn down look I have experienced at most other historic resorts. I stayed in the Paradise Wing next to the pools and the room was a nice size and a very comfortable bed. The lounge area outside the main lobby is a great place to have drinks after dinner. They have fire pits set up to take the chill off. The location is great as there is shopping and an amazing choose of great restaurants a short ride away. For exercisers, there is a two mile loop for running and walking and the fitness center is about average size for a resort this large. During a large conference, I can imagine the machines would fill up in the morning if you didn't get there early enough. My biggest complaint was the internet. It kept cutting out and was rather slow.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property!”
Reviews.Author: HapTrav12345
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful property! If you’re history buff, this is a great hotel to stay in and take the historical tour. The property was just stunning. I stayed in the Ocatilla building, which has a complimentary lounge which serves breakfast and food and drinks throughout the day. There is a lot of walking to get from building to building, which is not very pleasant in the heat of Arizona during the middle of the day. I don’t think I would have minded had I been on vacation rather than dressed for business. The setting is beautiful and the views were amazing. The pools looked beautiful, though I didn’t get a chance to enjoy them. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service and food wonderful but the room was shabby”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler9000
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights in a cottage room and while the food, service and grounds are lovely and wonderful, the room was in dire need of an update. Bugs in the overhead light fixtures, ripped and broken lamp shade as well as the headboard was very worn and scatched. The desk area was small and the internet, albeit free, was extremely slow. Not worth the $275 plus I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - A Exemplary Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: drichrx
Reviews.Content: I was here about 10 years ago and was not impressed (except for the history of the hotel). I recently came here for a business meeting and was truly impressed. First, I was not aware that this was a Waldort Astoria hotel and part of the Hilton chain. As a Hilton DIamond member I got a lot of perks. I got a room in the Catalina Villas, which was about 1000 sq ft with a full kitchen, dining room, living room with working fireplace, huge bathroom and bedroom, and a huge balcony, The grounds and saltwater pools were esquisite, and staff were everywhere, super-friendly and helpful. They even printed out by boarding pass and delivered it to my room. I only had breakfast there, but it was very good. This is now one of my favorite hotels in the US, and highly recommended to anyone staying in the Camelback Phoenix area.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Price - Four Star Service”
Reviews.Author: dreamdestinations
Reviews.Content: This was our third year of staying at the Biltmore. The first two years we enjoyed very much even though the stay is quite pricey. This year we found the service was slow and not as top notch as in the past. It's a beautiful resort and great venue for our conference each year. There are a number of meeting rooms for business meetings or special occasions and the grounds are perfect locations for outdoor gatherings. Sunset is especially beautiful with fire pits and large outside seating areas for food or drinks or admiring the mountain views. The 2 bars are great places for socializing and are easily located off the lobby. The property has 39 acres with a variety of lodgings. From cottages (small but cozy)scattered about the spacious grounds (some with jacuzzi and private grassy areas that would be perfect for large family reunions), to small rooms located inside the main buliding, or larger rooms located in outer bulidings (many of the outer bulidings have separate swimming pools), or the larger villas. There is a terrific spa with a very well equipped gym and about 7 or more tennis courts. The property was built in the 1920's in the Frank Lloyd Wright style with art deco furnishings in the accomodations as well as the puplic areas of the resort which are all very well maintained! There is a lot of hisory behind the walls of the Biltmore from it's beginnings to it's famous guests list. We have stayed in the Terrace Rooms (with a small quiet pool for guests) which have either ground floor private patios or private balconies on the upper floors. We always request mountain views which are magnificant at sunset. The rooms/bathroom are separated and large. The furnishings are in soft tones. We have never found the rooms to be less than clean and comfortable.....I'm very fussy about the condition of my room and have never had a complaint. We have also stayed in the newly renovated Ocatilla building that's considered a "hotel within a hotel" because of the concierge service and a separate room that serves complimentary snacks and drinks at certain times of the day along with other amenities that are only offered to guests in that building. These rooms are very spacious with an abundance of light from the french balcony on the upper floors (floor to ceiling sliding door) or the patios on the ground floor. The Ocatilla building has it's own fountain & large pool which much more tranqil than the main pool (the main pool has a large water slide, cabanas, and a Cabana Club Restaurant - great for families). The bathrooms, in the Ocatilla rooms, are tiled and very nice with a separate toilet room (very very small - 2 1/2 foot by 5 foot - too small for a large person), double sinks, large shower stall and good size bath tub. The iced water dispensers around the pool areas are a real plus especially when the weather in Phoenix can be very HOT!!!! The children's play area is very well equiped and the resort has a children's day care with supervised activities for all ages. The shops are extremely over prices - better to go to the mall down the road. The cafe is a great place for light food and Starbuck's coffee. The Frank & Albert's restaurant and the Wright's at the Biltmore have wonderful food. My husband is a foody and we found the restaurants' chefs had put together a yummy variety of dishes. Even though the service was a bit slow, we really enjoyed eating at both restaurants. A private town car from the airport was $35 one way. Overall, this is a lovely place to visit.....at least once. Try to find out what conferences are taking place. If it is a very large conference - try to schedule another time to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Jeckyl and Hyde experience!”
Reviews.Author: 1879fulham
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this iconic hotel for four nights at the end of August. The hotel is beautiful and the communal areas are maintained to a very high standard as of course are the rooms. My only moan is because it is the hotels low season that over the weekend of my visit the hotel was absolutely packed with families and groups there for the weekender special deal. As a consequence the pool areas were packed to the rafters and any sense one had that they were staying at an exclusive beautiful hotel quickly evaporated. It was more like staying at Butlins). This sense was further underlined when a significant delegation of tattooists arrived to commence their conference. Lol.

Reviews.Title: “Overall enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Sportsinfo101
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the first time this last week for a business conference. My stay was enjoyable. This hotel is not what I would call a typical traditional hotel. There is a sprawl of rooms set out over a large area but the grounds, rooms and general meetings areas were all clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Rooms Well Past Their Prime”
Reviews.Author: kikiwhite69
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in this Waldorf Astoria. While the public space was elegant and wonderful, the rooms were far from that. My room had stains on the carpets and draperies. The carpet had obviously been patched due to stains that couldn't be removed. There was a phone jack next to the toilet, there was easily a quarter inch of dust built up on the edge. The tub didn't drain properly so while you showered, you were standing in 2-3 inches of water. I will say the service was excellent as was the room service. But, the room was well below the standard of a four star/diamond establishment. The internet was a per day charge. I was happy that I was a premier customer with Hilton so that I didn't have to pay because it was spotty at best and non-existent at worst. The only two good things I can say about the room was the air conditioning was excellent and the bedding package was great. But, the housekeeping was poor. I stayed at another Hilton brand last year that was almost half the rate that was far superior to this hotel. The only reason I am giving the third bubble on this (as opposed to two) is because the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: alliecat1014
Reviews.Content: Had a convention here and everything was wonderful! My only complaint is no coffee in the rooms. But great food, great atmosphere, beautiful grounds, and A/C galore. Would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend-wedding venue”
Reviews.Author: SebastianDallas
Reviews.Content: We have a large family wedding at the Arizona Biltmore. It was wonderful for everyone to be in one place for all the activites; old folks, young folks, everyone was happy. The food and service was great. Summer rates were deeply discounted.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in every regard”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkinExile
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore is beautiful, relaxing, and exceptional in every regard. While the architect of record is Albert Chase McArthur, the environment displays the extraordinary talent of Frank Lloyd Wright, a "consultant". There is a visual and visceral tranquility unprecedented in the contemporary "top this" resort scene. Seven pools from kid friendly to book friendly. Foods option from the elegant "Wright Room" to "relaxed but excellent "Albert and Franks", to take out Starbucks Cafe. Great tip: last year we went the week before Christmas for low rates, a chiefs gingerbread competition, stunning Christmas decorations, and relaxing by fire-pits sipping tea and enjoying the Craftsmen's lanterns, Wright "Sprite" sculptures, garden and mountain views.

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful Hotel; rooms were a little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Miusa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and while I was very impressed with the public spaces of the facilities the rooms (I stayed in the Paradise Wing) were a big disappointment. As mentioned in many of the other reviews the public areas, grounds and without question the pools were spectacular. This a a Waldorf-Astoria property and with that name comes some pretty lofty expectations. While the above mentioned areas met those expectations the room itself did not. The Good: Great location, near downtown Phoenix, including the baseball and basketball arenas. The grounds were beautiful, the pools were spectacular and parking was convenient and plentiful. The ok: Service was spotty, some of the staff were very polite and professional and consistent with what you would expect at a 5-star hotel. Others were gruff and less helpful. One example: While checking in at 2:30 the clerk let me know that they didn't have a room available for me yet. He asked for a phone number to contact me when it was available which i provided. I politely asked when did he think the room would be ready and he replied, "just so you know check-in isn't guaranteed until 4pm." That wasn't my question. I wasn't in a rush to check in I just was wanted to plan my time accordingly. If he didn't know he could have just said 4pm. The disappointing: The room was very basic, the AC didn't cool the room very well. I called twice for service but they told me it was working as it should however it was uncomfortably warm for my taste and unpleasant to sleep. When I went to visit a colleague in her room it was much cooler than mine. The rooms only have wired internet service and the tab on the cable was broken so it kept falling out of the network jack on my laptop. There were no available outlets by the desk (the two existing outlets were taken by the lamp and modem). So I needed to use the laptop by the desk because of the cable but there was no outlet to plug the laptop in. I don't know why the hotel wouldn't use lamps with outlets built in like they have at almost every hotel I stay at these days. Finally, when I checked in the valet asked to park my car, he said it was free valet parking. So I said yes. Upon checkout I had a charge for $27. When I inquired at the front desk about the charge I was informed that free valet is only before (sometime I don't recall the exact time) and since I had left my car overnight I was charged the fee. That wasn't made clear at the time. Overall nice hotel and if the expectations were lower it might have been a 4 star rating instead of 3.

Reviews.Title: “Style, character and space”
Reviews.Author: Alinta B
Reviews.Content: - summary - This is a good hotel with a great feel. It is spacious, stylish and has character. - purpose - We attended for a conference and it suited that purpose very well. - buildings - It consists of historic parts and newer parts - we preferred and stayed in the main building. Some of this looks a bit tired, (80s or 90s tired rather than 30s tired). It is an historic building (Frank Lloyd Wright and all) - as evidenced by its reputation and by the framed newspaper cuttings. Unfortunately the history is often hidden, with an explanatory tour of the hotel for guests only occurring once a week. - location - It is not particularly close to anything because it was originally built to be out of town. Since then the town has caught up with it so where once (in the 30s) guests would have been surrounded by orchards or desert, it is now surrounded by suburbs (and a golf course). It still has a spacious desert feel. facilities - the facilities are good - the restaurants are excellent particularly breakfast. The staff are generally friendly and pleasant. The grounds are well kept so that this has a definite 'oasis' feel with lots of space.

Reviews.Title: “Overall just an average experience”
Reviews.Author: ftoader
Reviews.Content: Been to a conference here so I was pretty busy most of the time without enjoying the bar, restaurants or pools. They look pretty nice. However, I stayed in the Valley wing where the everything seems pretty old and tired. Doors still have the key knob, carpets are very used looking, same with bathrooms. There is no coffee maker and the snacks are extremely expensive. A small bottle of water (not even cold) is $8. A/C unit is noisy and has only ON/OFF manual controls. There was a lot of noise coming from the bathroom walls every time someone in the adjacent rooms was flushing or running water, or maybe their A/C units - God knows what some of those noises were. There is a resort fee of $28 per day that includes Wi-Fi in room. However, it was not working and after many tries I called the front desk to find out it was not working in the entire building. The cable was however working after calling the help desk again to figure it how to make it really work. The architecture of the resort is nice (Frank Lloyd design) but it is overrated and over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Pools & Layout”
Reviews.Author: kris1914
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Biltmore. The pools are gorgeous and the layout of the villas and the way the hotel is set up is very apartment/campus like but in a very upscale way. The grounds had a ton of space to have a picnic, play games and eat outdoors. The rooms could have been laid out much better but the overall it was a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Class”
Reviews.Author: herold1961
Reviews.Content: Service, Atmosphere, and History....One of the best. I admit my initial attraction was Frank Lloyd Wright, but the service, comfort and quality won me over!

Reviews.Title: “Great Spa!”
Reviews.Author: sydni b
Reviews.Content: I am an Arizona Resident who lives near the resort and happen to LOVE their spa! Each time you enter the Spa you are greeted with a friendly smile. They are very accommodating to any requests you may have. It is very quiet, soothing and peaceful. The locker rooms are nothing too fancy with, but have everything one may need. There are two of the BEST attendants in the women's locker room, Sylvia and Lisa. If you need anything at all they will happily accommodate the request! HANDS DOWN two of the nicest women I have encountered at a Spa! The treatments are always great! Spa Week is a great value. I would recommend a visit to their spa to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Elegantly HOT”
Reviews.Author: LynnandSam
Reviews.Content: Beautiful pools helped alleviate the temps. Food was good service was good hotel is beautiful and interesting. Our suite was large and had a little balcony, however, it was overdue for a renovation. The room was dated and there was no wireless access except in public areas. We were there for a meeting and even though it was a large group of various ages everything appeared to run smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: ualsdguy
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Biltmore every year and love it! Each time we've been there the staff are friendly, helpful and seem genuinely caring and concerned that our stay exceeds our expectations. We have stayed in a few different wings of the hotel (our favorite being the Ocatilla wing). The Ocatilla rooms are newer than the classic rooms, but every room we have been in has been extremely spaceous, with nice amenities and always spotless. Beds are very comfortable with feather pillows and down blankets. The architecture is amazing and the grounds are beautiful, staff waves and say hello when passing by. The water slide at the main pool is great fun! This is one of our favorite resorts to have our yearly "chill out" vacation. Everything you would ever need is at the resort and you would never have to leave if you didn't want to. Food choices and restaurants are wonderful albeit a bit pricey but to be expected at a resort. There are activities for kids as well as adults throughout the day and evening such as salsa making at the main pool, marshmallow roasting some evenings and more. We will continue to go back to the Biltmore and would not even consider another resort in Phoenix. The place is just amazing in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Wright way”
Reviews.Author: anselandyosemite
Reviews.Content: We had a stay at the Biltmore on our bucket list because of the Frank Lloyd Wright design work (not his but his student) and included with it a visit to Taliesian West. We thought it would be much pricer, but at the off season mid-Sept. rates we were very pleased to be able to do it now. This was a first class stay and the staff was incredible. We stayed in the recently redone Ocotilla buidling with the club benefits. The pool (there are 8 of them) was very clean and the pool service was super. We had dinner at Albert and Franks and the weekend prime rib may have been the best I've ever had. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families and friends”
Reviews.Author: oregongrrl
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Biltmore - the room was large, clean, and had a private patio where we enjoyed the late evenings. The grounds were beautiful and my mom and sister, who accompanied me on a four-day business trip, spent an entire day walking through the gardens and trying out the different pools (eight of them!). It's away from the central business district, but still close to shopping and some good restaurants, although you'll need a car since there is little within walking distance. Warning: a venti cup of morning Starbucks coffee at the Cafe will set you back $4.25 instead of the $2 you'd pay elsewhere but you can drink it on a patio overlooking an impossibly green lawn for a desert climate. Beds were comfortable, bath was adequate, and overall we had a great time here and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay for an architect lover - particularly FL Wright”
Reviews.Author: acodymass
Reviews.Content: Our two night stay at this historic, upscale hotel and resort was wonderful. The rooms have all the amenities one would expect from such a prestigious establishment. The entire staff was helpful and friendly. There are many spots on the grounds to sit and relax - to enjoy the Wright influenced architecture. The lobby reflects many of the man's best design principles.There are a golf course, shops, bars and restaurants on site. Pools are on various spots throughout the property. The only slight negative - the shower drained slowly and gradually filled. A call to service was not answered with attention to the problem by the next morning when showering in a puddle was repeated. But this was the only negative about an otherwise enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stop the smoking at the Pool!”
Reviews.Author: Americanbrazilian
Reviews.Content: We go annually to spend a week at the Biltmore in conjunction with business. The grounds are fantastic with kids, so much room to roam and a beautiful setting, however, last year the pool was overrun by conference attendees who hoarded around the shallow are of the main pool and the steps from the pool that has the water slide for kids and smoked incessantly. There was literally no place to move where you could be close to the shallow entrance with your kids and not be overcome by smoke. They really need to either make the entire pool are no smoking or at a minimum confine smokers to the other pool away from the shallow are where most kids play and can easily get in and out. You would think adults could figure this out on their own, but they did not and it made the late afternoons at the pool pretty unpleasant for those who have children. The spa/gym closes too early, but some of the locker room attendees were particularly pleasant and helpful. Otherwise we love going to this place. The rooms outside of the main hotel are big enough to accommodate families with kids and you cannot beat the weather and location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ecmerrif
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biltmore for 2 nights for our 1-year wedding anniversary. We had such a great time enjoying the pool, restaurants, wine tasting, and local attractions. The staff is phenomenal and the history of the hotel (built in the late-20's!) makes it a unique and truly classic place. The hotel is full of old photographs including those of all the presidents who have stayed there (Hoover-George!). Be sure to go to Frank&Albert's happy hour....their meatloaf sliders are to die for!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning resort hotel with attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: NatureGoddess
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference, and was really impressed by the service and the facilities. The grounds and buildings are lovely, the pools are clean, the bar and restaurant service is good. A very nice place to spend a week or a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Made to feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: vacationx2
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the 4th of July. It as a great time. The staff we very friendly, and gave us some great recommendations for restaurants. The architecture of the hotel was grand and kept perfectly, The grounds were kept quite well, and were nice to walk around. The room was nice and kept clean. Parking was very limited near the hotel, so if you don't mind walking, there is plenty in the garage. The pool area was cramped, and not kept very clean. Cups, dishes, and trash was left and often not cleaned will the next day. The included breakfast was amazing. Red velvet pancakes are impressive and will keep you going all day. We rented a car a drove ourselves all over to see the sights. It was totally worth it. We knew it was going to be hot, so we planned accordingly with our activates. The gem was the restaurant 'the Barrio' the concierge recommended- great margaritas and excellent happy hour tacos. That alone was worth the trip. The spa had some nice areas and always had ice water and space in the lounge. The staff was very pleasant and always accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “The Arizona Biltmore has the IT factor...”
Reviews.Author: kaluss
Reviews.Content: I just love this place...have stayed here 2x before and for me, there is just something about it that puts me in a very relaxed frame of mind. The grounds are beautiful, there is nice scenery, good places to take walks, the staff is very nice and I have decided it just has that certain something that some places don't have....the intangible. And that's what makes it special. If you're going through reviews wondering if you should make a reservation here....do it, you will not be disappointed. This place is great and they know how to run a resort. Have only come here with solo or with my wife so not sure if it would be a hit with the kiddies...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: KYtraveler79
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Arizona Biltmore early September and it was wonderful. The grounds were spacious and stunning. The pools were large with many chairs and lots of umbrellas for shade. The room was nice... not the best I've ever been in but very nice. The heat was biggest complaint so I'll be going during the winter months on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: osodoro
Reviews.Content: The grounds are beautiful. The Ocotilla Club is wonderful. Rooms are very well appointed. Our meals were good, not great. Service poolside was awful. It took 1.5 hours to get our meal. We were there the same weekend as a large college-aged conference. Ruined our stay. They were very noisy and partied until the wee hours. They also turned the pool area into a frat party. The golf was good but not great. Spa was OK but small. With all of the top-flight resort option available in the Phoenix-Scottsdale area the Biltmore seems to be relying on its past to make up for its present short-comings. Try the Boulders, Four Seasons, Phoenician, Hyatt Gainey Ranch, Camelback Inn, or even the Wigwam instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: kbshoop
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a relaxing weekend and it delivered. The Ocotillo section of the hotel has great rooms and gives you access the lounge for food and drinks. The concierge in the lounge, Leo, was excellent and really helped us enjoy the weekend. There was always something to do on the property, the food was good and the staff was overly friendly everywhere we went. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Sbaz040
Reviews.Content: Good: nice looking hotel and good location. Bad: sinks pumped up yellow liquid with black flakes and didnt drain. I called the front desk and had them send someone up in 1 hour since i had guests till then, he arived 10 minutes later, i was embarressed. We made plans for an engineer to stop by at 3 pm, he got there at 6 pm, again when we had guests, after 3 days it still hasent be fixed. The front desk offered to downgrade me to a different room. Every 15 minutes the TV goes to channel 00, kind of annoying when your trying to watch football.

Reviews.Title: “The good; the bad; the ugly”
Reviews.Author: HLICguy
Reviews.Content: The Good: >OCOTILLO was beautiful and run well...Leo and Kim were outstanding and Hilton should be delighted to have them. We felt the rooms were nice; the Executive Club was well run (obviously Leo/Kim were involved). Book your room in the Ocotillo if possible! >Rob (server) also did a good job at the Ocotillo but his "historic tour" of the Biltmore was outstanding--make sure you do your tour with him! Wow what great history >The bar restaurant was good for lunch---good servers and we enjoyed being in there >Appreciate Shane, in management, trying to resolve some issues we had--never got totally resolved but he tried The Bad: >Cleaning of the rooms were off; never did the 'evening turn down' even when called to do so. Plus we felt that the towels were worn and needed to be replaced. >No protein at breakfast in the Executive room--NONE!! Come on add yogart; cheese; and maybe some hard boiled eggs---all sweets and all carbs---those were good and we ate them but they really need to cater to guests with some good proteins! The Ugly: >First day the hotel let in a dog to the Executive room--said it had papers to do so but no collar to say that; they let the dog run without restraint and the dog ate off the plate of the woman who brought the dog into a public room were people ate; NOT GOOD!!! >The pool area management and the Spa management is and was TERRIBLE!! Never seen something so poorly run and managed. >The therapist were NOT GOOD---spoiled with our therapist back home but this was one of the most expensive and most poorly done therapy's we have ever had. For a resort like Biltmore this is a real issue! Plus total miscommunication in what they were to do and they seemed not to care. Be careful with the spa. >The Spa was so bad that ALL of our services were TERRIBLE--management tried to resolve it but it never worked--to pay that much money for service that was not good is not right. Seemed to be allowed by management to get away with it even tho we were compensated. Poorly run for sure! >We had a horrible time with the man at the main pool in assisting us--he put it all on us to do something that clearly was his responsible to do. Little service or concern for the guest. >The work out gym needs new equipment and new cardio machines--it is dirty inside and the locker rooms were well worn--for a 5 Star there needs to be some monies put into this >The issue is service--there were few guests here the week we were here and the pool and Spa service got worst and worst as we were there. Again little attention given to guests or serving them. To us this starts with the leadership in the Spa/Pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Still a jewel of the desert”
Reviews.Author: maelpielUsa
Reviews.Content: We ended our soccer trip with our teens staying one night at the Arizona Biltmore. It was a pleasant surprise to find the hotel so well maintained, and we got a great price due to the low season. Great pool. Definitely worth a visit even if you are not staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great summer rates - I will be back, despite unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: whosaidso8
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore is a historic hotel/resort with lots of character. You walk into a time-machine because of decor and the feel of the place. While historic, it does have a nice spa, fabulous swimming pools (I think three on site), and current amenities, including flat screen TVs. I enjoyed my stay, overall, but I was very disappointed with the front desk staff. They were unfriendly! The bell staff, and the spa staff were great, but the front desk staff left much to be desired. Tips: - If you want a new, contemporary decor, this may not be the place. - The resort charges upwards of $25 a night resort fee. I associated this with the use of (wired) internet service. It would be nice if it were wireless. - The resort is near the Biltmore shopping area and restaurants. We had a nice meal at True Food - good food, mediocre service.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad & the ugly”
Reviews.Author: Pastorkenaz
Reviews.Content: The good... world class service throughout the resort... from bellmen to wait staff and pool bar to front desk everyone was helpful and went out of their way to make us feel special. When the bell staff found out it was our anniversary they sent chocolate covered strawberries and champagne to the room. Thodor, Bellman; was AWESOME! The first room we were sent to was nothing like described on the Biltmore's website. It smelled of mold and overall was dismal. Thodor got on the phone, called the manager and we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite. The bad: For such a highly rated restaurant; Frank and Albert's food was mediocre. The pizza my wife ordered was bland and unimaginative. I've had better frozen pizzas. The Arizona cheese curds were a nice treat; at least the first third. After that the cup they were presented in was filled with grease. Even 3 napkins couldn't dry them enough to make them edible. The website is so outdated it should be taken down. They're advertising a fabulous Sunday brunch at Wrights restaurant; which by the way has been closed for renovation for some time. The ugly: No pride in their property. Where do I begin? The suite: The carpet was filthy. I'm not talking about a little dirt or a few spots. The carpet behind the door and along room edges was off white, nice and clean while the traffic areas were dark and grimy. The sheer curtains dark and dirty at the bottom edges. The spots ranged from black to yellow and red (I'm still trying to figure out what the red and yellow might be)....Crumbs were found in my coffee cup at Frank and Albert's. The plate was dirty - yes, this can happen from time-to-time at Denny's, but at a 5 star resort, really? Along the pathway plastic bottle of water was there for more than a day. Saturday evening a pair of black socks were added and remained well into Monday morning. Still not sure they've ever been picked up. Question: Has money gotten so tight at the Arizona Biltmore they can now pinch a penny and make 6 feet of copper wire? If you're looking for great service; this is the place. If you're looking for a property that matches the service; I'd look somewhere else. Overall - I'd give it a 3.

Reviews.Title: “Improvement needed”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth A
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and the hotel is not like what my husband remembered.....limited service around the pool, shortened time on the water slide and disgruntled staff. Its called a resort and spa, but I would not call it that. Connie the aquatics instructor was rude and disrespectful, she does not belong at the Biltmore. On the positive side, the food and service were fabulous at Frank and Alberts, would go back to the restaurant again, the chef came by and asked how everything was!! Seems like the slow economy has effected the service at the Arizona Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds and pool, however parking, food prices, and room noise from air conditioner ruined the pleasant atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: toughone
Reviews.Content: We rented a pool side cabana with a friend, it had it's own bathroom and refrigerator. Outside food was not allowed, so we indulged on free chips and salsa that is available on Sat. Afternoon by the pool. A bucket of 6 beer ran us $32 a bucket and an appetizer was $17.50 (yikes). The parking was the worst, even if you use valet. The rooms looked great, until you were woken up every 45min by the air conditioning noise. It sounded like a cement drill. Last but not least, no coffee pot in room, and a sm coffee ran you $4. , an appetizer was

Reviews.Title: “Family reunion rocked @ The Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: VacationSidMeister
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion for about 100 members of our family at the Arizona Biltmore over a 3 day weekend last December. Needless to say, the resort grounds were breathtaking, and very relaxing! We absolutely loved the outdoors. We all had rooms in the Ocotillo wing. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. The Ocotillo lounge with breakfast and all day coffee and tea service was a start attraction for our family:) We did not eat at the hotel's restaurants so can't review them. But all that we experienced was very nice. The one problem we had was that when we initially approached the hotel to book our reunion, we made clear to them that we have lots of kids - and they assured us they 'love families and kids'. But during our 3 day stay, we got the evil eye from other guests over our let's call it the kids' enthusiasm and inability to whisper 24/7. That put a damper on the mood at times.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: fasiVirginia
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Arizona Biltmore. We were taking our daughter to Arizona State University. The service is incredible and the grounds are beautiful. The location was perfect. Very easy to go back and forth to ASU and very close to a very nice mall with great shopping and great restaurants. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa - it was very spacious, beds were very comfortable, but it was a little dated. However, I would stay there again. The food at the resort was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort...”
Reviews.Author: iq1012
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my colleagues' recommendation(s) for my business trips. This resort was almost 7-8 miles from the airport as compared to other resorts close to airport. Resort has lot of history , many celebrities and politicians graced this resort with their stay here and it is clearly visible of those records. One thing you notice clearly the moment your car enters this resort is the spread of the resort as well how beautifully every part of the resort is arranged. Lobby is all surrounded by restaurants and some shopping places... Lounges have sweet view of the water fountains and lush green gardens...Rooms are big , but not necessarily clean in sound proofing... Bed are very comfortable. As a business traveler only thing I found missing was WIFI , there i internet but it is wired one. ! Again this a resort and you are not expected to use internet in the bed I guess ;) Be advised , if you are ordering in room for desserts, Chocolate cake is highly recommended... :) Overall a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise. The view of Piestewa Peak from the courtyard was amazing.”
Reviews.Author: lcworth
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, lodging was very comfortable. Pool was amazing. Sitting around the courtyard at night with a bottle of wine was my favorite part.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DarrylBElkRiver_MN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at the Arizona Biltmore Hotel and were very disappointed. We were looking forward to spending time in a luxury hotel and chose this hotel because of its star rating. The quality of our room and professionalism of staff were not what we expected. Desk clerks were very unfriendly and rude when additional questions were asked regarding our reservation. Directions to our room were poor and the map provided was vague (it is a very large hotel). Our cottage room was small, old and smelled extremely musty. Previous to our stay at the AZ Biltmore we spent five nights at the Radisson and were very pleased with our experience at half the price of this hotel. There are so many other beautiful hotels in the Phoenix area within the same price range as the AZ Biltmore and I would suggest you go there...The Phoenician knows how to treat their guests like royalty! It would be a much better choice (we went there 2 years ago and loved it). Don't make the same mistake as us:(

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to bring the puppies.”
Reviews.Author: MissEileen
Reviews.Content: We live local in the Phoenix area. So on a 105 degree day when our a/c decided to go out, my husband and I decided it would be resort day. But we also had our two dogs with us. Being a Sunday, we started to check out "pet friendly resorts". We were thrilled to find that the Biltmore was one of them. We called, made the reservation, and spoke with them about their pet policy. We arrived at the hotel, puppies and kennel in tow and were very warmly greeted. Well, actually the dogs got the warmest greeting, from EVERYONE!!!! We had a wonderful room, in their "cottages". We were able to have plenty of room for the dogs and their kennels in the room. What was really wonderful about the cottage area is that they placed us in the back and there was a wonderful paddock for the dogs to run in that was enclosed with a gate. Being it August in Phoenix, the resort was not at capacity so we were able to walk the dogs and play with them on the lawns. They loved it and so did we. They also had a room service selection for the pets. I did not want to divert from their diet, so our dogs didn't get it, but I am sure it was fantastic. The puppies sure did love resort day and because they did, we were able to.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic property, but service and maintenance issues do not deserve the Waldorf Astoria name”
Reviews.Author: TheHighwayWarrior
Reviews.Content: This is a tough hotel to review. I stayed there for five nights at the end of July and beginning of August. The property is absolutely beautiful, and it's worth seeing even if you don't stay there. I had looked forward to my stay at the hotel for a long time, and thankfully it's beautiful enough that I was able to overcome the poor service and maintenance issues. The big problem with this hotel is probably that it's in the Waldorf Astoria portfolio. This is supposed to be the flagship Hilton brand with exceptional customer service. The reality is far different. I had a room in the Terrace Court area, and the first thing I encountered was that the air conditioner could not adequately cool the room. The second thing I noticed was minor maintenance issues around the room and the bathroom, such as peeling wallpaper on walls, peeling paint on the ceiling, and a door that didn't close. It's not a huge issue, but at a Waldorf Astoria property these kinds of things should be dealt with immediately. Finally, there were some serious customer service problems attempting to get towels at the pool. After making several calls, visiting the front desk, and waiting more than an hour, we still didn't have towels at the pool...instead we just had excuses from resort staff who seemed apathetic and unwilling to accept responsibility for the problems. It took well over and hour and a second trip up to the front desk for the hotel staff to finally admit to the service problems. Finally, the rooms don't have wireless internet. I was staying at the hotel for a business conference, and everyone in my room had to keep sharing the one wired internet port. I understand this is an old resort, but as a Waldorf Astoria property and at the rates they charge, there's no excuse to not have wireless in all the rooms by 2011. This could be a world class hotel if they would maintain the rooms better and if they could get the communications and customer service issues under control with the hotel staff. My stay overall was poor, but because of the beauty of the property grounds and main building, I'm bumping my rating up to average. One thing worth mentioning is the restaurant - Frank & Albert's. It's absolutely amazing. Go to the restaurant regardless of if you stay at the hotel or not.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at your own risk”
Reviews.Author: lkhes03
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion at The Az Biltmore over Memorial Day weekend. My family of 6 had 2 rooms for 5 nights. I am from Phx and stay at the hotel often as my Dad lives within walking distance to the hotel. This is the second year in a row that a large conference has taken over the hotel when we were there. This year it was the recovered cocaine addicts. The cigarette smoke haze permeated the pool and public areas- and the noise was unceasing. When I complained to management they acted like "oh really we hadn't noticed, well they will be gone soon" The management of the Waldorf Astoria group would never have their family stay in such conditions. Unfortunately we will stay elsewhere next year.

Reviews.Title: “One of the prettiest resorts I've been to.”
Reviews.Author: PlanninPaula
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, manicured property. Guest rooms were updated, and luxurious. Big comfortable beds. Staff was professional, and on point. Even though we did not frequent them all, there were several pools on site. We were there for the All Star Game, and really made the experience memorable all around. We received 5 Star treatment!

Reviews.Title: “Great historic hotel, be prepared to pay!”
Reviews.Author: 918fortravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biltmore August 1-6th. Even though we live in Arizona, this was our first time to the Biltmore. It is a beautiful, historic hotel and resort that is tucked away quietly in the middle of a busy city. We were there for a conference and were lucky to be able to secure a very good rate for the room. I was very excited to be staying there for the first time! The grounds are beautiful and it was amazing to see the photos on the wall of the resort in its prime! There were so many very cool people who have stayed there and this resort is certainly part of our heritage in our beautiful state. The staff was very friendly upon check-in. When I went to my room, I was under-whelmed to say the least. It did have a very nice view of the golf course, but was extremely dated and very worn. I checked out a friends room, only three doors down and was interested to learn that he had a nicely renovated room. Since I was planning on having a young visitor I asked the front desk if I could have a new room. They were very helpful and showed me a few rooms until I found one that was more suitable for my needs. I got help from a nice bellman and got all my stuff to a new room. I thought I was in heaven until I saw that there was no soap in my room and there were used towels in the bathroom. I tried to find a member of the cleaning staff who could understand my desire to have the room cleaned and finally found someone who understood what I was trying to say. I then left for awhile to go to class. When I returned to the room I thought it was hot, so turned down the A/C. Nothing, still very, very hot in the room. I then went rinse something out in the sink and the plunger broke, not allowing the water to drain. I called the front desk and the sent someone immediately to fix the stuff. He quickly fixed the sink and said he thought it may take awhile for the room to cool down. A short while later I got a call from the front desk to ensure that everything had been fixed. I told them that the sink got fixed, but the room was still very hot! The immediately offered to give me another room. So, once again, I packed back up and moved to a very close room. This one had working A/C and was heaven! That night I went to bed and hear the toilet running constantly. I was embarrassed to call the front desk and complain again, so I left a note for the maid. When I came back to my room the toilet was fixed. However, one flush and it broke again. Again, I was tired of complaining, so I took the lid off the tank to see what the problem was. The toilet needed a new flushing mechanism. I ended up leaving the lid off the tank the entire time and literally lifting the chain to manually flush the toilet. We ate several times at the Frank and Albert's restaurant. The food was fantastic each time, but holy cow the prices! $4 for a soda.....really? If you go to this restaurant, please ask for VICTORIA! She was one of the best servers we have had anywhere. Very helpful and friendly. She helped us entertain our young daughter and went out of her way to ensure we were happy. I guess that people who are fortunate enough to stay there and pay the normal rate don't blink an eye at a $50 breakfast, but for us it was a bit steep. The food, like I said was great, but a bit much for our budget. I will come back for special occasions for sure though! All in all it was a really fun stay. It was great to stay in a hotel with so much history and the architecture was beautiful. I am a huge Frank Lloyd Wright fan, so big thrill to stay here. There are some really great restaurants nearby, check out DELUX and REVOburrito for sure!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Jmobileguy
Reviews.Content: 8 of us college buddies went to phoenix for a golf outing...we booked one two room suite and two regular rooms. when we arrived in our suite, it was completely undone, the room had not been done up yet. there was still dry cleaning wrappers and towels thrown about. after letting them know of the situation, they moved us to another suite, but this was only going to be a one room suite. so we moved, not only was this a major let down, but the suite (both of them) still had tube style tv's...how does this type of property still have tube style tvs i still don't understand. Then to top it off, no air conditioning in phoenix in July :( We ended up spending just over $7,000 on property and would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Grande Dame with Excellent Manners”
Reviews.Author: CCKlyman
Reviews.Content: The decor is standard 1980's high end resort, but the rooms are huge, the bathrooms luxurious and the service impeccable. Our room was in a nondescript building a short walk from the main edifice, but the view form the large window was magnificent. We had our own, very private pool, and overall the experience was lovely. We felt very pampered. There is a shopping mall nearby, but most of the good shopping is a hike. You definitely need to rent a car. I would recommend this venue for the business traveler and older vacationers who want comfortable, familiar surroundings. It might be a little stuffy for children.

Reviews.Title: “I'm Going Back Again!”
Reviews.Author: suekapec
Reviews.Content: We planned a trip to visit our son in Arizona and thought we'd spend one night at the Biltmore before seeing him. We called the hotel the day we arrived to say we missed our flight and would be arriving later. We wanted to stay in the oldest section of the hotel and have a fabulous meal at the Wright's restaurant.
