We were very disappointed when we arrived because the oldest section of the hotel and restaurant were closed for renovation just two days earlier....They automatically upgraded our room and sent us chocolates (which were delicious) with a handwritten note. Telling the wonderful young woman who was our waitress at Frank and Albert's restaurant (forgot her name) about our disappointments, she introduced us to one of the waiters from Wrights, who introduced us to Jason, the Sous Chef who made us a special appetizer that we would have experienced if Wright's was open! I want to thank everyone at the Biltmore for their personal attention and care. Thank you to Tim who somehow always bumped into us and made us feel loved. Thank you to Becky for a fabulous tour. I'd recommend this hotel to everyone. We will return again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great historical resort”
Reviews.Author: funreviewing
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a modern, new resort, this is not the place. This resort has a long history of high class, resort level experience. All but one president has stayed here since the opening in the 20s. Our rooms were fair and older but very clean and comfortable. Big TVs and great beds and a patio next to the pool. Great for the kids. The grounds are immaculate. Clean. Service throughout was awesome with exception of the little cafe. These girls were all fairly rude and short with customers. Most people didn't seem to care as they wanted quick and accurate service. Elsewhere, Biltmore service is true RESORT service. The place is beautiful and really enjoyed the history throughout.

Reviews.Title: “A Steal In The Summer”
Reviews.Author: KatieKatz
Reviews.Content: If you like retro/luxe surroundings, interesting people-watching, a fun pool and an atmosphere that transports you to another time and place, this is the place to go in the heat of the summer. We rendezvoused with family members at the Biltmore on a weekend in mid-July. The hotel was very sparsely occupied and rates were exceptionally low because it was the off-season in Phoenix. The hotel is a unique jewel, with its historic facilities and grounds. The rooms are spacious and luxurious; we got a great deal on a room with a balcony overlooking the nearby mountain. Service was good. The prices for amenities, parking and food/beverages were outlandish, so plan ahead. There is no in-room coffee. Plan to spend $17 on a martini at the bar, and the same amount on a cup of coffee with an egg sandwich at the patio cafe. But if you get up early, even in the summer, it's worth it to sit with friends and chat, surrounded by an incredible green lawn, shops selling exquisite (to affordable) accessories (like sun hats) and the Phoenix Mountains rising in the background.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Stay-cation”
Reviews.Author: jtallman23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I needed some rest and relaxation from the daily grind. Summer rates at swanky hotels like the AZ Biltmore are remarkable. So we took advantage and stayed at the Biltmore. The distinct Frank Lloyd Wright architecture sets the atmosphere apart from any other place immediately giving you a sense that you are somewhere special. The hotel benefits from some rich history (if you are interested of course) as well as immaculate grounds and great services. Room service is provided by gentlemen on old-fashioned bicycles. But you should really get out of the room at some point and enjoy the lush pool area, to notch spa, and tasteful Frank & Albert's. If you are in the mood for drinks and a romantic walk with your significant other you need not go far a Wright Bar provides the libations. And the beautiful grounds will do the rest. The AZ Biltmore is still luxurious, still romantic, and still a top destination for out of towners and in-towners alike.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: daymeeyan
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms as we were in town for my graduation ceremony at the University of Phoenix. The staff was extremely friendly and congratulated me on every chance they got. We valeted our vehicle and the team our front could not have been more prompt and helpful. The front desk never missed a beat even though we had a couple special requests. It was a pleasure to speak to staff as they knew how to treat their guests. The room we had was very spacious. Bathroom equipped with walk in shower and large bathtub, 2 sinks, and vanity area. Air conditioning worked so well that we were cold and had to turn it down. Free wired internet in the rooms, wifi in the lobby. Even the balcony was a nice size. Our favorite part of the resort was the pool area. You can rent cabanas. There's a full bar and waitresses will serve you when you are in the pool. Almost like a mini Las Vegas style pool club. We had fun just hanging out by the pool. The rest of the resort gardens are well cared for. Just walking around makes you feel like you are in another place. Some of the architecture takes you back to the 1920s as it keeps its historic charm. I think we will definitely try to make it back here on our next trip to Phoenix.

Reviews.Title: “I am back!!!”
Reviews.Author: JULESVERNE66
Reviews.Content: WOW! Just when I thought things could not get any better at the Biltmore, they did! I was there during the all star game with all the high dollar players around and the hotel was definitively at DEFCOM 5. It was great! I had a terrific room great service but most of all Frank and Albert's was the biggest surprise. That restaurant is so accommodating!! They were packed and I asked the waiter if I could get a special dish on the side. No problem chef made it to order. He actually came out to ask me if that was how I liked it and wanted to know if there was anything he could do to make it better! I told him it was so Delicious and thanked him. Guess what? Since I ate it all, he went back into the kitchen and made more! YOU cant go wrong eating or staying here! Infact, I am staying there this whole week! I LOVE the Biltmore and its staff!

Reviews.Title: “Frank & Alberts”
Reviews.Author: sandi07246
Reviews.Content: We had the very best waitress at Frank & Alberts names Cheryl-she was smiling all the time, made us feel right at home and the service she gave us was top notch-how lucky you are to have her-she is a doll and will miss her smiling face-give her a raise! Customers from Michigan!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and amenities to match the architecture”
Reviews.Author: SBAvanti63
Reviews.Content: We just returned from six fabulous days at the Arizona Biltmore. Although I had to leave most days for our Elks convention meetings, my wife was able to enjoy the facilities to the fullest. Our accomodations were very comfortable and luxurious - making us feel quite at home, but with the amenities you expect from an outstanding resort. The many staff we encountered were friendly, helpful and attentive to serving us as guests. The grounds are beautiful and well-maintained. You cannot help but be taken in by the look and architectural style of the property. There were many other members of the Elks staying there and not once did I hear a word of discontent. Our thanks to everyone at the Arizona Biltmore for making our week so spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Another great trip to the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: kccare
Reviews.Content: I havent been back to the Biltmore in a few years. The renovations they have done to the resort are great! Loved Frank and Alberts and if you are going to try the spa I reccommend the sugar scrub. I have always loved this resort and it seems to get better each year.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting 50s Hollywood feel.”
Reviews.Author: NazanYar
Reviews.Content: The biltmore is a nice hotel in metropolitan Phoenix. Easy access to anything in the area, which is a plus. Even though we came in the summer, conventions were going on, so I can understand several of the previous posts- be prepared at peak times. The rooms are pretty standard for an upscale hotel. The setting is nice, but in June it's a little hot to wander around. I thought the scheduled activities were interesting and well-planned. Note that in summer the pool is bath water hot.

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like Home”
Reviews.Author: TMah88
Reviews.Content: I am from Phoenix, but now live in Boston. I stay at the Biltmore whenever I am in town visiting family. I love that I always see familiar faces at the spa and restaurant...even by the pool. There's nothing more comforting than knowing I can go right from lounging by the pool, throw on something quick to wear and head over to Frank and Alberts for a beautiful dinner. The restaurant has a gorgeous patio that has a great resort feel to it, while maintaining some of that ambiance characteristic of the desert. At night. the outdoor firepit makes it the most ideal place for a quiet dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Cheff Todd is amazing”
Reviews.Author: tomguza
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of joining a group of friends for a special dinner in the banquet kitchen. What an incredible experience! Chef Todd and his staff took excellent care of us. The food was amazing - catered to our tastes. The wine accompaniments were excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place--Will Be Back Despite a Few Small Kinks”
Reviews.Author: Grmpmbl
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore is an outstanding hotel with an outstanding staff. The "kinks" that I mention in my title have to do with some troublesome, minor details, but ones that the management might want to consider. I'd been advised by friends who had been there many times to ask for a room in one of the "Cottages." Despite my having been assured that I was connected to the hotel desk when I called, the person I spoke with had no knowledge whatsoever of the cottages--and in fact, she thought I meant the Villas, which are very expensive and very different from cottages. When my husband and I arrived and made our way from the parking garage, we passed through--guess what?--many buildings labeled "cottages." The front desk was puzzled by this gaffe, and we will try again the next time we visit. Although we had a lovely and large room in the Valley wing (and I agree with the person bemoaning the lack of in-room coffee), there is as of this writing no wireless at the hotel, a problem if you have a laptop such as a Macbook Air with no ethernet port. This was very surprising, and a clerk agreed: she said, "This is 2011, right?" When my husband turned on the water to take a shower (fortunately, he turned on the water from outside the tub), the entire shower head--one of those large "rain" shower head--flew off the connection and into the tub and then into the bathroom. Had he been in the shower at the time, well..... The staff members were eager to make things right when we brought things to their attention. (We hadn't mentioned the shower...) Our keys demagnetized four times--no exaggeration, despite our keeping them away from cell phones, coins, etc.--and when we went to the clerk yet again to have them fixed, the clerk said that such problems were not acceptable and, to our surprise, gave us a small but appreciated credit on our bill. SO...while there were glitches, we'd still go back. The staff members were eager to please, and the place is lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Bloody Mary's were yummy....”
Reviews.Author: mckmetal8
Reviews.Content: Girls Road trip to Phoenix... our girl friend recently bought a house in Phoenix and so we came to celebrate, decorate, play in her new town.. The AZ Biltmore is listed as one of the 1,000 places to see before you die so we HAD to go.. It was about 102 and we were thirsty.. so we ducked in, the architecture is amazing, decor and BLOODY's just hit the spot. great lounge chairs AC blasting.. and MOLLY at the bar was great. loved Molly's glasses....so check it out, check it off the list of historical sites and knock one back in the heat..

Reviews.Title: “All around great 4th of July weekend!!!!”
Reviews.Author: martinezkatherine056
Reviews.Content: We started the weekend with Brunch at Wrights with 2 other couples. The food and service were WONDERFUL, but the manager Mo was fantastic! He made our morning. We were able to check in early to our room in the Ocotillo Wing. The room was beautiful, but being able to go and have drinks in the lounge area before the concert even better. We met the Bikini Chef, Susan Irby who had given cooking classes at the Biltmore that weekend. She signed and had delivered her cookbook to us when we checked out the next day. I hope she returns so we can go to her class. The concert with Jeff Bridges was out of this world, and to top off the evening fireworks. We hope to make this an annual 4th of July event.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with fantastic grounds and giant rooms”
Reviews.Author: Janey-Sue26
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant stay in Arizona Biltmore for 3 days - room was spacious and beds small but comfortable. Got a great rate through my travel agent. Didn't like the wildness at the pool in the afternoons - screaming teenagers and empty plastic drink cups did not match the lovely settings. HUNDREDS of soiled beach towels further wasted the atmosphere and the ability to gain a sunbed - why not charge a nominal deposit, say $10, that might encourage people to tidy up? All in all a lovely hotel, a bit let down by it's rowdy guests. Would stay there again, possibly during the week when it will be quieter.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST place to stay this summer!”
Reviews.Author: Kerry_T_2011
Reviews.Content: The service was OVER THE TOP! The staff made our anniversary celebration perfect!! The room was luxurious! We stayed in the Ocotillo area with a room overlooking the pool. The all-inclusive plan included meals, so we celebrated our anniversary dinner at Frank & Albert's. It was fabulous! David was our server and was very friendly. We ordered lunch poolside at the Cabana, and once again, the food was fabulous! The Ocotillo accomodations allowed us to enter the lounge any time of the day for refreshments, a great getaway in the middle of the day (or night!). We will DEFINITELY come back, and we will DEFINITELY spread the word!!! It was a memorable celebration! THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, Accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: taves7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Biltmore in the Valley Terrace (or whatever) building. I enjoyed my stay here. The grounds and main building are beautiful and the pools are nice and well-kept. The main pool area has a bar and waitresses. I did notice that toward the end of the day towels would not be cleaned up and new guests arriving to the pool would have difficulties getting a fresh towel. I was at the Biltmore for a conference and the conference areas were more than adequate. The food was good and the waiters were very polite and attentive. I also managed to take a walking tour of the grounds led by Travis and it was an amazing tour! I would stay here again for leisure if I could provided there was no big conference scheduled. My conference took over the hotel. Regular guests were probably overwhelmed. One last thing--I went to the cafe and gift shop often to buy breakfast/drinks. OVERPRICED. $3.50 for an 8 oz. water is not a good deal. And $5 for a croissant is highway robbery.

Reviews.Title: “Just when you thought it couldn't get better......”
Reviews.Author: SpencerourCavalier
Reviews.Content: As a past Phoenician who has had the pleasure of enjoying th Arizona Biltmore since I was a child with my grandparents, staying there this past June (2011) wasanother incredible experience to add to my vacation memoirs. As a child, we always spent weekends at the Biltmore during the summer and had brunch in the Gold Room almost every Sunday. For more than 30 years I have been in awe of this jewel in the desert. with it's perfectly manicured gardens, lawn croquet and chess, multiple pools and wonderful Frank Lloyd Wright influence. It has always transported me back in time....movie stars, presidents and locals alike have always come here to relax in luxury. The back veranda facing what used to be called Squaw Peak was a favorite place to lounge and play backgammon while my grandfather drank martinis and I had a Shirley Temple. Fast forward thirty years and the new influence of the Waldorf Astoria ownership has made this jewel the Tiffany's of AZ resorts. Now I drink the martinis with my partner and my friends but we still have the same gorgeous view and we still play backgammon on the back veranda. From the friendliest staff, pool attendants, housekeeping, the wonderful spa and of so comfy rooms....they are even better than before. You can even bring your dog who will enjoy its very own special menu too. Our Cavalier King Charles puppy loved staying there too! His first hotel experience was at the Arizona Biltmore. So the next time you visit Phoenix....I encourage you to hand yourself over to the Arizona Biltmore because just when I thought a hotel experience couldn't get better, it was more exquisite than ever before......the Arizona Biltmore is the crown jewel for us. My partner and I made a promise to each other on June 11, 2011 while on the veranda playing backgammon, that for as long as we live....we will always come back and spend one week every summer at this magical desert resort. Peter Houle Philadelphia, PA

Reviews.Title: “Love this historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruffwriter
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel -- the architecture is fabulous and grounds are beautiful. Love the bar areas and the food is very good in the restaurant. The staff is very friendly and does a great job. My only complaint is no in-room coffee. That would be perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A specatacular treat for the jaded business traveler”
Reviews.Author: SixthSister
Reviews.Content: My travels take me to cities all over the US and I'm usually booked into chains ranging from Sleep Inn to Marriott and Hilton. So a conference at the Biltmore was a true treat for me. From surprisingly excellent service - I was able to check in to my room at 8:30am! - to the serene environment both indoors and out, this was the most peaceful, relaxed business stay I've ever had. Every staff member I met in passing made eye contact and greeted me. Food choices throughout the resort were delicious. Reclining under the awnings and people-watching was fabulous. Rooms were decorated with real wood furnishings and live plants. My windows opened and overlooked one of eight pool areas. I didn't see a motor vehicle on the grounds during my entire stay. The architecture and history were intriguing. Conference catering and special events was outstanding. I can't say enough good things about this establishment and their well-trained staff who obviously enjoy their jobs. Normally when I'm away on business I long to be home, but this time I wished my visit was longer (2 days wasn't enough) and I hope to return one day when I can truly enjoy all the splendid Arizona Biltmore has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: christianne60
Reviews.Content: Very dated, dirty carpet and drapes. Unfriendly staff. It must have been a beautiful hotel at one time. It is run down and extremely dated. I'm shocked that they can't even touch up the paint or replace the carpet. Don't waste your money staying here. We arrived at 10 PM with 2 starving children and were told the restaurant just closed and there is nothing we can feed you? I was told there is no free breakfast for Hilton Gold members because this is a resort not a Homewood Suites. Not a classy place, like I expected the Waldorf Astoria to be.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Susan6971
Reviews.Content: This is truly a unique hotel. Great rooms. Great spa/workout facilities/pools. Great food. Parking was far away from rooms however and the map of the different buildings could be better to include the pathways so you don't get lost. Overall it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, but Better for On Property Events/Meetings”
Reviews.Author: BoysInNY
Reviews.Content: As loyal HHonors member, I was excited to stay at the Arizona Biltmore given its prominence as a hotel in the Waldorf Astoria Collection. I had not stayed at the hotel prior, and was unsure of what to expect of the resort, particularly considering that I was not attending any events at the hotel (I was simply using the resort as a business hotel). The major take away for me is that the property is beautiful, but unless I was coming back for an event on property, I likely would not go back because as a resort it isn't really designed for a typical business traveler (e.g., a lot of walking to get to your car, parking is far away, resort fee). If I was traveling for pleasure, I would check to see if there were any large meetings and avoid those dates to ensure a calm, quiet stay. The hotel is lovely and particularly beautiful at night. The lobby is lit up well, and can be a very comfortable work/social area. Valet parking is easiest, but at about $27/night I chose to self-park. There are limited spaces in front down a long row that I managed to use for a few days, but otherwise I had to park in a garage which is a good 10-minute walk from the entrance. The property has several restaurants and bars, and in the middle of the resort there is a decent amount of outdoor space that offers seating with fire pits for a relaxing evening. There is a coffee shop/Starbucks on property which was nice when needing something quick in the morning, but like everything else on the property the prices were on the high side -- I think my coffee and bagel was $10. I found the service overall to be about average. I didn't find that anybody was going out of their way to provide a memorable experience. When I checked-in I was not recognized as a Gold member nor were any benefits offered (I had to ask). After asking, as a Gold member I received a room upgrade (to the Terrace area) and 2 alcoholic drinks in the bar (up to $14 each). I also was given 2 free waters from the mini-bar. The room was very large and comfortable, but very traditional. I think the room could benefit from a facelift, bringing a few more modern elements to the room. Nonetheless it was quiet and I slept very well on the typical Hilton bed. It had a nice patio, a huge bathroom with separate make-up area, shower, and large closet. There were multiple pools and whirlpools on property.

Reviews.Title: “historical hotel with beautiful gardens”
Reviews.Author: Cath050
Reviews.Content: wonderful place to relax, have stayed there several time, in cottages, or simple room by main pool. got this time a huge appartment with a terrace looking onto the golf course, amazing ! the hotel is like a village, you can walk around so many places and gardens !

Reviews.Title: “What a cool place-I'll go back”
Reviews.Author: Garyedwbrown
Reviews.Content: I was here for five nights attending a class and an annual trade association meeting. This resort is first class and has a lot of interesting history. I really enjoyed everything about my stay and have no trouble recommending this resort highly.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Architecture”
Reviews.Author: TarpleyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Its worth a stroll around the grounds to take in the Frank Lloyd Wright-style architectural details. There is a grand-sized pool reminiscent of 1930's desert destinations. The hotel is situated in what now is a wealthy Scottsdale golf course neighborhood. Maseraties and Lamborghenis are commonly seen cruising by. Our guest room was just your basic nice hotel room off a main interior corridor, with a comfortable bed, and all-in-one bath/show/toilet/lav/mirror. The room had a sliding door that opened to the pool. I recommend valet parking, as the hotel sprawls and parking is limited.

Reviews.Title: “A truly exquisite architectural design, absolutely stunning!”
Reviews.Author: Chaswb
Reviews.Content: An almost regal setting, truly a desert beauty. Shuttle service is also excellent to shopping destinations. Fun putting green holes and clubs provided. Food (restaurant) and beverage service excellent. Very comfortable environment. Stunning architecture.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way, we hope to return yearly”
Reviews.Author: tamca
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel on a Frank Lloyd Wright Pilgrimage years ago. He isn't the "official" architect, but his influence is apparent (he was "consulting" arch). We vowed to come stay here. I brought my husband here for his birthday and it was perfect, he had come here as a child for Christmas and never forgot it. I can see why. The architecture is magnificent as was the service. Okay, they upgraded us to a Villa, I think partially because we were celebrating a birthday, which took everything over the top. The grounds are top notch and pleasant to walk around. The food at the restaurants was incredible. I could hang in the main building all day, it really is magnificent (I'd better come up with another adjective). Go upstairs and check out the Biltmore History room and just marvel at all the nooks and places to sit and enjoy another vantage point. This resort does take you to another time and place - you definitely get out of the main stream and settle into another world, which makes it a great vacation spot. We got a great deal - search the web site for specials and packages, it is well worth it. We had 3 meals thrown into our rate, and since the resort was the destination we took advantage of it, which made this wildly affordable. Here is what we liked: The Spa area was fantastic: a full gym and locker room facilities for every guest which include steam, sauna, whirlpool, outdoor quiet jacuzzi, classes and tennis courts. I had a message and it was lovely. Our package included 30% off spa treatments, which was a good incentive. All the restaurants had very good food. Frank and Albert's, might have been our favorite. Lots of organic, fresh tasting food at very reasonable prices. Indoor and outdoor seating. We also ate at Wright's which was gorgeous and also very good. We thought the prices were not bad for the quality of the food and the ambiance. It was my husband's birthday so we splurged (our deal included $100 toward dinner and that paid for most of it, like I said, it was an unbelievable package). They even gave us a free souffle for dessert! The Villa was unbelievable, 1200 sf, 2 patios. We had reserved a premier king room with a balcony and view. I won't be able to afford a villa on my own ($1200/night) but it was so nice of them to upgrade us without us even asking. Shows the care of the staff in general. We just seemed to get stuff without asking, like they wanted us to have the best stay ever. There is a fantastic main pool with a FLW inspired slide. There are also other pools on the property. You have croquet and a large lawn chess set. There is lots of patio seating around the resort, a nice bar, a casual cafe, a pool bar and cafe. It is just a great place to sit and unwind. We wished we could have stayed another day. There also have plays and concerts. We had just missed Randy Newman and the night we were there they had productions of both Midsummer's Night Dream (outside) and The Importance of Being Ernest (inside). There was s'mores making for kids on Friday night and lots of activities to keep you happy, if that is your thing. We got the deal we did because their slow time is end of May through the summer when Phoenix gets hot. It was going up to 100 degrees when we were there, but it wasn't unpleasant and with the beautiful rooms to hang in, the pool to cool down in, and all this resort has to offer as far as service and design - it is all good. Phoenix was never on my radar (I don't like the desert heat), but we vowed to come back more often. It is our new getaway destination (we live in L.A. and it is only a 6 hour drive).

Reviews.Title: “Check conference schedule carefully before going”
Reviews.Author: SoCal17
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Biltmore for the Memorial Day weekend. We were very surprised that what seemed to be about half of the guests were there attending a conference for recovering drug addicts. Not exactly the crowd we anticipated at a four star hotel and, at the risk of being a snob, most of them clearly did not belong there in terms of behavior and basic manners. We were informed by a staff member that at other times of the year it is worse (such as a huge tattoo convention in August called Hell City). Why a four star hotel would want to scare off its regular customers in return for some convention business is something I don't understand. I didn't see any pictures on the Biltmore web site of the guests covered in tattoos, smoking, and swearing. Some parts of the hotel are well maintained (lobby) but others have been pretty neglected (including pool areas). There used to be a smore roast for the kids which everyone seemed to love but the hotel now only provides marshmallows. Seems like a prety cheap way to save a few dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach in sink”
Reviews.Author: ASUnurse
Reviews.Content: I had heard nothing but fabulous things about the Biltmore and was so excited to spend a night there for a friends wedding. My boyfriend and I got there and went straight to the pool. We were shocked at the number of people smoking cigarettes and cigars by the pool, it stunk of an ash tray. Pool side service was fine. In the morning we ordered room service, and our meal came incorrect twice. The man was very apologetic, but it was unfortunate that the meal wasn't correct the first time (especially considering the price). Starting at 8:00am, we had a maid knocking on our door asking if she could clean (even though we had put a do not disturb sign in the key slot as directed). After breakfast when we went to brush our teeth before checking out, I was greeted by a nice small cockroach climbing out of the drain in the sink...not what I expected! Needless to say, I was very dissapointed with our stay, and it was not worth the $400 (room plus food) we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: quicktraveler91
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds and restaurant were very good and in great condition. The stay included the Ocatilla building. This building location is a problem since there is not an easy way to get to it from any automobile location. It is also hard to find from the signage on site. It offers an area for a continental breakfast, snacks, beer and wine with afternoon hors d'oeuvres and some dessert at 8 to 9. The quality of this is not the greatest and it may not be worth the value unless you partake on the beer/wine. The only major issue is the lack of maid service on a reasonable basis. Turn down was ignored, next day room make up not happened, even after calling it in. This is not a tolerable situation for a hotel that is supposed to be an elite facility. The restaurant is very good and may make up for this issue, maybe. There are better resorts out there- especially the Royal Palms, which is exceptionable for the same fees.

Reviews.Title: “Frank&Albert's Restaurant/Lounge/Bar at the AZ Biltmore Resort - PHX”
Reviews.Author: MeinPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Celebrating a birthday and enjoying Happy Hour: We 7 girls have never seen anything like this royal treatment we got here!!! And believe me, we know a lot about HH in PHX. Sharon (our waitress and "entertainment advisor") was just fabulous, we would have liked her as our guest. She was fast, knowledgeable and still lots of fun...and with all the important connections to the staff for their special contribution & congratulations to our birthday girl. Not even to mention the extraordinary setting at the Biltmore! All appetizers came in good portions so we all could try them, (calamari !!, goat cheese), the sampler plates were an eye candy and a delicious treat. And then came dessert: All of it! The smores-plater, warm cookies and all kind's of icecream - we were in heaven! And the bill was almost unbelievably low...as I said: Happy Hour! We'll make that a "Birthday Tradition" from now on until we all turn 100!! ..and that can take a while. If you want to relax here or celebrate a special occasion: It doesn't get any better then this.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great experience- will come back again and again!”
Reviews.Author: cupcakesonfire
Reviews.Content: I traveled recently with my family (consisting of a 11 year old and 8 year old) to Phoenix. When we got to the hotel, the staff was friendly and polite. The manager actually upgraded our room to a room near the pool (a huge plus). Our room was clean, and you could see the water slide out the window. We spent most of our time at the pool. However, when we wanted to see the Grand Canyon and other attratctions, the concierge actuall helped us accomodate, and gave us many suggestions. For food, there was a poolside restaurant, a regular cafe, a grill, and a fancier place. We loved the poolside restaurant, since it was right near our room. Also, there was an outside mall right next to the property, which gave us somewhere to go if we wanted to. All in all, we loved the Arizona Biltmore and will come back whenever we go to Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable hotel that's more reliably efficient than cosy”
Reviews.Author: ABdeMH
Reviews.Content: This is a prestigious hotel – its trim low level buildings are spread over a large well kept site. The style – Frank Lloyd Wright’s – may not be to everyone’s taste but it is faithfully adhered to down to the last detail. I was attending one of the many conferences referred to in other reviews and knew what to expect: clinically efficient staff and a reasonable choice of different dining facilities. The pool facilities are a bonus and the choice of beers there much wider than I expected. But the rooms haven’t changed since I was last here 4 years ago and seem basic compared to what now constitutes 5 star hotels globally. Even a no-star B&B in the UK will lay on free self-serve tea/coffee facilities, and most top hotels I’ve stayed in have a CD player in the room, though I suspect their walls between rooms are thicker than here. That said, it was handy to have a set of scales in the bathroom, even if they only registered in lbs, and an Ethernet connection for one’s laptop. This is a great location for a conference. So, if your company’s paying, then lie back and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Wrights for Brunch”
Reviews.Author: PHXeater
Reviews.Content: I am a Phoenix resident who recently went to Wrights at the Biltmore for sunday brunch. I was expecting very high quality and good food, but frankly, I was blown away. The buffet items were good - some very tasty, some pretty meh, the kinds of standard brunch buffet things you would expect. But the hot food that you get (which then comes with the buffet) was excellent. I had the prawns, my wife had the banana french toast, and I kept saying "wow!" about the prawn dish. Smoky, with curry, very flavorful and really great. And the french toast was very tasty, too. it wasn't cheap, but quality brunch never is, is it? But the food, the food was what brought me here to comment, because it really was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby & grounds - rooms need work!”
Reviews.Author: teelerfan
Reviews.Content: Day two of a four day stay. Staff is friendly and responsive, hotel grounds and common areas are lovely. Dining is good but if you want a quick breakfast, "The Cafe" menu is limited, mostly carbs in the form of pastries. The lunch options looked more promising. The room is definately in need of a face lift. We have broken tile and peeling ceiling paint in an awarkdly designed bathroom. While the hotel room isn't dirty, it isn't sparkling clean. I think this is due to how old the furnishings seem. All in all, it is a fine place to stay but has seen better days.

Reviews.Title: “Frank Lloyd Wright on steroids”
Reviews.Author: JoanE_chinook
Reviews.Content: This is an absolute MUST for anyone who admires the architecture of Frank Lloyd Wright. Although we learned there is some dispute as to who actually did the final design for the hotel and the many out buildings on the property, the architecture, lighting, furniture, landscape design are all clearly heavily influenced by Wright. We spent 3 days on the property leaving only to take a tour of Taliesin West (Wright's home and current architectural school less than 20 miles away) and we were constantly discovering new wonderful aspects of the hotel. In addition to the main building, there are 8 pools (have to go back to swim in the rest of them!) 2 full service restaurants (don't miss the lobster bisque and souffle) and a cafe, an enormous spa, tennis courts, I could go on. Tours of the hotel are offered 3 times a week - don't miss if you can work it in to your schedule. The grounds are so extensive that despite the fact we were there on a very busy, booked weekend, it was easy to wander the grounds without seeing another person. Both restaurants were excellent, bartenders imaginative - it was the perfect, pampered weekend. I went with a girlfriend I needed to catch up with and we had a blast, but I'm planning to go back with my husband as this is also a very romantic getaway. Not inexpensive - but I'm guessing it's possible to find good deals with a bit of planning.

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities although large hotel”
Reviews.Author: grahamdpatterson
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect from a good hotel in US. Great pools & architecture.

Reviews.Title: “About as good as it gets!!!”
Reviews.Author: NorrisDN
Reviews.Content: As a seasoned travelor, I always enjoy the opportunity to stay at a 5 star resort type propertly. The Arizona Biltmore certainly lives up to this reputation. I found the accomodations, service, and amenities to be all top notch. In fact it is one of the all around best properties I have ever stayed at. Just about the only negative I can think of is that the pool chairs by the main pool get saved (with towels) early in the morning sometimes, so sometimes you may have to find your way to one of the other 8 pools on the property. In addition to the great service, accomodations, and the breathtaking property itself, it boasts some of the best food in all of Phoenix. To sum it all up I would say that this resort is "About as Good as it Gets!!"

Reviews.Title: “Getting a drink at the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: jerrysmithson
Reviews.Content: Earlier this month I attended a large business luncheon event at the Arizona Biltmore. As it turned out there were also 3 other huge luncheon events at the Arizona Biltmore on that day. Needless to say, the traffic and the parking was a bit challenging so when our event ended I decided to take my partner for a glass of wine on the terrace and wait out the exiting crowds. We proceeded to the terrace, took a couple of very comfortable chairs and, while admiring the garden and fountain views, waited for our server. None came. After a bit I got up and went back into the hotel in search of a server. I found a young lady and asked if she could help me get a couple of drinks on the terrace. She informed me that the bar was closed so perhaps I could collect my partner and go to another "open" bar somewhere else in the hotel's interior. I was dismayed. The day was glorious and the very comfortable outdoor seating and views on the terrace are an imeasurably more "luxurious" experience than sitting in a dark interior bar. Bummer, I thought.... Another server happened to overhear us and turned to me and asked me what I wished. I responded "two glasses of wine on the terrace". To this he responded, "I can make that happen!" "Really?", I asked. "Absolutely," he said and told me he would meet me and my partner back at the terrace. No sooner than I had taken my seat than he arrived and, after some dialogue and recommendations regarding the merits of various posssible wine selections, he took our order and disappeared back into the hotel. Soon we were sipping our wine and it was then that I noticed his name badge. "Kevin," I asked, "what is that pin you're wearing?" Well, it turned out to be an "Emplyee of the Month" award. I asked Kevin if he could comment on its interesting design and he said it symbolizes the 16 Biltmore values -- which include his favorite value: Empowerment. "This," he said, "means I can take any action which I believe will enhance a guest's visit and I do not have to go through 5 layers of supervision do that. So, I can walk a few steps to bring you your drinks on the terrace". Well, I was most impressed. Kevin could see that this customer could either acquiesce to the suggestion from the first server (and probably neither have nor remember an Arizona Biltmore "experience") or be granted my wish to enjoy with my partner a glass of wine on the terrace and celebrate the outdoor garden views on a beautiful Spring day. God bless Kevin (Doyle) and the Arizona Biltmore values! Kevin turned a potentially unhappy experience into a beautiful memory...

Reviews.Title: “It's not any just another place...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The charm and architecture aside from it's location are only made better by the staff. This review goes out proudly to Christian, from in room dining that saw to my morning coffee promptly arriving at 5:30 am every morning. His courteous evening greeting assuring me of prompt service should not be overlooked or taken for granted. Thank you to you and your staff!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive and watch the extra fees”
Reviews.Author: aclone
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Biltmore for business and pleasure and the resort is nice overall with some very elegant touches. Our room was older but very large which worked out very well. We did have to change rooms due to a water leak but those things are sometimes unavoidable and it was handled well. What was a bit of a surprise were all the extra fees. We just didn't realize we'd get charged for nearly everything. There was no ice machine in our building and they wouldn't tell me where I could get ice...they said it would be easier for them to just bring it. And then I saw the charges. Plus there was a maid fee and other stuff. Given the high cost of rooms and additional fees tacked on initially up front, the extra fees seemed to be very questionable. The main pool is quite nice though and we did enjoy our time there. They advertise 8 pools but in reality there aren't 8 complexes of pools. The golf course (Biltmore Country Club) is essentially forgetable and not worth the high price. You can find much better courses and values away from the hotel. Overall, a nice stay but be prepared for the fees. The value is questionable at the normal rack rates but if you can get a discount, worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel that needs some work”
Reviews.Author: 3DTurkey
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. There are some things that are really good and some things that are really bad. Good: The grounds are beautiful and kept up wonderfully. Just walking around the hotel you felt like you were escaping to a tropical garden. It was really amazing. The staff was always very friendly and helpful and we always felt welcome. This hotel has a lot of history and there are photos all over the walls of days gone by and famous people who have visited over the years. It was fun to check it out. The pools are great and the waterslide was a blast (even for adults). Bad: Our room was very small and in disrepair. I've posted photos so you can decide for yourself. Wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the furniture was beat up, there was mold all over the shower. In addition, the door that separated our room from our neighbors had a one inch gap underneath so you could hear just about everything in their room and I'm sure the same went for our neighbors. In other words, no privacy. Our room was right next to the main courtyard so lot's of traffic and noise at all hours. You were charged to self park your car which seemed a bit petty. Also, the service at the pool was very slow. We'd often order a drink and wait 15-20 minutes for it to arrive. They are either very short staffed or poorly managed in this department. When you are paying this kind of money for a room and for drinks this type of service is unacceptable. And finally, I left my phone in my golf cart after a round of golf at the Biltmore and when I went back to find my phone the indifference of the staff was insulting. I'm still perplexed at their response and lack of assistance. It was strange and extremely irritating. Overall, I'm glad we went to experience this little piece of history but I would not return. I would probably recommend visiting this place for a night just to check it out but beware of all the pitfalls and don't expect too much from your room.

Reviews.Title: “The Arizona Biltmore is the best resort in the world!”
Reviews.Author: DurbMorrison
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at The Arizona Biltmore dozens of times, I always look forward to the exceptional treatment and relaxing elegance that the resort and it's staff exudes. The entire staff is more than accommodating to our needs and they make sure that our stay is luxurious in every way. I will always stay at the Arizona Biltmore when I'm in Phoenix!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing room; beautiful outside”
Reviews.Author: 40somethingsplus1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent two nights. I spent two days in the the conference center and he spent time enjoying the outdoor amenities. The room (a Villa) was tired and out-dated: wallpaper peeling in the bathroom. Wooden TV stand falling apart. Small standard TV, and the hardest bed I've ever slept on. The Villa we stayed in adjoined a larger villa via a suite door. I could hear the entire conversation from the adjoining room. Room Service was excellent, and the breakfast was incredibly delicious. My husband found the steam room to be one of the best. In general, the grounds were beautiful, but the room we stayed in needs some serious updating. I would not stay here again. There are better options available.

Reviews.Title: “Posh place that needs some smiling staff.”
Reviews.Author: Carolynn55
Reviews.Content: Lovely spot for events, girls get away, romantic weekend. The grounds are amazing and like nothing i have ever seen. Gardens, pools, mini golf were top notch! Proximity to shopping and restaurants is also good. For the price and reputation I can say that we were disappointed as the overall staff experience was not great. The staff seemed rushed (understaffed?), not very friendly and other than the bell men in general no one smiled. It was busy so I am sure it was a reflection of the March break crowd but, I truly believe your staff make or break your customers experience and this needs addressed @ the Biltmore to ensure folks want to return. I would also mention that if you plan on renting a suite so you can cook this is not really what the hotel is set up for - you have to ask for pots & pans (our arrived dirty) and the dishes are minimal and not what I wanted to be able to entertain. Just sayin'!

Reviews.Title: “Ocitilla at the Biltmore One of the Best Romantic Getaways”
Reviews.Author: m2maverick
Reviews.Content: Ocitillia is a wonderful experience for couples! The exclusive setting has a private fire pit, good size pool with spa - very quiet - away from the family area ( Paradise pool with small water slide) Access to the Executive Lounge comes with an Ocitilla room and includes continental breakfast, afternoon snacks, free happy hour with good selection of wine and beer, chef's appetizers and delicious evening desserts! Lounge also includes personal concierge service and small business center with access to the internet. Well worth the price of the room! Check-in was a nightmare - so be prepared if you arrive early! Nick, our concierge at the Ocitilla, was wonderful and gave us great ideas on how to spend our time! Lots of secluded areas for couples and the grounds are beautiful! Weekend evenings had roasted marshmellows over wood fire pit and afternoon tea with Kevin was the BEST!!!! We loved it! Aside from our check-in experience, we really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “You never have to leave the hotel for your vacation!”
Reviews.Author: klee25
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic experience staying here. The rooms, pools, restaurants were all A+. We loved the variety of outdoor seating/lounging, especially around the fire pits since the evenings get a little chilly. There were quite a few families there with school aged children.

Reviews.Title: “a decent hotel, but way overhyped”
Reviews.Author: Clyde_Betts
Reviews.Content: OK, so to preface this, I live in Arizona, I travel all over the globe for work and have stayed at many many hotels worldwide. The Az Biltmore just does not impress me. The Hotel itself just seems dated. and not dated in a classic kind of way. I think it just feels old. The rooms, (in which I have stayed in at least 7-10 different ones in the last three years) all seem tired and rundown. The cleaning staff does a great job with what they have but the rooms seem like they have not been renovated in ages. It is a great place for conventions though, they have a ton of great meeting space. Stacy Shapiro (one of the convention managers) is one of the best in the valley, if you have a choice ask for her, some of her colleagues do not have a clue about their job, but she is amazing. Do I recommend this hotel, well the history of it is amazing, the architecture is very cool, it just seems overpriced to me.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great”
Reviews.Author: AEWishard
Reviews.Content: While it is promoted as being a Frank Lloyd Wright-designed compound, the man evidently only had a passing acquaintance with the place. It may have been a very cool design a hundred years ago, but today it is more like a prison for free fee-paying adults who buy the promotional BS. The concrete block compound is a surreal place with exceptionally high prices on mediocre food and drink with less than stellar housekeeping. There was mold in our shower, lights didn't work, the wood surfaces in our room had buckled from "overuse," and our patio door wouldn't lock ~ in short NOTHING worked and we were paying big bucks for the privilege of suffering these inadequacies. It was awful. There's nothing quite like checking into an expensive room in the desert after a long, hot trip and finding a note on the large bottle of water on the bureau - drink me and it will cost you $8 - no freebies here! Oh - I forgot the "complimentary" shuttle that cost $12 each way to go just outside the gates. What a joke. DON'T GO!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Property With Not So Beautiful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MimiStarr
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I recently attended a conference at The Arizona Biltmore. The location, grounds and history associated with this hotel was lovely and interesting. The photos displayed throughout, the historical tour provided (you have to sign up for this) and the literature to read are steeped in the elegant history of this hotel. We enjoyed the grandeur of the grounds, pools, shops and restaurants. The service was good, but not great, as one might expect from a hotel of this caliber. There certainly was effort, however, this hotel greatly needs the expertise of someone like Steven Freund to overhaul the hotel's customer service and attention to detail. Steven was the former Manager of Reynold's Plantation/Ritz Carlton in Georgia and brought it to a 5 star rating worldwide. Every area could use his touch! Most surprising to us was our room. We were placed in the original part of the hotel in a room that was comparable to a Holiday Inn. Very disappointing. We will likely visit Phoenix again, but will likely return to the Royal Palms where the entire experience is generally top notch. Be aware of the surprise additional charges to your bill reflected below in "tips". We had, unfortunately, already left a daily tip for the maid and paid the valet and bellman, only to find these additional charges had been added to our bill.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to find its identity”
Reviews.Author: travel JR
Reviews.Content: We have visited here before and are seeing the transformation of this old time classic into a somewhat more contemporary hotel, but seems to be still struggling with going from a playground of the wealthy ("every American Prez and royalty has stayed here.") to a conference center. Overall the staff was young & very friendly, the restaurant is greatly improved (Frank & Alberts is #1 on Tripadvisor). Beware of taxes & fees...about $90.00 per day on a $385 room)...including resort fee, parking fee for self-parking a long distance from rooms, a daily housekeeping...enough already...as bad as airlines.) Also, roo, has free wired Internet, but wireless only in main building.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Elegance”
Reviews.Author: SonjaWitt
Reviews.Content: Very elegant but not stuffy. Historic Hotel. Beautiful grounds. Wonderful staff, rooms and food. Ate at Frank & Alberts for breakfast. Delicious. Generous portions. Enjoyed massage at Spa. Wonderful facility and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great girl's trip”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaPrettyKitty
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at the Arizona Biltmore the second weekend of September 2010. We booked our trip on www.ruelala.com - we paid $259 a night - which included double occupancy rooms, all meals, and 50% off of spa services. We were so impressed with our trip that we have booked the Biltmore for a Memorial weekend vacation in 2011. The grounds were gorgeous and the food was top notch. We were given vouchers for the meals and found that we had plenty in vouchers to have an appetizer, meal, wine, and dessert. The rooms were clean and extremely comfortable. The pool was a lot of fun - there was even a water slide. The people that worked at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful. I took so many pictures of the lobby of the hotel - it defines old hollywood glamour - gorgeous! The spa was really, really great too. We took advantage of our 50% discount and had massages, facials, seaweed wraps, you name it. When I mentioned to my massage therapist I wanted to get my hair done and have a mani-pedi (salon services weren't included in the 50% special), they offered me a discount of 30% at the salon - yes, please! As far as activities outside the hotel - we left the hotel only once to do some shopping. The Biltmore shops are somewhat down the street and there is a large mall down further on Camelback Road, I think, that requires a cab. Given the deal we bought on ruelala, we weren't sure what we were getting ourselves into. The entire experience exceeded expectations and I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Facility, Service & Food”
Reviews.Author: LeppFrog
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore is an experience of extravagant living in an historical museum that is living. The structure, service, food and grounds are amazing. There is an ambiance reminiscent of days gone past with the sophistication of the present. Everyone should experience the Biltmore. Bret W. Leppo

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place, can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Susana114
Reviews.Content: This property is absolutely amazing. The setting, gardens and grounds are beautiful, and the original architecture and historic touches are beyond compare. I've always loved FL Wright, and to see his designs and legacy come to life in this property is a remarkable experience. I stayed in the Ocatilla wing, with a modern, large room that repeats the Biltmore Block in the headboard and bathroom tile. I liked having a large patio door that opened to a view of the mountains. I also loved the large bath with soaking tub - it even comes with a candle and bath salts. Overall, my stay has been an enjoyable experience. The Biltmore provides great service and has maintained and modernized this lovely Arizona gem in the desert.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to the Staff at the Biltmore- awesome service!”
Reviews.Author: Czaplewski
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were guests in January 2011 at the Arizona Biltmore and stayed in the Ocatilla - we thoroughly enjoyed our stay - everything was top knotch. We especially wanted to acknowledge and thank Nick Douglas, Conceirge in the Ocatilla. He went above and beyond to provide excellent service to us. He is a wonderful representative for the Biltmore's high standards and qualities. We also want to say "great job" to the others that work with Nick in the Ocatilla...They work diligently to keep things flowing there - stocked and looking perfect!...Rajith de Soyza, Kim and Scott Hutch. We had such a nice time. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “You had us at hello”
Reviews.Author: hrodine
Reviews.Content: This was our second year in a row staying at the Arizona Biltmore. Both times we took advantage of their inclusive package which consists of room, 3 meal vouchers, and spa discount. We felt that it was an incredible value because the food onsite is out of this world and our vouchers covered our entire breakfast, lunch and dinner and we ate a lot! We want to specifically call out the outstanding welcome we received from one of the front desk employees, Micah. He checked us in last year and was really good to us and showed the same welcoming spirit and service this time around as well. It is because of his friendliness that we wanted to come back again this year, and that we will continue to come back year after year. We also had terrific service in Frank & Albert's restaurant - thank you Sommer! As for the facilities - our rooms have always been luxurious and spacious. There is a pool associated to each of the different buildings as well as a pool for the entire hotel. We've used both and loved them! We also take advantage of the complimentary 18 hole putting course they have on grounds, the croquet, and life size checkers/chess board. It provided a fun activity for us to do in the morning before it got warm enough for the pool. It is also a lot of fun to take a walk through the neighborhoods that surround the resort. I can not say enough good things about this resort and our experience there! To the Biltmore management team, please recognize that the service of your employees goes a long way in enhancing the guest experience :-)

Reviews.Title: “Elegant property - not so elegant rooms.”
Reviews.Author: timminn
Reviews.Content: This is a historic resort with wonderful ambiance, well-staffed with plenty of friendly people who are eager to welcome you and make your stay special. From the front desk to the bar & restaurant, cleaning & ground staff, the kind of positive attitude is projected that lets you know they take a lot of pride in serving their guests well. The property was a little too spread out to be efficient but the grounds are beautiful, interior spaces were more than adequate and the meetings, meals, receptions, etc. were very well handled by the hotel. The weak part of the experience for me was the room. Mine was rather spartan and quite dark with very inadequate lighting, even a light fixture by my bed that didn't always work. The desk and other cabinet tops have bubbling veneers that reflect the tiredness of the decor. The air handling system is noisy and woke me every night audibly clicking on and off. When the temperature dropped into the '30's outside and I arrived back at my room chilled, I couldn't get the heat in the room cranked up and had to take a hot shower instead. It may be that other parts of the property have been renovated and are in better shape. Overall, if you want a 5-Star resort experience you'll have to find it somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “I will return if I ever get back to Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: sfimporter
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Arizona Biltmore while in Phoenix for a business trip. Originally planned to stay at the Arizona Grand resort, which was much more affordable, but not nearly as luxurious. The Arizona Grand would have been great for a family on a budget, but the Biltmore was perfect for adults and business. Such a large resort, such beauty all around. So many pools! I imagine when it gets really hot, those pools get packed, but since there are several of them spread out amongst the resort, I imagine there's always room at one of them. Ate and Frank & Albert's several times. Great for breakfast - not bad for dinner, but not amazing. The staff was all great. We were placed in the main building on the 4th floor above the lobby. Couldn't imagine it gets any better. See my pic for the amazing view out of our window. The room was large and spacious, although I might have preferred wireless access over the one wired port in the room. Plenty of electrical outlets. Depending on what was going on, we could actually get a wireless signal from the lobby - but it wasn't always reliable. I found the Starbucks on the premises to be a little expensive ($5 for a croissant?!) but with Hilton Silver Honors, you get a free large coffee each day of your stay. I think I could have stayed there a week, and I imagine it only gets better when the weather really heats up. Self parking was the only minor hassle. It was a bit of a ways away, but still a pleasant walk. Not much around the resort itself. A shopping mall isn't too far away, but you'd need to drive anywhere. I'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of holes to be filled.”
Reviews.Author: JaquesN
Reviews.Content: This historic property has an incredible setting and lovely architecture. Too bad the room I had was more tired than I was having traveled across country to attend a conference at a different hotel and was adjusting to the time change. Dark and in need of a face llift. The high light of my stay was that the staff was professional, courteous and helpful. The wait staff at the various dining venues on the property were friendly and even fun. No complaints there. BUT, although advertised as providing free Internet, be sure you have an old laptop with a port for it. I travel with a Mac Book Air. And, I didn't bring my Sprint Wireless Card. Wireless is available in the lobby which is cozy but does not have good work space. No coffee maker in the room, though I learned you can get one on request - when I was checking out - my bad for not asking sooner. As is the case with most all-in-one resort properties, everything was over-priced. I paid $10.00 for a domestic light beer in the mini-bar. A glass of house wine is $16.00. Would I go there again? Probably not on a business trip- an frankly, that's not what it's there for. It was, however, a stunning property, the grounds are lovely and they have full amenities. Compared to a few other resorts I've stayed at in the Scottsdale area, this one gets an average rating from me.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: Traveler151983
Reviews.Content: The complex was well-kept and very clean. I enjoyed the great history surrounding the place. I did not get a chance to eat at Wrigths, but ended up eating at Frank and Alberts 3 of the nights during my stay. The food was really good and the servers were friendly. I felt right at home form the moment I walked in and was greeted by the two hostesess Britney and Courtney. They stood out in my mind with their bright smiles and friendly demeanor. They were very nice and gave me recomendations for things around town to check out. I look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, Luxury, Luxury”
Reviews.Author: DCMcG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights here at the start of our honeymoon. It was by far our best hotel of the trip, and was a wonderful way to start our vacation. When we arrived to Phoenix we rented a car and drove from the airport. The hotel is easy to find, and parking is abundant. We did get lost after we checked in because the front desk agent told us to park in a garage that was closer to our room, but something must have gotten lost in translation of the directions because after we parked we walked all the way back across the resort to find our room. We moved our car and the rest of the stay we parked right outside of our room! The first room we were given was under maintenance. After a long flight, and the aforementioned trek across the resort carrying all our luggage we were disappointed to be given a room that was out of service. The bathroom smelled of fumes, was being painted, and the bathroom was being caulked. We called the front desk and explained the issue. They brought a golf cart and took us to a new room, which was amazing! The room we ended up staying in was a one bedroom apartment style room with a full kitchen, living room, large bathroom with jet tub, and a porch. We loved having so much space to spread out and relax in. The place was perfect for a lounging couple! We used the main pool a few times (it was a little chilly out, so we didn't spend much time poolside), and we used the gym equipment each day. I got a massage at the spa, which was wonderful. The service at each place was top notch. The resort is conveniently located to just about anywhere you'd like to go in the Phoenix area. We spent time hiking, dining in Scottsdale, and gambling one night. It's not walkable to anything outside of the resort, but is driver friendly. I have very fond memories from our first nights as a married couple, and would definitely recommend staying at the Biltmore for a special occasion!

Reviews.Title: “So much more than just a hotel”
Reviews.Author: adventurers02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biltmore for 10 days between Christmas and New Years into January. We have 2 boys aged 8 and 12. I had always heard about the Biltmore from work associates and clients but you have to stay there to experience why people like it. It goes without saying that the grounds, pools and buildings are beautiful. The main hotel has an elegance which most hotels simply do not have these days. It was the social aspect of the hotel which we enjoyed. People inlcuding the staff are very friendly. Having a drink in the lobby bar is something you need to experience for yourself. Everyone chats like they are old friends and you meet lots of guests. We stayed in a building beside the Octilla which was very nice. On the second part of our stay (we went to Sedona for 2 days) the hotel was full so we were given a room on the far east side of the grounds, opposite the main interior courtyard. Not as good, this building needs some cosmetic maintenace. I have to say the second room was much larger and nicer, however the common area (lobby) was not as nice and also not as convenient to the common areas. The kids loved the pool, pool slide, smores by the fire, chess and golf. The concierge arranged tickets to hockey games, Fiesta Bowl, Dude Ranch, restaurants and anything else we needed, they were great. For the days we did not have a rental car we used the hotel car service which I would highly recommend. Very professional and it's like having your own private limousine. It was one of our best family vacations and I would recommend the Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “Convention hotel with good quality and high prices”
Reviews.Author: UTAustin
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore is a nice convention type hotel with a few stand-out amenities and some drawbacks as well. The room I stayed in was in the Ocatilla. This basically was a new building where you were charged an extra hundred bucks for a bit more space, a bit nicer bathroom, and free cokes and snacks in a club area. Whether that's worth the expense is up for debate. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. There was a decent work area and a view of the pool. There was an attempt at an outdoor patio / seating area but the execution was weak. It was basically two patio chairs looking at a pool fence. The bathroom had a large tub and a stand alone shower. The commode was in a separate, but very small, room. I'm not sure it would be great for a person who gets claustrophobic. The towels were clean and plentiful. The hotel itself had decent service. The valets were effective though didn't seem terribly efficient. The front desk staff was friendly but the place still had the feel of a convention center hotel. The gym area was nice and had lots of equipment. However, it closed early. Around 9 or 10. It's amazing how a Hilton Garden Inn can have a 24 hour workout space but a Hilton Waldorf Astoria Collection hotel has to boot you off the treadmill before the 10 o'clock news comes on. The spa was adequate but nothing to write home about. There were lots of parts that sorely needed maintenance. If you have a convention here, it's a great place to stay. If you like Frank Lloyd Wright influenced architecture (he wasn't the primary architect) it's also a nice place to be. However, I'm not sure this is a must-see.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of reputation these days...”
Reviews.Author: Global_Coug
Reviews.Content: First, I've stayed at the Biltmore a number of times over the past 25 years. I'm not sure if it's because the property isn't making enough money due to the habitual overbuilding of resorts in Phoenix, or what, but to one degree or another the hotel has been partially updated from time to time but never given a good overhaul. For example, if you stay in the Garden rooms, expect to stay in a small room that was designed in the '20s and was kind of updated sometime in the '60's. A key feature is virtually no electrical outlets, small, New York City type bathrooms, and an ancient in room heating/AC unit. The Ocatilla wing has much nicer rooms but is a hike to anything on the property. Finally, I'm not sure who owns the Biltmore now but I've seen it be an independent, a Westin, and now under Hilton management. Sadly, Hilton properties have not impressed me with top notch housekeeping and that goes for my stay 1/11/11. My room was made up but dirty. There was crud on the carpet and the bathroom was, well, kinda clean. Now, on top of this, the Biltmore has adopted the new technique for having a much higher effective room rate than what is advertised. Some of you may have experienced this little wonder at other vacation type hotels and that is the "resort charge". At the Biltmore this was a relatively modest $28/day plus 13% Arizona tax, or $31.72/day. Now this is charged regardless of whether you use the pool or anything else. It's a scam. To hotel managements, just put it into the room rate in the first place and allow consumers to know what the real cost per day is. It's also $12/night for self parking which is in the boondocks. Now, to be fair, the Biltmore is a historic property with some very cool Frank Lloyd Wright architecture. On the other hand, for whatever reason, the owners over the years have never undertaken to truly renovate the property, not just change out a few carpets now and then or mess with the bar area. Too bad. And, as I mentioned, Hilton managed properties just don't seem to be on a par with Ritz-Carlton (Marriott), Four Seasons, or even Starwood properties. If you get a great deal, then by all means, consider the Biltmore. But, for what they usually charge, you can do better elsewhere, although, a final, final note, because of habitual overbuilding generally speaking the older the resort in Phoenix the less capital improvements. The Phoenician for example was an increible property when completed in 1988. It's still cool, but nothing like it was when it opened.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but ruined it upon checkout...”
Reviews.Author: Canehdianman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biltmore with a large group for a wedding. The hotel is gorgeous, the amenities are fantastic and the staff were friendly. Our room had a gorgeous wrap-around balcony that overlooked a fantastic garden. You could pick lemons from it! The wedding was amazing and everyone had a blast. At the hotel, the only thing that annoyed me was not having wi-fi in all of the buildings (only the lobby as near as I could tell) Everything was quite good...until it came time to check out. We had a large group and organized a group rate. It was to be a flat rate of $169 per room, including everything. First off, I had to ask for an itemized bill to be printed so I could see how the charges. They had charged us a $25 resort fee, $12 parking fee, $12 porter fee and a $3 housekeeping gratuity (How is a mandatory charge a gratuity?) each day. In spite of the fact that our account had a note saying it was supposed to be an all-inclusive price of $169 AND the fact that we didn't have a car AND the fact that we didn't use any porters, it was a fight to get the clerk to remove the extra fees. She said "this is the agreement that the bride and groom signed with the hotel, so you have to pay it". Maybe I'm a cheap jerk, but I'm not paying for services I didn't use. In the end, she relented and took the charge down to the proper amount. However, it soured me on an otherwise fantastic trip.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and ambience”
Reviews.Author: NinaK10025
Reviews.Content: We went for a three-day weekend including New Year's Eve. First, this hotel is justly famous for its beautiful design. We stayed in the Ocatilla wing. The Ocatilla rooms were beautifully renovated and spacious. The service in the Ocatilla executive lounge was outstanding, and they offered a terrific selection for breakfast and evening snacks every day. We especially enjoyed a cooking class offered by the hotel chefs. The food in the restaurants is also excellent. Really nice gym, salon, spa and pools.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: rosaritaknows
Reviews.Content: On 12/31/2010, we had a room at the Arizona Biltmore, when we arrived the room was extremely cold, after trying at least four times to fix the problem, the hotel upgraded us to a villa! This is how you tread guests, what a great experience! THANK YOU AZ BILTMORE

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, service, and stay.”
Reviews.Author: eae7209
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to Phoenix on a business trip and decided to stay at the Biltmore in the Ocatilla wing. All of the concierge in the Ocatilla lounge were very friendly and helpful, among all of them Leo was a great help during our stay. The rooms were very nice, spacious and clean. Overall, our stay was nice and relaxing, even for being a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience..Hope to return!”
Reviews.Author: atltravelergw
Reviews.Content: We were escaping the torrential rains in Southern California and drove to Phoenix as a last minute option. We booked two adjoining rooms for our family of four and couldn't have been happier with the entire experience. The rooms were spacious, beds and pillows extremely comfortable, grounds spectacular and service in every department was top notch. The historic tour of the hotel is well worth it (and no charge). The fitness center and pools were great, dining at Frank and Alberts was convenient and tasty, and the staff was helpful in every way. The hotel offers shuttle service to the nearby mall, where we did holiday shopping and had a nice lunch. We took a trip to Scottdale to see the Frank Lloyd Wright home/museum and that was well worth it too. I would love to return for a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort too bad the staff isn't so great”
Reviews.Author: karen4352
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business trip 3 days after our wedding so I started our honeymoon here. We stayed in a Villa which was great. The room was HUGE. The resort is beautiful but the staff isn't. We ate dinner at the restaurant twice and the food wasn't good either time. The wait staff was not attentive. We would have to waive them down to get water or drink refills. I spend the days at the pool and the staff there is just as bad. The hotel concierge was the worst. I asked for them to arrange for a taxi to bring us to the airport the following day and he said he would see what he could do. The next morning come to find out they never called for a cab but wanted us to use their private car service.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to get disconnected and relax, this is the place.”
Reviews.Author: UKWildcat22
Reviews.Content: My wife, her sister and her husband went to the Biltmore. The objective was to disconnect. It was fabulous. The property is laden with history and nostalgia. The service is incredible, the rooms were great and the restaurants were second to none. There is a fabulous spa the girls frequented. The workout facility was great. There are two quality golf courses. My brother in law is a runner. He said the running trail was awesome. There are 8 swimming pools, all with character. At night we sat around one of the many fire pits after dinner and enjoyed an evening cocktail. This property has moved up toward the top of the resorts I have been to.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Settings, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: tstar12
Reviews.Content: The property has beautiful grounds and out door areas. The buildings are artful and pleasing to the eye. Service was non existent. From the front desk to the bar and pool staff, no one offered customer service. The banquet servers seemed annoyed with any special diet request (there was a vegetarian in our group), even rolling eyes or giving a big sigh. One server went so far as to cut off the explanation of what was wanted only to screw it up (this vegetarian eats eggs and cheese). One afternoon at the pool, I tried to order food 5 minutes after the kitchen and bar closed (4pm). I was given a flat "no" with no offer of the nearest place to order or an offer to order from room service and have it delivered to the pool. When we tried to accommodate a travelers birthday, it was treated as if we had asked for a space shuttle! After being routed to multiple people over 2 days, we were offered a $75 cake for 3 people that was only if the chef had time! The spa may be nice but I was directed to the salon for my pedicure, so there I sat smelling hair coloring chemicals in what looked like the local grocery store hair salon. I've been treated better at much cheaper properties. I was shocked that there is no WiFi in the rooms! Really, what year is it. How do you host business travel with no WiFi? A hard line is offerend, but that is not helpful for smartphones and iPads. WiFi is available at the pool and lobby only. Bottom line - this place is over priced, not very clean and provides minimal service.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful property full of history, class and excellence.”
Reviews.Author: Cielaklvr
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful, relaxing weekend at the Arizona Biltmore. We booked several months in advance and were able to take advantage of an excellent promo that offered the room with breakfast, lunch and dinner and also offered a 30% discount on spa services. It was so nice to relax and not have to worry about leaving the property. We unwound with a couple of massages at the spa and spent our time enjoying the beautiful grounds and soaking in the sun by one of the gorgeous pools. Upon arrival we were greeted by a very friendly check in agent who upgraded our room and explained the meal package to us. Our room was very large with French doors that led out to our private patio. The bathroom was big with a double vanity, tub w/ shower and separate toilette area. The room was very clean and the housekeeping staff was friendly.
