We ate breakfast, lunch and dinner at Frank & Albert's restaurant. They have a nice selection of menu items with something to satisfy all appetites and the staff was excellent on each visit. One night we had dinner at Wrights restaurant. WOW! Our meal was fantastic and our server was so friendly, professional and knowledgeable. We really enjoyed that meal. Since it's December, the entire property is decorated for the holidays and it's just beautiful. We enjoyed sitting in the lobby bar in the evening, listening to the entertainment and enjoying all the Christmas lights and decorations. On Sunday morning we walked to the Cafe and had Starbucks coffee with muffins, juice and fruit bowls. It was all included with our meal package. What a deal! We had a great time and everyone at the Biltmore was professional, friendly and accommodating. We look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “my praise for regino alcon and advice for BIltmore AZ!”
Reviews.Author: hcarmich42
Reviews.Content: This is still a timeless and amazing property. You can almost still feel Jackie and JFK playing tennis, and Marilyn Monroe out by her favorite pool. If you are serious about top-notch customer service, however, just stay across the street at the Ritz. The service is very hit or miss at this hotel, which only makes me laud Regino in engineering all the more. Our door lock was defective... While I was waiting for someone from the front desk to bring new keys (which wouldn't have solved the problem), Regino saw me sitting forlornly by my door and walked 50 yards over to me to inquire if I needed anything. He didn't have to do that. It took some work, but he effiiciently and graciously fixed the problem. The lady at the coffee shop/cafe practically was growling at everyone this morning (am not a morning person either, but really??). Housekeeper too - wow on rude. I can forgive almost anyone becuase perhaps their mom is sick, dog died, etc. But it amazes me that ladies and gentlemen serving ladies and gentlemen doesn't seem to apply at this property -- except for the rare gems such as Regino (and James at the front desk). The great staff make it all worth the stay... the history and door locks are just a bonus. HC, NCSL Conference Attendee

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel and what great service”
Reviews.Author: Loves2Travel001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Biltmore during the Thanksgiving Holiday. The service could not have been better from the front desk to the nice man (Regenio, I think) who came to help me fix the heater during an unexpected cold snap. I stayed in a lovely "cottage" that was quiet and had a great patio. I loved walking the beautiful grounds. Since I was in four hotels during that trip, I have a perspective on clean and cared for. The cottage was the cleanest of all the places I stayed. The bed was the best, not too soft or too hard. I do not usually use the shampoo and conditioner from a hotel, but I was intrigued by these and pleasantly surprised at how good they were; my hair needed the moisturizer after a trip up to Sedona and touring Indian sites in the wind. I did think the Hotel needed more entrance signage as it was a bit difficult to find at night. Once I drove right past it. I do like how hidden away it is, but signs on the main street or better ligts by the entrance would be good.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: 1937Forever
Reviews.Content: I like Frank Lloyd Wright Architecture - Which is why we stayed here. The main hotel lobby is reasonably faithful to the original appearance. The rooms and dining/bar areas are typical' contemporary hotel' - nice, but nothing special. We went for Thanksgiving and had the $75.00 brunch. This was good food - but disjointed service as we really were not sure who was the server - Many people running in panic that worked there. We had a small bar table for three people that had the table cloth all over the floor and kept getting tangled up in the chairs. The drink situation went from 'where are you?' to 'leave us alone'!. It is interesting that on each occasion - longtime staff made a point to tell us that Hilton is running the property into the ground and how awful it is to work there, now. I must remember to not apply for work there... Beware, also, of a lot of 'hidden' or fine print charges. You have to pay $28.00 per day for a 'resort fee' and they don't even tell you what it is for - All we do is sleep and eat, anyway... They also may charge for ANY kind of parking and the Thanksgiving dinner even had a 25% gratuity and 'service' charge. I think I should have kept some silverware to make it seem worthwhile...

Reviews.Title: “Great resort. Super family destination”
Reviews.Author: AnotherHoustonian
Reviews.Content: The hotel and grounds are gorgeous. The architecture is simply spectacular. The rooms are well appointed in addition to being spotlessly clean. The pools are super special. This would be a great place with kids. Tons of activities and the pool area is really cool. The service is top notch. Everyone from the gardener to the waiter was friendly and helpful. No wireless internet, but they do offer wired internet and it's free (a welcome surprise in luxury hotels.) We were a couple without kids and this is a great romantic getaway as well. Our room was totally quiet despite having neighbors on both sides. (I only know they were there because I saw them. I never heard a peep, not even a shower) We ate at Frank and Albert's on the property. The ambiance was wonderful (ask for the backroom with the fireplace). The price wasn't cheap, but was definitely reasonable given the quality, ambiance and location. If you want to go out, Camelback Road is moments away and the options are endless. We were really surprised that this was both a great couples and and family destination. The combination is hard to come by, but this resort pulls it off wonderfully.

Reviews.Title: “We will return!”
Reviews.Author: MaraleeTucson
Reviews.Content: Our visit started with Sarah Goodell helping us with check in. So helpful. We played golf and Clark Hobbs in the pro shop assisted us with our choices. Again, very helpful. We had a problem with the heating in the room and Regeno Alcan from Engineering solved our problem immediately. We will recommend the Biltmore to our friends and we will return for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother unless you're rich or on expense account”
Reviews.Author: BillStickers_7
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beautiful, historic estate. Lots of picture of presidents and whatnot who stayed there in past. Striking distance to some decent hiking trails. Big, clean, quiet well appointed rooms. Cottages don't have wireless internet, but ethernet cable long enough to work in patio area. Campus-like setting with fresh air, plants, humming birds. Cottages very quaint - nice switch of standard hotel experience. Reasonable ($25) taxi fare from air port. Polite staff at reception, concierge, bell desk and elsewhere. Cons. Isolated. Rent car to get most anywhere in town. On-site shops, cafe and bars gouge you because of hotel's isolation - $14 for socks, $16 for latte and muffin, $17 for glass of wine at bar. Much of grounds devoted to apparently unused putting greens. Difficult to attract attention of restaurant and bar room wait staff. Moldy grout (yuk!), my in cottage at least. Surprisingly noisy grounds - always a leaf blower, tree trimmer, lawn mover, power generator or some other machine making stay less than tranquil. Surrounded on two sides by beautiful mountains (especially at sunrise/sunset), but buildings by and large block view of them.

Reviews.Title: “Coppola Wine Dinner”
Reviews.Author: threeputtpar
Reviews.Content: This was such a wonderful event. The food was not only delicious but a true work of art. The wines from Coppola's Rubicon Estate brought the evening to a wonderful and classy climax. I highly recommend trying the wine dinners at the Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “We Keep Going Back-- It's Like Home!”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnob11
Reviews.Content: We've tried at a few Hotel/Spas in the Phoenix area and always end up going back to the Biltmore. We've taken our children and gone by ourselves. It's one of those places that can make both types of travelers happy. My favorite is the spa! I had a great deep tissue massage from Robert. But I also had the most relaxing massage that I have ever had in my entire life! I got an 80 minute hot stone massage from Christina-- it was amazing. There's also a great person in the salon-- Mi Lon. I got a mani/pedi and a fantastic blow out. The hotel and spa staff are always dedicated to making your stay a great one. The rooms: We've stayed in regular rooms and the villa rooms. All of the rooms we've stayed in needed updating but I hear they're doing it in stages. I believe they have already completed one wing. We love sitting outside by one of the big fires and having a drink. The inside bar is great as well. This is such a relaxing place to stay and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - rooms could do with a bit more TLC”
Reviews.Author: wilko51
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Biltmore and it remains my favourite hotel in Phoenix. It was built in the thirties and has a charm lacking in so many of the resort hotels in Phoenix. That being said the rooms are starting to look a little frayed around the edges. My room was a cottage near the main lawn. It was a good size but the bathroom felt a little tatty and the shower was also a little worse for wear. Normally I would not care but the Biltmore is at the top-end of the market so everything should be spot on. The general hotel environment is lovely - especially the fire-pit area where you can chill with a nice glass of wine. The Biltmore gym has been re-kitted out since my last stay with an excellent variety of cardio kit. Overall a very pleasant stay at the Biltmore but it is just one small step away from being a truely great experience. Also played golf at the resort. Have to say that the links course is much better than the other course (cannot remember its name).

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Debra1313
Reviews.Content: My husband had to attend a conference in downtown Phoenix so I decided to go along for some relaxtion time. We did not want to stay right downtown and decided on the Biltmore, after all I was looking forward to the Spa! Starting with check in, which went fine...that was until they gave us a very small map and pointed...turn here and here...needless to say we did get lost and had trouble finding the room. Why would such a nice place not have someone to take you to your room the first time? We had asked for a balcony room, however when we got to the room the balcony was "attached" to the room next door. With me being there so much by myself I did not want that. We contacted the front desk and had no problem getting the room changed to one with it's own balcony. Of course we had to go back and find the lobby and then find our second room. The room was very nice and had a great big bathroom. The Spa...it was fantastic! I had a massage and a facial. Both the treatments and the therapists were great. It is a wonderful Spa and I do recommend it. I took the "Biltmore" tour of the hotel which is free to guests, and it was really interesting. I would recommend it. You learn tons of interesting facts about the era and the hotel. We ate in both restaurants. Both were very good but extremely pricey. Now don't get me wrong we like a good dinner, but at Wrights it was $202.00 for the two of us! It was good but it was not that good. We eat at "Ruth's Chris Steakhouse" here at home and while it is expensive it would have been less than that and much better. I was really looking forward to the Biltmore, and it turned out to be nothing like I expected. I was very disappointed. I expected a relaxing resort environment. What I got was a "convention" site. There were multiple "conventions" every day. You can imagine very large groups of people talking loudly together, large "gatherings" in the middle of the grounds. It was really a bummer. I never felt like I was at a resort. They even turned regular rooms into meeting centers so no matter where you went you never felt you were in a "relaxing" environment. I would not recommend this hotel if you are looking for a quiet, romantic, relaxing vacation. I sure wish I had known that, then at least I could have made my decision with all the information. Going there for business? This would be a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lucia324
Reviews.Content: The buildings and grounds are stunning, the service is great, rooms comfortable if not as luxurious as you'd expect for the price. I'm always irritated at places that charge for wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a vacation but not for a business traveler”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveler053
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is historic and beautiful, as a business traveler I was disappointed. I travel extensively on business and often stay at Hilton properties. In fact I am a Gold VIP member. This is the first Hilton property I have stayed at that does not offer WiFi in the rooms. Also, it may sound trivial, but I expect to find in room coffee (I later learned it was available but for an extra charge). Given the higher than average room rates I would expect such amenities would be provided. When I arrived at the airport I called and asked for a shuttle, only to be informed that the Biltmore does not provide such service. I took a taxi but was disappointed when I arrived at the hotel to find that, although there were several hotel employees standing around the entrance, they were apparently not there to help guests as they simply stared at me as I struggled to get my luggage out of the taxi and into the hotel. Once inside I looked for the HHonors registration desk which the Hilton website said was there. If so, I could not find it. Later on I found I needed some additional toiletries and asked the Concierge for help. I was informed that I could take a taxi to a drug store (according the Concierge it probably would cost me $25 - $30 each way). It was clear that the person at the Concierge desk was completely indifferent to my request since after telling me to go get a taxi he turned away and left. Frankly I expect better treatment than this from what is supposed to be a first class hotel. I might consider this property as a vacation destination but I will never stay here again on business and will make sure my colleagues are aware of my reasons!

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel; excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: AiredaleTraveler
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Biltmore, attending a conference in the hotel. My room was in the main building - average room - not luxurious - but, adequate for a short stay. The common areas were very nice - especially the main hall and dining areas. Our octagonal conference room was very unique and comfortable. Most notably, the food was very good - I ate 6 meals at the hotel and every one was consistently well prepared and well served. The staff throughout the hotel went out of their way to make our stay extraordinary. From the bartenders to the front desk employees, everyone was very friendly and accommodating. My first morning at the hotel, I noticed that both drains in the room were clogged - I reported the problem to the main desk and within 2 hours they sent up a maintenance guy who fixed the problem. And, they gave me a credit on my bill - a very nice touch. In sum, I would definitely stay here for a conference, family vacation or romantic get-away. Don't expect luxury at a Ritz or Four Seasons level - but, you will experience very helpful and friendly staff, good food and a very unique environment.

Reviews.Title: “Ocatilla higher end rooms total waste and disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Erik_and_Stephanie
Reviews.Content: This is my third time to the Biltmore. I come every year in October for business and pleasure. Let me begin with the positive. The grounds are always outstanding. The pools are comfortable and clean. The main restaurant is also pretty good. So that's the good stuff. I gather the Waldorf Astoria Company knows it is time to update the rooms at this property. Good chance they have not been since Marilynn Monroe was there as a regular. However, as a start they have created a boutique hotel within the hotel called "Ocatilla". It costs extra to stay there but you get updated rooms, continental breakfast and beer/wine in the afternoon. They also have a staff member within the building to help you. Sounds good, right? Well, it's not!! The rooms are nicely updated but lack more common amenities found in higher end properties. For example, TV in the bathroom, more than two towels in the bathroom, decent shampoo and conditioner. We actually ran out of shampoo and towels because they don't give you enough of either. The scale in the bathroom didn't work and neither did the TV remote in the bedroom. I mean, when you get right down to it, the room was about what you'd get at an average hotel... not high end "boutique" as they call it. But that's not the worst of it. They promote this higher end stay as having a free continental breakfast. It was about the worst I have seen. They had these tiny stale bagels that when toasted only got worse. The muffins were stale as well. The granola looked okay but they had no yogurt to mix it with... I guess just eating it dry is meant to match the dry Arizona weather. Kidding aside, I found the free breakfast just what you'd expect - you get what you pay for. But wait a minute, I thought I did pay for it with the mark up on the room. BTW, I did kindly complain to the staff person assigned to the Ocatilla and she promised to speak to her manager about at least providing yogurt but nothing changed while we were there. Anyway, we checked out on Friday and moved down the street to the Phoenician and for the same price I feel like we're in heaven. Much better. Waldorf Astoria... you really have allowed your reputation to be compromised.

Reviews.Title: “It's a beautiful resort.”
Reviews.Author: chris50Boston
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice. The service was excellent . The location was very convenient. If I go back to Phoenix, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great grounds but past its prime”
Reviews.Author: n_leibo
Reviews.Content: BIltmore is a very nice place, but its rooms could use a bit of freshening up, especially at the prices they charge. Staff is courteous and responsive. The nice thing is that they have so many pools you could choose to go to a quiet pool with mainly adults or to a pool that would be more appropriate for young children. The grounds are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Old charm but needs upgrading.....”
Reviews.Author: erinpope23
Reviews.Content: I guess we staying in the "old section" of the Az Biltmore, as you can see many new and beautiful parts to the property. But we were int he Valley wing and it was very outdated. The carpets were probably original, very worn and faded. Block walls in the halls were dirty looking. The room was very large but looked strange because the bed was off in an alcove and then there were 2 chairs and ottoman off to one side, a desk over to another side and this huge room with nothing in the center. I am not kidding, you could hold a 10 person yoga class in the middle! Dresser was very old, not antique and quaint, just old. I would definitely ask to be put in the newer/upgraded rooms next time. The pool area was beautiful, the grounds lovely, and the staff was very nice, but definitely some refurbishment needed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: waldoinparis
Reviews.Content: We traveled to this hotel from the East Coast for a wedding with our 3-month-old. It was very comfortable and very clean. They gave us a crib to use that was also clean and safe. The setting is gorgeous and the restaurants are actually good. The pools and amenities including the golfing is great. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “If you must do business in July in Phoenix, do it here”
Reviews.Author: joysroad
Reviews.Content: I'm in and out of Phoenix for business and I love to center my meetings here, and take a straight shot back to the airport. I must admit I love my Frank Lloyd Wright. Don't think I'm made of money. It doesn't cost all that much to do business here. I'm not eating at Wright's. I still miss L'Orangerie, which was my home territory since the 70's but I'm usually at the Patio & Grill. The rooms? Choose carefully. There are some small, dark ones tucked away. Inspect and reject, if necessary. But make sure you spend plenty of time in the public areas enjoying the ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort is the priority”
Reviews.Author: Traveler32722
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this lovely property for a week.Every step of this glorious property is maintained. The old world charm is mixed well with current day service. Each employee makes every effort to make sure your stay is pleasurable. The beds have to be the most comfortable I have slept in. The coffee shop as they call it has some of the best food found any where in Phoenix, There truly is no reason to leave the property everything you need is available.

Reviews.Title: “I would come back”
Reviews.Author: AllClear
Reviews.Content: I came here for a business trip and was pleasantly surprised at the luxury of this location. It offers a variety of sleeping quarters from a traditional hotel room to cottages and villas. The resort was at approximately 70% capacity, but because it is large and spread out, you never felt crowded or overwhelmed with other travelers. There are several pool areas accommodating kids and adult relaxation. There is a nice fitness spa. Also, a nice walking trail and golf right on the property. The service of the housekeeping, bartending, and waitresses was great. There is not much of a night life activity except for the bar and the pool. No music or dancing on property. The food was good and reasonably priced. I would recommend this to my company for a meeting. And I would also come back for a vacation destination.

Reviews.Title: “Always impressed with the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: workhardplayhardguy
Reviews.Content: My family and i took advantage of a wonderful deal on the internet one weekend in August. It was a belated birthday getaway gift from the Mrs. We have stayed at the Biltmore before for a romantic getaway and wanted to experience it as a family. The Biltmore seems to be the standard by which we compare other hotels and resorts. Hands down, the Biltmore never fails to disappoint us and always seems to impress us. We live in Phoenix and visit the Biltmore on special occasions. The resort staff is always friendly and accommodating and the resort itself is an iconic location within the city. Our last trip to the Biltmore we left the property one night for dinner but this time we did not leave the resort for any meal. We took advantage of the restaurants within the resort and were most impressed with Frank & Albert's! Our waitrons made each meal there very pleasant and the food on the menu was perfect. We had the pleasure of meeting chef Bryan who capped off our already impressive score of the place and made it an A+. Our room was very nice and had a balcony which allowed the Mrs and I to enjoy some wine while our child slept. Taking in the views and enjoying the resort that made us feel like we were in an Oasis within a city! Our only disappointments were the main pool was a bit unkept and too crowded on Saturday and seemed overwhelming. It probably had something to do with our favorite pool being closed for remodeling- the Catalina. Overall our stay rec'd an A. The resort staff and within the Frank and Alberts restaurant made up for any imperfections we had at the pool or on the grounds. A must visit for anyone coming to Phoenix. We did not get to experience any of the spa services this trip and the trails on the property are always stunning, just remember to bring water on your journey.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible resort - excellent food, service and ambience!”
Reviews.Author: sb102294
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore is an amazing resort! First class service, ambience and food. Extremely friendly staff. We did not leave the resort because it was so beautiful! We highly recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “"$45 for Chips and Beer?!?" Yes but they were the best chips ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DavidFancher
Reviews.Content: You can't expect everything to be perfect, but when things go sideways how do they handle it? Well the staff at the Arizona Biltmore did a fantastic job! We were very uncomfortable in our initial room so we addressed this with the hotel staff. They were very accomodating and moved us without hesitation. I give them big kudos for that. Even with summer rates you will find it expesive here. We actually paid $45 for chips and 2 beers by the pool (pool side service). You will pay to park and pay a resort fee. There are plenty of activities here some free and some not. On Saturday they offered a s'mores station for the guests and live music. The grounds are fantastic and the pools are relaxing. The history of this place was awesome as well. Our stay was worth the money. Impressions... Romance: Yes very much so Night Life: Relaxed Resort activities: Abundant and fun Value: You can easily spend a lot of money. Some unexpected charges. Recomended traveler: People who love Historical Elegance and charm. Overall: Worth it Side note: this hotel is nearly 100 years old. If you stay in the summertime The main building was warm and stuffy, expecially during the monsoon season (July - August). 1st night we ate in one of the Restaurants and it was uncomfortable. The next night was Room Service. We paid $100 total for two steaks, a bottle of wine and AIR CONDITIONING. I highly recomend the room service at least once!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: badlybitten13
Reviews.Content: I had the unfortunate experience of staying at the Arizona Biltmore Hotel over Labor Day weekend. The first night I was in the hotel room, I found a black beetle in my bed crawling all over me. The second night I started noticing red itchy bumps on my back, stomach, legs and ankles. I began to realize that these bumps were spreading as the weekend progressed. I notified the front desk about the bites and they sent security and the head of housekeeping to check my bed. They stated that they did not find "any substantial evidence" as to why I was getting bitten. They changed the sheets and gave me itch medicated pads but sure enough the next day I woke up with more bites. It is almost a week later and I still have these bites that appear to be getting worse. I am very disappointed in the experience I gained from the Biltmore Arizona. I never expected to feel miserable while being on vacation. I will never return to this hotel again and I will never recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Check before you go ...too”
Reviews.Author: VA-Panache
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, Megstravel15 was accurate about the activities going on at the Arizona Biltmore this past weekend. We too arrived to the “carnival” atmosphere and raucous crowd. My husband and I decided after enduring the first nite that we needed to change hotels. I did speak with the manager; he was very apologetic and helpful. He and the Concierge arranged for us to relocate (Thank you!) We would like to give the Az Biltmore the benefit of the doubt and try again but we will absolutely ask about any groups that are booked at the time of our intended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Check who's in town first...”
Reviews.Author: megstravels15
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review for trip advisor, but after the weekend I just experienced at the Biltmore I thought it would be a good time to start. My family and I chose this place to get together from different parts of the country and celebrate my grandmother's 90th birthday because of it's wonderful reputation in the past. What a huge disappointment when we arrived and felt like we were in a cheesy Vegas hotel. There was a huge group that was drunk, flashing at the pool and wandering the halls screaming at 3AM the entire weekend. We all stayed in different portions of the hotel and all had similar experiences. There were 45 minute waits for cabs, fights at the bar, it was insane! Nothing we would have ever expected from a resort like this, labor day weekend or not. So, a heads up- the rooms are nice, the grounds very pretty, the service and food wonderful but double- no, triple check what is going on at the resort before you book. Our trip was ruined because we were constantly interrupted and surrounded by this craziness. Hopefully, the Biltmore can get it together and prevent this type of behavior from ruining another family's wonderful event- unfortunately for us, it's too late.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing from the Get-go”
Reviews.Author: fleabitten_10
Reviews.Content: Arrived at noon from Boston, MA, and did not expect that the room would be ready but asked anyway. I was told it was being cleaned, and would get a call when it was ready. Checked back at 2pm, 3pm and still told not ready because the hotel was full. At 4:10pm I went to the desk again, was told that since I am guaranteed a room by 4pm, they may have to give me a different room. I asked them to call the housekeeper and the room was, in fact, ready. On making the reservation months ago, I had asked for a refrigerator since my mother is diabetic. I was told that would be no problem. When asking about this, I was told to take beer, etc., out of the wet-bar, put them in a drawer and replace them upon leaving. Others colleagues were told to do the same. The clincher was when I had to sit in the West Foyer for four hours to direct delegates to the auxiliary registration desk. After about an hour, my feet started severely itching. I looked down and had bug bites all over my feet up to where my slack line ended due to sitting down. Two days later I went to the Concierge to report this since my ankles were still red and swollen, and they notified Security. I met with Security who took a report and gave me some itch-medicated pads and told me that I could pursue this further. Once home, I sent a fax to the hotel, and the matter was eventually turned over to Security Risk Services in California who sent out questionnaires to some of my colleagues who were witnesses to the fact that I was bitten. I received a copy of one stating that there were either bugs in the upholstery or rugs and that the hotel is dirty and musty. In fact, the West Foyer smells like a sewer and the Main Foyer like a cow pasteur. I received a response similar to the person bitten by bedbugs that no evidence was found to substantiate my claim. In summary, with all the feral cats running around on the property, the hotel can continue to "brush things under the rug" but, eventually the truth/fleas will surface.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Arizona”
Reviews.Author: lariatlane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding in August. The grounds are absolutely beautiful. From the moment of check-in the service was impeccable. We were in an upgraded room in one of the newer buildings. The suite was wonderful. Large sitting area, comfortable bed, and AMAZING bathroom! The Biltmore is an example of Arizona at its best.

Reviews.Title: “A chance to stay at the Arizona Biltmore was worth the wait”
Reviews.Author: Traceyabbywhite
Reviews.Content: The grounds are impressive, the service second to none. While our room was one of the more economical ones, we had a balcony with a view of the gardens and more then ample room for the two of us. We savored the tasting menu in the Gold room. A delectable 4-course meal with wine pairings was well worth the price. We loved the Catalina pool boasting intricate lapis and yellow tile, and one can understand why it is said to have been Marilyn Monroe’s favorite. The putting course provides ample entertainment while one of us went to the spa! I would put this on your bucket list it you have not already done so.

Reviews.Title: “Wonder when it will drop from the Waldorf-Astoria Collection because service is spotty.”
Reviews.Author: NorthCarolinaMonkey3
Reviews.Content: I regret foregoing my usual stay at the Phoenician Resort, W Hotel, or Montelucia Resort (all within 5 miles of this Arizona Biltmore) when I was in Phoenix/Scottsdale area this weekend. Noticing AZ Biltmore had a special rate in the summer I opted to give it a try. After all, it's advertised as being part of the Waldorf-Astoria Collection. But based on my experience, the customer service at the front desk makes it more like a cheap motel. They must have cut back customer service training with the recent turn in the economy. They messed up my rate, but was not even apologetic. Mr. Gonzales at the front desk made me feel like I was begging for the special rate when it was clearly posted on the website as their AAA rate that night. I am a Diamond member (highest level) with their loyalty program and I was treated so poorly. I can't imagine how poor service could have been if I was just a walk-in guest w/o any loyalty affiliation. When I got to my room, there was an unsightly tray with left over food right outside my door. I called to ask them to remove it as I was expecting friends to visit. After 2.5 hrs and 3 calls later, they finally removed it.! I was already warned the resort is a bit dated, but I was willing to give it a try since most luxury collections tend to keep their structure up to date. On the negative side, the A/C is a bit old so it made a lot of noises. On the positive side, the maintenance man was able to quickly fix it. Seems like my quick 10 hr stay at the resort only amounted to me running into every back luck I can get here. I do want to comment the valet guys are really good and very accommodating. If I had to do it again, I would definitely go back to the Phoenician, Montelucia or the W Hotel Scottsdale. All 3 of them are staffed with well trained customer service personnel and there is no spottiness in terms of service from different areas of the resort. They know how to treat their guests as guests rather than a revenue headcount. Plus, they tend to give better upgrades to members of their loyalty program. Perhaps there are many positive aspects of this resort. But when customer service is poor, it's dififcult to recover from it. I wouldn't be surprised if the Waldorf Astoria downgrades them in the new future as this is not to par with their collection.

Reviews.Title: “It's a lovely historic hotel with modern amenities in a good location and has a great staff.”
Reviews.Author: STinAZ
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Biltmore was all that I expected from a 5-star hotel: large rooms with plush bedding, recreation for all age groups, good location, beautiful setting, and an entire staff that was professional and looked after all requests promptly!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ThompsonCR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married at the Biltmore in August. The staff was so helpful, and got us everything we needed. The property is gorgeous, the rooms are nice, and everyone is very courteous. I would highly recommend it for anyone for any occasion!

Reviews.Title: “oasis in the desert”
Reviews.Author: ginaeber
Reviews.Content: Lovely manicured lush grounds, nice boutique shops. Great restaurants and staff. Very relaxing atmosphere. Fabulous lobby. Awesome pools.

Reviews.Title: “The Arizona Biltmore exceeded our expectations - a truly luxurious stay!”
Reviews.Author: PeteRose_1243
Reviews.Content: We've always wanted to stay in Sedona, Arizona and planned our trip to fly into Phoenix, stay 2 nights somewhere within Phoenix to settle into the new climate before driving to Sedona. After some research, we found the Arizona Biltmore. Our criteria was a 4 or 5-star hotel with a nice property and nice pools for some sunning and relaxation. We needed a room large enough to accomodate the 2 of us and our 17 and 13 year old sons. We were allowed to check in 7 hours early and the reception was very welcoming and friendly! We were very happy with our room in the Ocatilla wing of the property which allowed us exclusive use of one of the pools reserved for Ocatilla guests. We also had access to an executive lounge that offered all of us complimentary continental breakfast and other amenities during the day and into the evening. The hotel property was incredibly large with beautiful gardens, small private cottages and multi-room buildings. The property was immaculately maintained and everyone was very friendly and helpful! This is definitely one of the nicest hotel properties we've ever had the pleasure of staying at and would definitely consider another stay here!

Reviews.Title: “hidden extra fees”
Reviews.Author: robnkellie
Reviews.Content: price for room was affordable. we paid $125.00 a night. but watch out for extra fees. valet parking was $25.00 a night or self parking was $12.00 a night. also there was a resort fee of $28.00 a day. we stayed three nights and our check out bill was over $550.00 and we did not charge anything to room. We did not spend much time on the property, we were there to move our twin daughters into their dorm rooms at ASU. Maybe if we had more free time we would have enjoyed the grounds and amenities they provide. But overall the extra fees we paid, left a bad taste in our mouths.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: HFC2010
Reviews.Content: The only place to stay! Amazing customer service, outstanding food, friendly staff! It was my birthday and the hostess wished me a happy birthday when we checked into Wrights before dinner. Then the waiter wished me a happy birthday also; both had smiles on their face and seemed very happy to be there! They made my fiance' and I feel very special, and the accomodations were perfect! We enjoyed the pool, the fantastic restaurants and the suite we stayed in was perfection: the most comfortable bed, great shower and tub, huge balcony overlooking the pool...everything you would want and never know you wanted! We will definetly return to the AZ Biltmore! Maybe even make it a yearly tradition!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort”
Reviews.Author: ShoeQ
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this resort to anyone! One of the many resort pools was located right outside our patio. What a great location! It was very convenient walking right out the patio doors and into the pool area. We were able to peruse the grounds pretty freely. We did comment to each other that the security is pretty lax though. The paradise pool is the biggest pool. Our room was big and very clean and the bathroom had two double sinks which was nice. The bed was very comfortable. Room service was prompt. It was a fun girls' weekend!! I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “One of the most handsome hotels you'll ever see.”
Reviews.Author: RalphLikeALion
Reviews.Content: Totally agree with the reviewer below who mentioned early Hollywood glamour, that's exactly how my fiancee described this place. The hotel buildings and furnishings are STUNNING. We stayed in the main building with a view overlooking the beautifully maintained lawn and fountains. We got an incredible deal here for 4 nights due to the sweltering heat in the Valley recently and the Biltmore didn't disappoint. Some highlights of our stay: - The most comfortable bed, sheets and pillows I have ever experienced. Seriously, we stayed here at the end of a two week trip across NM and AZ and I've never slept so well. - The "dive-in" movie. What a great experience! They showed Raiders of the Lost Ark on a huge screen dangled between two palm trees by the main pool one night and threw in a load of things to float on. Fantastic idea! - The smell in the hallways! It's funny the little things you notice and remember in hotels sometimes but honestly, Idon't know what they pumped through that air con but it was so nice. The one and only possible negative I would mention is that our room wasn't quite as luxurious as we might have expected and some of the bathroom was a little bit tired. I think it was partly down to the fact we'd just walked through the hotel to get to our room and you get used to the beauty. Overall, I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone who appreciates great architecture and old-fashioned charm. A great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing quite like it!”
Reviews.Author: Jorylu
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out, we had a an experience that set the standard against which all other hotels will be measured. Its a large, resort with many buildings, so I'm sure not all the rooms are in the same condition, but ours (in the ocotilla wing) was lovely. Well appointed and spacious with a balcony view of Piestewa peak. The best part about the Ocotilla wing is that it has its own concierge and a lounge with complimentary snacks, drinks, and dessert. If you stay here I recommend the Ocotilla wing (though I am curious to see what the experience would be like at the Villas, the Cottages and the original building). The pools were all well maintained, though only the Paradise Pool had food, beverage and towel amenities. The grounds were meticulous. The fine dining restaurant (Wright's) and the casual restaurant (Frank and Albert's) each had great food, service and ambiance. We didn't use the spa, fitness center or golf course (which is apparently owned and operated by a different entity) so I cannot comment on those. Every employee we dealt with had a friendly demeanor, was eager to help us and often used our names - great personal service! We will definately return to experience the Arizona Biltmore in the winter months, even though the rates won't be such a bargain. We're willing to pay a little more for such an unforgettable time in a unique hotel steeped in history and luxury!

Reviews.Title: “A fine, historical, grand place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: MissyMew
Reviews.Content: The history here is great, from all of the Presidents who have stayed here, to the artwork, to the original design by Frank Lloyd Wright and more. It's worth taking a tour! The putting course is lots of fun for all ages, and the pools are all nice. Although there is not a water ""park" like so many AZ hotels include, they have done a nice job adding a slide in one pool. They do arrange kids activities. Our ten year old was quite busy and happy. Our teenage son did not find as much to do, but did also enjoy the stay. It's truly an elegent hotel with first class service, (ie: no coffee in the room unless you order room service or visit the on-location Starbucks). Some hotels in Phoenix skimp on service during the summer, but not this one. The older rooms are larger than the newer additions, so it's worth double checking what type of room you'll be receiving. Well worth a summer time stay, when the rates are about 1/3 to 1/4 of what they are the rest of the year!

Reviews.Title: “Watch those sneaky fees”
Reviews.Author: el_justarino
Reviews.Content: I went there for a one night "stay- caytion" as I live here in the valley. I figured it would be a great way to check out this historic hotel. The resort itself is decent (Starwood seems better) but the main issue was I picked the Biltmore based around it's decent price at $119. When the stay was said and done the bill was $180 so there were approx $60 in taxes, resort fees, and parking fees. Taxes are taxes and the resort fee are understandable to an extent but to pay for parking seems a bit ridiculous. It seems that the rearranging of the fees are just a way to present a cheap room rate and then BAM your $100 room turns into a $200 room a the blink of an eye.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: letstraveltogether44
Reviews.Content: My stay for four nights over the July 4th holiday was so fantastic on so many levels! The service from the hotel staff was superior! The rooms are very spacious and comfortable, especially the beds. The beds boast new mattresses, down pillows, comforters and high thread count sheets. The classic historical architecture and the manicured grounds and the pool areas added to the pleasure of my stay. The food was good. The 4th of July program including fireworks was fun for all! This hotel is a great value and I would highly recommend a stay.

Reviews.Title: “OUT OF THIS WORLD!”
Reviews.Author: Aliwander
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed here for The Poisoned Pen conference in June and could not have been happier. The food was delicious at Frank & Albert's (try their fish tacos--best I've ever had in my life--gorgeous presentation!) and our accommodations were top-notch, top drawer with every amenity we could hope for. Total splurge and worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: MLG50
Reviews.Content: Great Art Deco design and the service was outstanding. Friendly staff and very helpful. Spacious and comfortable rooms A nice surprise was Frank and Alberts restaurant. All our meals there were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax in beautiful surroundings with outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: kuching_10
Reviews.Content: Though the map provided by the Biltmore omitted the key cross street of 24th Ave - everything else about our stay was outstanding!. This is a very service oriented hotel - from the valet parking, concierge, golf course/shop to the restaurants. We were reminded of the Regent in Singapore. The staff made us feel welcome and were extremely helpful in guiding us to various locations in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area. Each time the valet brought around our car we were given cold bottled water - nice touch. The appetizers and meals at Frank & Albert's were fresh and tasty. We would highly recommend this hotel! Nancy & Wayne

Reviews.Title: “We are locals and have found our oasis at the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: SearchOfBestPlaces
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in lovely Scottsdale Arizona, a suburb of Phoenix. During the hot Summer months we enjoy our weekend getaways at local first class resorts. We've stayed at the Royal Palms, the Four Seasons, etc. and have finally found "our home away from home" at the Arizona Biltmore. We recently decided to try The Arizona Biltmore because I had just become a Hilton Gold member and thus thought we would recieve special treatment. Upon check in I did learn of their parking charge of $12/night for guests. Shame on them. This is not NYC where space is at such a premium. That is the reason I did not give them an excellent rating on value. Other than that, our check in was most pleasant. Sara, who had just been with the property for 2 months, was a delight. We mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary and when we arrived to our room, Sara had arranged for a lovely dessert tray with a congratulatory note. What a nice welcome. Since we were in an Ocatilla room, we had access to the concierge, however, Sara was also at our service throughout the entire stay. We loved the pool, met some wonderful people from out of town, thoroughly enjoyed our breakfast at Frank and Alberts, took advantage of the fabulous room service, felt at home in our spacious room and just fell in love with the property. Funny, I assumed that all the attention we recieved was due to my "gold membership" status. Ironically, on the last day, I noticed that they had not in fact had me listed as a gold member (an admin issue which the hotel cleared up) and that this exceptional service was just the standard for the Biltmore. Upon check out, again with Sara, we booked another weekend for August. We are sold. We have found our favorite resort in the Phoenix area and it is the Arizona Biltmore. Of course the beauty of the place, the history and the location, all add to the ambiance of this property, but the people really made it something special for us. If you are traveling to Phoenix and are in search of the best hotel in the area, take it from a local, with first class taste. When we stay in Paris, we stay at the Ritz, Paris. When we stay in town, we now stay at the Arizona Biltmore. Thank you, BB - HH4923091

Reviews.Title: “incredible stay”
Reviews.Author: TheDixie
Reviews.Content: Just checked out of the Biltmore Arizona and I am not sure why it is ranked number 11 on trip advisor - this facility should be ranked number 1. We stayed 3 days at the Biltmore and we thought it was an incredible hotel. Stayed in the Octilla (sp?) section of the hotel in a junior suite. The first night we stayed we had a drink in the main building and my husband and I both commented on how this hotel made you feel like you were back in time - if that makes sense. With the pictures hanging around the resort you just felt the presence of the old movie stars and the presidents that have stayed at the resort over time. This was the ONLY good part of being in Phoenix in July. Phoenix is so very hot and you really can't spend alot of time outside without having a heat stroke. Anyway - i am a picky hotel guest and this resort met all my expectations of a Biltmore Resort. I would highly recommend this resort to any traveler going through Phoenix. They like to keep their guests entertained - examples: marshmallow roasts one night and the other night was how to roll a cigar - where you could roll your own cigar. cool I thought. My husband played golf on the links course and he seemed to have liked it. Not the best course he has played, but a challenging course. Anyway - enjoy your stay at the Biltmore - i know that i did!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the new Ocatilla Club”
Reviews.Author: SunnyWineBunny
Reviews.Content: Having high expectations, I sported the few extra dollars to stay in the new private Ocatilla Club. The extra dollars was well worth it. All of the rooms are brand new and spotless. A host of complimentary services are offered and you gain access to their Executive Club. In the morning there is a great continental style breakfast and in the evening there is a complimentary cocktail hour as well as a variety of lovely treats. The Biltmore is a sight to behold. Being a Frank Lloyd Wright fan, I could not stop taking pictures. My favorite meal of the trip was the Corned Beef Hash for breakfast in Frank & Alberts restaurant. Spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Service”
Reviews.Author: damian17
Reviews.Content: When visiting Arizona, the only hotel we stay at is the Arizona Biltmore. The grounds, rooms and service are all impeccable. If it is in your budget to rent a villa, I highly recommend it. They are absolutely beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Rockstar Stay at the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueen1313
Reviews.Content: I traveled here for work and it was fabulous! From the great restaurants to great main pool and amazing upgraded room and very friendly staff, we had a really great experience. The room was a 'villa' and like an apartment - full kitchen, living room, dining room, huge bathroom & bedroom with enormous patio. The only negative (which didn't affect us really at all because we used the main pool) is the lounge chairs by the smaller pools looked like they needed replacing. I would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The standard, by which, all other's should hope to attain.”
Reviews.Author: Mauishark
Reviews.Content: Aloha! I have traveled the world over, more times than should be allowed in one life time. I have stayed at many wonderful and comfortable hotels, but never with the overwhelming satisfaction that I have experienced at the Arizona Biltmore. If there was ever a standard by which all other hotels and staff are to be judged against, well, this takes the cake! From the very moment I arrived on the grounds to the moment I left, I can honestly say that I have never felt more welcome and appreciated as a guest at a hotel in my entire life. I was a Captain for American Airlines for 26 years. Trust me. I know service when I see it. I kid you not. The hotel itself is amazing! It is steeped in such rich history and memories, that you literally feel the presence of such guests as Ronald and Nancy Reagan, Frank Sinatra, Sammy Davis Jr., all US Presidents from Franklin Roosevelt to the Bushes. The movie "White Christmas" was written on the property. Not to mention the fact the the Hotel was designed under the influence of none other than Frank Lloyd Wright himself and his apprentice Albert. Which brings me to the real reason I have chosen to share my incredible experience with you. It is not really the hotel that I am writing about, but the incredible people who work there and make the Arizona Biltmore, not a mere hotel, but a home... Let me share some specifics. Ok, let's begin with Damien and Jason at "Frank and Albert's." For anyone who has traveled alone, you will completely get what I am about to share. From the very instant I sat down at the bar to order dinner, I felt as welcome and comfortable as I would at my own house. Damien is quite simply amazing! This guy will achieve greatness. Trust me! He is a sharp wit, incredibly professional, and treats you as if you were the first and last patron he will ever see! Damien makes you feel welcome. What more can one ask? Then there is John Watson. John is the F and B Manager for Wright's Bar. John has his act together. I hope he won't mind, but I over heard him comment on the significance of plastic cups and the impact upon a hotel's bottom line. I was very taken by this. A hotel is a business. I was struck by his obvious savvy, but perhaps even more impressed with his temperament and attitude. One evening I was having dinner at the hotel's fine dining restaurant: "Wright's." I was having dinner with the woman who is responsible for my coming to Phoenix in the first place. She is amazing!! But that is another story, and I'm presently allowing her to have the space necessary to figure her stuff out. Back to my glowing comments about John... So, two men were in the restaurant, and one of them was, shall we say: "over served." Not by the restaurant, but by his own accord. Yes, we have all been there, and the movie "Hang Over" is more than familiar, but Crikey people! This guy was out of control! Now, I would have taken some primitive pleasure in causing significant bodily harm to this idiot, but cooler heads prevailed, as they are want to do, and the cooler head was none other than John Aris Watson. Let me simply say that he resolved the issue. This man rocks! Let's move to the pool bar. Christen is a young girl who serves at the Main Pool Bar. She is unusual, in that she is born and raised in Phoenix. Once again, we have another outstanding and positive personality embodied in this gem of a person! Need I say more? Which takes me to the Spa. Weary and stressed from travel, I sought refuge in the Spa. By the way, I didn't realize this during my first three days at this oasis from life in the desert, but Spa access is included in your room rate there in Nirvana! Yay! I have A.D.D. sorry. "Flashy Silver Object look!" HaHa... Where was I? Oh yes. The Spa. Well, upon arriving to enjoy a well earned massage, I asked the attendant at the Spa counter for help in contacting the Concierge for assistance in obtaining flowers to assist me in winning the heart of the forementioned perfect lady for me. There I go again! Shut it Joel! Lol! So, this young lady at the Spa is named "Elissa?" Not sure, but WOW!!! She stunned me too! Here's what happened: So, I want to order a floral arrangement to give to my future wife (Ooops!). Elissa over hears me struggling to order flowers and offers her assistance. Thank God! So, she asks what I'm looking for, and I tell her that the girl of my desire, mentioned she likes Lilly's. I live in Hawaii, I think flowers are amazing, but I wouldn't know a Lilly from a Frilly! Elissa says, when do you need them, I tell her, and just as my massage is finished, there is a knock on my changing door. The attendant tells me that there is a floral arrangement waiting for me at the Front Desk. Holy Toledo! Wow? They were amazing!!!! Did I say amazing again? Well, that's the Biltmore! Well, I have gone on too long, I'm obviously not a writer, and I am running out of attention span, but certainly not the accolades for the staff at the Biltmore that makes it not just a Hotel, but a true home away from home. (That was a run-on sentence. Darn!) If I was really rich? I'd move in tomorrow! Besides, then I'd be closer to that elusive butterfly I want to be my wife one day;) There I go again... Can't say I didn't warn ya!! Trust me. Go to the Arizona Biltmore. Stay a few days, then you, like me, will extend your visit. Again and again. Not kidding! It's that amazing. It will alter your vision of the world. Maybe you'll find your soul mate too! Relax, Play and Breathe! Joel Edwards Maui, Hawaii P.S. This was fun!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location and Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Manmtn
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore is a beautiful resort and the conference facilities are very well laid out and organized. The rooms are clean and typical of other locations.

Reviews.Title: “finest and most responsive staff anywhere...”
Reviews.Author: sooner144
Reviews.Content: i have been here almost three weeks and am happy to comment that, without exception the staff and service at the resort has been outstanding......the restaurant staff (frank and alberts) in particular has been wonderful....the day manager matt went out of his way to ensure that all was well with myself and all other guests.....the wait staff to include tom and cheryl were excellent....tom may have been the finest, most polite, enthuiastic, attentive yet not overbearing, and knowledgable waiter i have ever experienced (i travel the world extensively)....the food was excellent and the chef scott robuck must be complimented on his efforts and interest in creating a perfect dining experience...chef scott went out of his way to be certain that my food was prepared well and to my liking as he visited my table several times in my stay.......the resort experience was excellent while the restaurant (frank and alberts) and staff, was PERFECT in every aspect......i will return....myles fisher...villa 7128

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: Robengar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ocatilla wing over 4th of July weekend. The resort is very beautiful and the updates in the Ocatilla wing were very nice. The lounge is good, but the limited hours and small size given the number of rooms in the wing made it very crowded at times. This might seem like nitpicking, but the toilet paper in the rooms was subpar for a gas station, much less the club level of a luxury resort. I think that they are heading in the right direction with the addition of the Ocatilla wing, but they are still nowhere near Ritz-Carlton or related club levels. There was a small fireworks display on the 4th at the hotel that was excellent given the fact that the hotel was putting on the display. We thought this was an incredible touch and were very impressed. While the staff was very polite in general, the service in the Frank & Albert restaurant was poor. On our first night we ate in the restaurant and it was almost empty but it still took forever for the waitress to refill waters, clear plates, bring new cocktails, etc. The food service also was very slow from the kitchen end. Since we were there to enjoy ourselves it was not an issue and we did not think much of it at the time. On the evening of the 4th we went back to the restaurant. We wanted to make sure that we would not be late for the fireworks display so we ordered all of our food immediately upon seating. After 50 minutes we still had not received our 2 hamburgers. We understand that the restaurant was busy, but 50 minutes for hamburgers is a little crazy. We ended up having to get them boxed up to go so that we would not miss the fireworks. When we got to our room after the fireworks the buns were completely soaked in grease and not very appetizing. Also, others in our party had gone with the buffet. During the entire meal, not one plate was cleared off the table to the point of having a small stack in the middle. Also drinks were left not refilled for most of the meal. This problem was not the end of the world, but it is the service that really sets true luxury hotels apart from the rest and in this regard Arizona Biltmore fell short of the Waldorf Astoria name the Hilton has decided to attach to it. We have stayed at the New York Waldorf many times, always with incredible service and also stayed this year at the Orlando location. In my opinion, Hilton is doing those locations a disservice by invoking the Waldorf name in regard to this resort. That being said, I thought the resort was very good throughout and would consider staying there again, it is just not anywhere near the top of my list for the area and if going back I would plan on eating elsewhere if I had anything on my agenda after mealtime.

Reviews.Title: “Communication”
Reviews.Author: JamesValona
Reviews.Content: Everything was great with the exception of one incident: I had left my phone in a friends car who dropped it off the following day at 10am. I asked the Front Desk throughout the day if a phone had been dropped off and throughout the day they said no. I really needed my phone to pick up work emails so I started to get a little panicked. It was finally at 8pm that I asked the Bell staff and they in fact did have my phone. I am just curious as to why there isn't any communication between valet and the Front Desk?

Reviews.Title: “Plan to stay again - longer!”
Reviews.Author: jkmtres
Reviews.Content: We had a change of plans that ended our Arizona vacation in Phoenix and booked the Arizona Biltmore last minute. Our stay was excellent; staff were professional, accommodations superior. I feel we received excellent value for the cost. We plan to make it a destination vacation this winter.

Reviews.Title: “Frank and Albert's- Very impressive!!!”
Reviews.Author: mcfarlinsusan84
Reviews.Content: While i didn't stay at the Biltmore, i had the pleasure of dinning at Frank and Albert's. I was very pleased with the brand new restaurant and how clean everything was kept. Jason the bartender, was very nice, attentive, and poured a great martini. The happy hour bar bites were a fun and tasty surprise served almost Tapas style. The smoked trout was to die for!! Chef Kyle came to the bar with a comforting smile and asked if I was pleased with my visit, which was a nice touch considering I was by myself. Thanks for making me feel welcome, Chef!! Everything was great. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Stay clear - bed bugs!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cam04g
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a business trip and although the conference and the hotel was nice, I ended up with bed bugs!! It started off with 2 bites to my inner wrist and neck and by the time i got home I was covered!! I called to alert them to this, and they said they would conduct an investigation. A couple calls and a couple "disconnections" later they finally did and said that they couldn't find anything and that it was most likely the "feathers poking me". Last I checked feathers do not bite. So i went to the Dr this morning who confirmed it was bed bugs. Still in the process of clearing up the situation- but be warned! -itchy & annoyed

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: taxchick0101
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was great, food at Frank & Albert's was wonderful and spa services were spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the salon and spa are the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: christine7797
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Biltmore was ideal. The hotel and staff were perfect, as usual. We had several spa treatments during our visit which were wonderful - extremely professional and relaxing. Our manicure and pedicure experience at the salon was wonderful - our nails were flawless, and we had a terrific time (make sure to ask for Mi Nor or Marylee!).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: ktleyed
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a fabulous stay at the Biltmore. This was my first time and I stayed for a long weekend with my two sisters. We shared a large and spacious room in the Ocatilla Section of the hotel and it's well worth the extra money. The lounge there provides a delicious continental breakfast, a happy hour with unlimited drinks and hors d'ouevres and later after dinner cordials, coffee and desserts. This is such a great deal and the service was tops. I got a very low rate too since it's off season. The Ocatilla concierge gave us a great recommendation to a nearby authentic Mexican restaurant, they printed up my return boarding pass and delivered it to me at my table at breakfast. I was charmed by the Biltmore. The separate Ocatilla pool was almost empty, even on the weekend, the workout room was clean and not crowded, I had no waits to get on the equipment, plenty of ice and water and towels and the spa ladies locker room was great as well. We had a roll a way for one night and they didn't even charge for it, and even though we had valet parking each day, we were charged as if it was the self parking ($12 instead of $27). I was pleasantly surprised with the bill. I have no negatives about this hotel. The grounds were immaculate and so beautiful and sprawling. It's somewhat of a walk to Ocatilla from the main building, but not bad, you pass the shops and it's a nice stroll, but hot if you're in the sun. I was pleased to no end and found no signs of wear and tear and need for a refurbishment and I can attest that our room was cleaned daily! I ran into the maid and she was so nice and accomodating, everyone was polite and made an effort to make our stay perfect! Try it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely delightful”
Reviews.Author: fxyjon
Reviews.Content: The service was wonderful. I asked for something that had been discontinued on the menu and the chef came to my table to tell me he would make it for me and he did and it was just as good as the review I'd read about it. I've stayed at many resorts and been on over 100 cruises and have never had any better service. The setting of the hotel is beautiful and the grounds are immaculate. I especially recommend the Ocotilla rooms which cost a little more but are definitely worth it. Everyone should experience this lovely place.

Reviews.Title: “Better options for what you get”
Reviews.Author: lknight26
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I have stayed at the Four Seasons Troon, Fairmont Princess, JW Camelback Inn, Montelucia, and now the Biltmore. The Biltmore is definitely last on my list. First off $28 resort which does not cover parking. Parking is $27 valet and $12 self park, so pretty much ridiculous! Additionally the fee doesn't cover much which is why I have no idea why they charge a resort fee. Besides internet services, the other options are pretty much included within the STANDARD room rate at the other resorts. And yes while the others may charge a resort fees, PARKING was included. The hotel is old and I stayed in the Ocatilla tower which suppose to be the newer section. If that's new, then I sure hate to see the old. While decent, they can't compare to the competition I stated aboved. Turn down service was awful, whereas they don't service your room just give you towels. No clean up or NOTHING. They were suppose to run bath water if you request it, never happened. Don't get wrong not running bath water is not gonna ruin my trip, just don't offer it if you aren't gong to actually do it. This is suppose to be included when you stay in this tower because again you pay more $$$$ to stay in the Ocatilla. One person though who was awesome is Jazmin with the Ocatilla Conceirge, she was very nice and extremely helpful. The Ocatilla pool is suppose to private and only for club guest. Pretty much open to anyone, so again why bother paying extra for this tower if the rules aren't enforced. The cabana rental I must say were nice if you do it during the week when they are half priced. Othwerwise, don't waist your money because you are paying double when the cabana is really only worth the mid-week price. Everything is pretty much really expensive at the resort which is to be expected, but the nickel and diming for what you get in the OLD hotel is why I would not recommend it to others. If I have to be nickel and dimed, then I'd rather stay at a newer resort with better amenities! There is no way I would pay regular price when housekeeping isn't up to part, $28 resorts fees, plus parking which is a mile away, rooms are very dated, and the daily activities they offer all hae fees attached! Forget it. Save your money and stay at the Phoenician or the others I listed. Lastly, the staff was very nice but that is to be expected for what you pay and they are just as nice at the other resorts. So again, Biltmore just doesn't cut it with the competition and for what they are charge. You can save yourself the headache and some money by staying a newer and nicer resort where they appreciate your business, and provide a GOOD expereince for what you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gretta1122
Reviews.Content: I have never been treated as awesome as the person who checked us in treated me!!! Her name is Sarah and she made our stay so wonderful. She was so friendly...it is nice to start a trip out with such a friendly person.

Reviews.Title: “They need to refresh this place”
Reviews.Author: TravelinVC
Reviews.Content: Although some might appreciate the "rustic" charm of this hotel, it has clearly seen better days. A total refresh of the decor and furnishings is in order. In the cottages, a lot of maintenance has been deferred. While the service was quite good, the lack of upkeep is showing and the overall hotel experience is not worth the exorbitant prices being charged.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: manswa
Reviews.Content: An outstanding hotel in every way. First-class check-in; very well appointed room - King size bed, sitting area that would comfortably sit 4, desk, spacious bathroom. We ate at Wrights at Biltmore and, whilst expensive, the food and service were excellent. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and classy place to stay and dine!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmg1935
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biltmore for a "Girl's Weekend" and it was fabulous!! I have stayed there before and the facility just gets better and better. Our Aaron, the Bellman, greeted us and took such good care of the group and Ashley at the front desk was so pleasant and knowledgeable, we were all so impressed w/both Aaron and Ashley. Our rooms in the Ocatilla building were wonderful and of course, the executive lounge was a real treat. We dined at Frank and Alberts, after having a cocktail at the Squaw Peak Bar, served by Cory & Tony - they know how to mix a drink!! F&A's was great - Mo and Tom treat us like family every time we dine there and Eric makes sure our dinners are exactly what we ordered. You will not find a better place to stay in Phoenix - my thanks to all the very competent and attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: cpete
Reviews.Content: I lived and traveled world-wide and stayed in 1-5 star properties. This was the worst night's sleep I have had in 35 years. I was told the day before arrival for a one-night "staycation" that an early check-in would not be a problem as there were plenty of rooms available. When we arrived, an upgrade to a suite was not available. I requested a rollaway which took two calls and two hours to arrive and a coffeemaker which also took an hour and a half. Micah at the front desk apologetically gave us a $25 credit. The afternoon at the pools, water-slide and swim-up bar was wonderful. Food at the poolside restaurant was good, service was fair at best. The drama started around 11 p.m. From 11-12:30 a.m. I was awakened four times by young parentless children running down the halls laughing and talking loudly. After reprimanding them myself, I finally had to call a security guard who promptly helped. At this point it was too late. In the morning I staggered to one of the restaurants with my young son, looking forward at least to the $40 breakfast coupon that came with our package. One clueless and apathetically slow hostess tried to field a line of hungry guests. When we finally got to the front she told us there would be another half hour wait. I returned to the front desk and told them of my disappointments (the coupon was not valid for room service). I was told that they could only offer a monetary reimbursement but that they were terribly sorry. That monetary reimbursement has yet to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel stay I have had in 50 years.”
Reviews.Author: Bryant_10
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the service was excellent, the food was excellent and the staff went out of their way to ensure we lacked for nothing. Some of the most beautiful landscaping I have ever seen as a backdrop to the golf courses. The Frank LLoyd Wright architectural style building nestled under the palm trees is extremely unique.

Reviews.Title: “My Week At the Jewel of the Desert”
Reviews.Author: npharr
Reviews.Content: I recently accompanied my husband on a business trip to Phoenix and had the wonderful opportunity to enjoy a relaxing week at the Arizona Biltmore. As we approached the resort, I was instantly mesmerized by the sheer beauty and expanse of the resort - GORGEOUS landscaping with thousands upon thousands of blooming flowers were everywhere. We were immediately welcomed by a very polite and well-informed Front Desk Check-in person as well as the very courteous Bell Hop. Our room had a beautiful view of the surrounding mountains - I enjoyed daily activities such as: enjoying the walking trails which are surrounded by breath-taking mountains, lounging by one of the EIGHT pool/swimming laps, exquisite food prepared by the amazing Chef Todd Sicolo and outstanding room "service with a smile" from an effervescent lady named Mary Kay Bond who brightened each of my mornings with her bright and bubbly personality. I also very much enjoyed boutique shopping at the resort's shops which were staffed by such nice and helpful ladies. The amenties were endless and my stay couldn't possibly have been more enjoyable. I am thrilled that my husband's company is booked at this resort for their Phoenix conventions for next two years as I will greatly look forward to returning to the Jewel of the Dessert! Thank you to all the staff who made our stay so wonderful and memorable - I will see you all again next May!

Reviews.Title: “They said it was better than it was”
Reviews.Author: zags40
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel as it doesn't measure up to other properties in the area. Yes the grounds are fabulous, and I know it was designed by Wright, but I still think it looks like a prison. We got a good deal at the Ocatilla ($179/nite) pool view, however they told us a few things about the Ocatilla that weren't true. In two different phone calls they told us they served free beer starting at 11am. It sounded too good to be true and it was. The pool was not private as they said, it was open to anyone, in fact there were many non-hotel guests at the pool (who were asked to leave late in the day). There was no drink service, no bathroom at the pool and no music. Self parking was minimal and the property is so big, it was a nightmare trying to find our room the first night there. Service was overall good, but somewhat spotty. We have stayed at several resorts in the area, and this just isn't that great. When you book look at the property map to see where you want your room. If you want a relaxing pool experience with music and a bar (and bathroom) at the pool, this isn't the place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Historical, and Some Issues”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1Denver_Co
Reviews.Content: If you haven't been to the Arizona Biltmore you are missing an opportunity to visit a wonderful and historic hotel. The grounds are breathtaking and spotlessly maintained by gracious employees. The front desk folks are accomodating, the valets are perfect, and the housekeeping is just so, so. During an extended stay on three occasions they forgot to clean my room. I am not sure how someone forgets to clean a room but 20 percent of the time that is what happened. The hotel is just huge so look carefully at your possible room. The main pool is great for kids and families. I stayed in a more secluded area with a private pool that was also just wonderful. Despite the housekeeping issues this is a marvelous place to spend a few days.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Manicure & Pedicure”
Reviews.Author: Ruby1213
Reviews.Content: Just a short note to recommend JALEH to get your nails done. She is top notch and a wonderful stylist. I received a caviar manicure & pedicure and got five star service ****! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: Janice1978
Reviews.Content: Here with a large convention and can't think of one thing that wasn't done First-Class--All meals were excellent, room in the Terrace wing was Huge, grounds were gorgeous, pool was delightful, and all staff were extremely accommodating--they even pronounced my name correctly--something that NEVER happens. Bed was comfortable, temperature was easily controlled, linens were clean. I'd love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Biltmore is a classic in every way.”
Reviews.Author: AZTraveller2010
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore is a lovely hotel and the accommodations are generously proportioned and well appointed. The hotel facilities are up-to-date and the amenities' list extensive. It's a great getaway destination for couples and families. It's always reliable and the staff is very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “one star service”
Reviews.Author: jeckel13
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference. Service was awful. Meeting room was moldy. Pool has little/no service. Children running wild. You have to get your own towels. The food and drinks are double the price of the Westin Kierland. Our room was in the main building. The terrace outside our room had meetings held. Imagine my surprise to walk outside my room in the morning to have a man standing outside it smoking. We asked to move to the Ocatilla our last few nights. We were told we would be called when the room was ready (they had told us specifically what room we would have). We arrived at the hotel and were told that we had been moved to the Paradise wing because there were no rooms in Ocatilla. We asked to speak to the manager several times, but were told she was too busy. With MUCH ADO, after 30 minutes they miraculously found the room. We were told it was a sales room, and by giving it to us, it would be costing them sales. My husband asked that a manager call us, but that never happened. The rooms in the Ocatilla were nicer, much more modern. Again, NO SERVICE at the pool, except for 1 morning. Towels never picked up or replaced at the pool. All rooms are a long walk. Self parking has very few spaces. We have stayed at the Royal Palms, Phoenician, and Westin Kierland, and this hotel doesn't even compare.
