The Adobe Golf course was like a poor public course, no elevations, no trees, etc. Unfortunately, our conference is here again next year. We wil not spend any extra time here.

Reviews.Title: “So great!”
Reviews.Author: tvnewseditor
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in the Ocatilla wing of the Arizona Biltmore in early May. We had a ground floor room with a patio that overlooked our private pool area. There were plenty of chairs, umbrellas, towels, etc. The grounds of the Biltmore were absolutely stunning. We spent several hours at the Paradise pool and it was totally and completely relaxing experience. We ordered poolside lunch. I strongly recommend the greek salad. I was disappointed that the floating loungers cost $10/day to rent, but I guess they gotta pay for those beautifully manicured grounds somehow. Expect to spend a lot for food/drink. Even more shockingly, a 20oz coke at the on-site starbucks cost $4.50! Dinner was at Frank and Albert's - great menu, lots of choices. I wanted to order about 5 times more than would have been reasonable :) The $28 resort fee is a bit steep, but I knew in advance I'd have it so no surprise there. I would strongly recommend staying here, whether it's for one night or one week!

Reviews.Title: “When can I come back??”
Reviews.Author: vailskiier7
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous place. We have traveled all thoughout Asia, which generally is considered to have the best hotel service in the world. However, the Biltmore could have been in the middle of Asia- the service was impeccable. The people- from the check-in, to the maid service, to the hotel restaurants, to the concierge, to the bell staff, to the manager- were nothing short of first class all the way. Usually I am fairly critical of US hotels and their lack of service- but the Biltmore just blew me away. Service, service, service- and it all came with a genuine smile. These people actually cared about their guests. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Jaleh in the beauty salon was very special.”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixGoplay
Reviews.Content: Jaleh took care of me in the beauty salon. My hair always looked perfect. Jaleh treats her clients with the utmost courtesy. Jaleh is totallt attentive to each client she is attending, is always on time, and is always to be found with a smile on her face. Jaleh really made me feel special. I always am happy when I return to the salon. Thank you, Jaleh

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: bdecore
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful! Customer service was timely and very good. We enjoyed our stay so much. The staff was always friendly and responded in a timely manner. The room and balcony were very clean and we enjoyed the view tremendously. The gardens are lovely and we enjoyed walking around the site in the early morning. We enjoyed the deli for a quick breakfast. The hotel environment is lovely; we felt very safe and well taken cared for.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience, from the rooms to the service to the amenities, the Biltmore delivers.”
Reviews.Author: carolcolombo
Reviews.Content: The villa suite was large and lovely. The kitchen was equipped with everything that I needed to make dinner. The amenities were fantastic, especially the pool area, and the staff was very responsive. The Biltmore is a modern classic and we had a wonderful weekend.

Reviews.Title: “The Biltmore gives the best costumer service.”
Reviews.Author: cdajda
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and quite, We were always met with a smile and thank you by Room service and house keeping. The food we ate in our room was great. It was a true vacation for both my husband and myself. We took so many pictures of all the flowers on the grounds.Can't wait for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to find a hotel that has a restaurant onsite serving organic foods”
Reviews.Author: PassingthruOmahaNe
Reviews.Content: We were most impressed with the on site restaurant Frank & Albert's. The menu included organic vegetables, free range turkey, and hormone free, antibiotic free beef. The kids loved the food and looked forward to eating there repeatedly ( 3 dinners and 1 breakfast). The restaurant servers Anna, Billy, Mandy, Adrienne were all polite and prompt. Thomas C. one of the managers made a point to visit all the customers present. The hotel was very full the entire time we were there and the only time that was an issue was finding an open lounge chair at the main pool between 11am to 4pm. Otherwise no overcrowding problems. The beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “High priced inconsistency”
Reviews.Author: durigirl1
Reviews.Content: There is not doubt this is a beautiful setting with amazing architecture. Yet, the tone is not set for a highly rated resort. We were greeted by a rude valet , a screaming child in the lobby and had to wait for our bags. WE had asked for a quiet room. We were woken up that night by a barking dog in the next room. When it started barking again we called the front desk. When I asked why we were being woken up by a dog two nights in a row in a quiet room the answer was "we are a pet friendly hotel." I was transferred to security and was told pets were not allowed in our building. To management's credit, they did comp our room for a night. Service at Frank & Alberts was indifferent and inconsistent. Wright was wonderful. There were both kids and adults bathing in the fountains. i would be hesitant to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Excellent Service, A True Slice of Americana!”
Reviews.Author: MooneyPilot
Reviews.Content: All in all, my wife and I had a truly enjoyable stay at the Biltmore. The hotel is an amazing historical treasure. I really enjoyed walking around and looking at all of the photos of the hotel through time. There are some spectacular aspects to the property including the architecture and the grounds. The pools are all quite nice, but were crowded on our weekend stay. If one wanted a chaise lounge by the pool, you had to be down there to "claim" it with a towel and book by 8am... This was a bit too much "cruise ship" lack of quality to me, not what one should expect at a Waldorf Astoria. The rooms were quite acceptable... I can understand where someone would say that they need to be re-done, however, they are truly appropriate for the time period in which the hotel was built. The decor (very Frank Lloyd Wright, straight line and plain) appears bland, however it is correct for the hotel design and period of acrchitecture. The grounds are AMAZING and kept to perfection. The bathroom was very nice with a rainfall showerhead. The linens were first class, triple sheeted, with high thread count cotton. The bathrobes were equally nice. Finally, the restaurant was wonderful (Wrights). This was one of the most imaginative dinners for a truly classic hotel. We enjoyed the Chef's Tasting Menu with the WIne Pairings and found both felt that it was one of the best "hotel meals" that we have ever had. The sunday brunch was equally nice. The bottom line is that the hotel is really a true slice of American history. The architecture is fabulous, the rooms are very nice, and the grounds are amazing. My only complaint was the lack of chaise lounges at the pool (as well as the number of young children at the pool). I would recommend this hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in PHX”
Reviews.Author: visitmae
Reviews.Content: I travel to Phoenix for work every 2 weeks. I'd definitely recommend the Biltmore. It's the nicest of all the hotels. It's a bit out of the way from where I need to be, but it's nice to actually stay at a resort instead of a regular hotel. The gardens are beautiful, multiple pools are nice and the spa is awesome. Treat yourself if you have the time.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: jjsteve77
Reviews.Content: Overall.../little things here and there, but quite an extensive, attentive stAFF AND CLASSY!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Marcoland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned last week from a perfect stay at the Arizona Biltmore. The hotel is lovely: the architecture is stunning, the furnishings are interesting and completely in keeping with the style of the buildings, and the grounds are breathtaking. Our room was spacious and comfortable (great bed and pillows) and the food was outstanding. However, an equally notable feature of the hotel was the topnotch service, from the room attendants to the restaurant servers to the front desk staff - it was clear that their primary goal was to make every guest feel welcome and happy. We had an issue with the temperature in our room and Chris, one of the front desk assistant managers, made certain that an engineer was sent to our room within minutes and he checked back with us regularly to ensure that the problem had been taken care of and that we were satisfied. He indicated the option to switch our room but we were otherwise so pleased with our accommodations that we wanted to stay put. He was friendly, pleasant, and a true professional. We had a wonderful getaway in Phoenix (so much to see and do), but it was our stay at the Biltmore that made our vacation just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dragonfly65201
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband on a business trip. He was meeting colleagues. We were given a room on the second floor overlooking the desk. The rest of our party were placed in cottage rooms but our rate was the same. The room was small and very noisy from the outside and an 80's party one night. The air conditioner was very loud and not easily regulated. The maid spoke no english so a request for more shampoo was fruitless. The service at the cabana restuarant was terrible. They were out of the spring rolls I wanted to order and the waiter said it would be 20 minutes. Then he forgot to come back and take out order so I decided the now 10 minute wait would be ok but now he said the wait would be 30 minutes! The gift shop closed at 10 pm. We arrived at the outside door at 9:50 and it was locked. 2 men working inside just looked at us. We went in to the inside door and it was open. We got our bottled water but the cash register was already down. They were not at all helpful. For $400 per night I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Great grounds and pool, but spa and rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: travelingtimr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Biltmore for business and then tacked on a few days for leisure for a total of 7 nights. I am a Hilton Gold member and expected an upgrade from a standard room. The upgrade I received was not nearly as nice as other non-Hilton members received. The room was very standard with not much room (maybe 200 sf). the upgrade was actually a shared balcony with the entire floor, so there was no way to leave the door to the balcony open at night. There were no other windows to open and therefore had to rely on air-conditioning, which was loud and either very cold or very hot. The maid service was terrible and unreliable for standard items such as towels and coffee. I would not recommend booking a room in the building next to the Paradise pool. Also, the rate I secured was to include the $28 resort fee, but once I got my bill (last day), I was charged a $3/day maid fee and a $12 Bellman fee (for which I had already paid a tip). I got no where with the front desk on eliminating the charge, even though I showed by confirmation. I would think hotels should be required to disclose those fees up front. On the positive side, the grounds and activities are extremely nice. Great pool areas and enough lounge chairs for all. The resturants and lounges are great for both food and atmosphere. Overall, I would recommend if you can secure a newer and spacious room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and quality!”
Reviews.Author: kmh3
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in the Ocavilla part of the hotel. We had our own concierge, who happily did everything and anything for us, continental breakfast every morning, cocktail hour with appetizers every evening, our own pool and own lounge with firepit. Our room was plenty big and the bed was super comfortable. The Frank and Alberts restaurant was a good restaurant but Wright's was over priced and had a very limited menu. Our concierge found us some great restaurants off the grounds that we enjoyed. The staff was really really friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this place and would go back. I think staying in the Ocavilla was a must. I think it would be great if they had some kind of entertainment on the weekends, although they did have a nice piano player in the lobby at night. The golf courses were "okay". Nice fitness center, beautiful tennis courts, nice spa.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Biltmore: 5 Star Grounds, 1 Star Service, Room Maintenance”
Reviews.Author: Travelinglynn
Reviews.Content: Few hotels anywhere have more beautiful grounds or architecture than the Arizona Biltmore. Unfortunately, however, our recent stay there was terribly disappointing. Most all of the service was unfriendly, unhelpful and unresponsive. With the exception of a helpful bellman, one likable and funny waiter, a hair stylist, and few others, we were greeted with scowls, long waits (including for any phone inquiry), and frequent negligence. The incidents of poor service are too numerous to describe. Although our travel agent made certain that we requested an accessible room, we were put in a worn down room in the middle of the property inaccessible by car. We were taken in a golf cart past the laundry, tennis courts, far away from any services, and brought up the freight elevator since the bellman thought it would be faster than me trying to hobble down the long hallway. We were told that another closer room with a view would cost an extra $175 per night. It took a lengthy negotiation to land in a villa closer to the main building. The room was small with filthy, ripped up carpeting, a small, extremely old television and the worst hotel bed I have slept on in ages. The notice indicates that there is turn-down service, however, you will never need to call for it, since the maid staff turn down the bed in the morning. That's right, they never make the bed up completely. The poor service was more than frowning faces everywhere who acted like they were doing you a big favor to change a bill, or show you to a table. Never before have I been completely blown off by a concierge who I tipped 20$ to make a reservation for me at a local restaurant, and a hair appointment. That's right. I requested that he call and leave a message with the info at our room, but he did not. I left my glasses at the beauty salon, and the operator refused to put me through to the salon directly. I was transferred to security but there was no voice mail, back to the operator 3 times. I tried calling the spa, explaining that I was disabled and had to ask if someone could walk over to the salon to locate my glasses. The spa agent said she would, but she also never returned my call. There was an endless phone que for anything: room service, salon, housekeeping, security, spa. Terrible. The hostess in Frank's restaurant was beyond rude and unhelpful, though the food was fabulous. I will say that the food at the Biltmore was consistently superb: Frank and Al(?), the Wright room, the Cafe, room service. Do go to enjoy the grounds and the meals at the Arizona Biltmore.. Not one person inquired about our stay, and the rooms had no hotel survey about the staff, grounds or service, as most do. No wonder. It is clear that the management really does not care. Terrible, terrible attitude throughout the hotel. One other note about parking. Guests have two parking options: 1) valet parking in the main hotel for over $24.00 per day (excluding tips), or 2) self parking for $12.00 per day. Be advised that there are not enough self-parking places often, and you may have little choice but to pay the full valet parking fee when you return to your room on Saturday night and there is not a free spot anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “loved it , loved it, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: call4less
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Biltmore. I was, am very impressed with the resort. My patio room was beautiful and spacious. I enjoyed the pool, gym and the spa. The grounds were lovely. I especially enjoyed my meals at Frank and Alberts. I had dinner there twice and my server was a delightful young man named Brad. He took care of me both times and was a pleasure. He managed to be very attentive while not being intrusive. I like that. He was professional, knowledgable and obviously happy to be working there. He even told me about the tour you offer to your guests, which I thoroughly enjoyed! I look forward to returning in the fall with my husband and friends in tow. Keep up the great work! Sincerely, Dubois Lynette

Reviews.Title: “Still a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brauna
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because our preferred hotel, the Royal Palm, was fully booked. We tend to avoid these large hotels because they attract the conference crowds (I've been a conference crowd so I'm not trying to be a snob) which means that there are often crowds at places you'd like to go, the pool, the gym, the restaurants. They have done some major renovation, so the hotel does not feel as tired as it did the last time I was there. One caveat, we had made a reservation for tea with my in-laws. Because they are older, at the last minute, they did not feel well enough to join us, so we called to cancel (about 2 hours before the reservation). We were told there would be a $15 charge per person. This cancellation charge had not been disclosed when I made the reservation. I did later call the front desk to explain the situation, and they waived the charge. But, they should not have had such a charge in the first place. A no show charge is certainly understandable, but we make reservations for fine restaurants everywhere in the world, and noone has charged us for cancelling a reservation. Otherwise our stay was great. The room was comfortable and large. The breakfasts are great. The spa is top notch. It's still a big hotel, however, so keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Off the charts!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JULESVERNE66
Reviews.Content: I am a traveler. I am Gold Elite on Continental Airlines. I am silver with Hilton. This is very important information for my story. My husband is a TOTAL high maintenance traveler. this is my 10 stay at the Biltmore but they total exceeded expectations tonite. My son who is 5 fell asleep while having cocktails on the veranda. The staff saw that he was asleep and went to find a blanket to cover him up. WE had a 6:30 dinner reservation at Frank and Alberts. The STAFF made sure that since my son was asleep they blocked the booth next to us so he could sleep and we could enjoy dinner. The restaurant was totally packed and they had no problem taking the hit to the table so we could enjoy our dinner. Whats important here is that the management to the wait staff made absolutely sure that we were happy and to the hotels determent (by loosing revenue for the table). You cant make that kind of service up and I got the hotel manager to come and take pictures so he could show the management how its not the hotel but the people. YOU wont GO wrong here if you are looking for service!!!! STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “You Can Feel the History”
Reviews.Author: BlueCamaro
Reviews.Content: From the moment you step into the lobby, you can feel the history. The design and architecture are spectaular. Pay attention to each detail and you'll notice something new around every corner. We stayed in the main building and our room was generously appointed. We had an excellent view of the courtyard. Our only issue with the room was the size of the bathroom- too small. We ate at Frank and Albert's and the Cabana Club- all excellent meals. I can't think of a better time than laying by the pool and drinking a "Marilyn". At the Biltmore, you'll feel like Marilyn.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay w/ kids”
Reviews.Author: CooperAlex
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a conference at the Biltmore and brought my family (kids ages 7,5 and 1). It was great. They have 8 pools (one w/ a waterslide) and the grounds were beautiful. The room was very spacious (and inexpensive at $229/night) and the family had a great time. The service was excellent and the conference was set up very nicely as well. I have no complaints whatsoever. This was one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed at (maybe Ritz-Orlando or Fairmont Princess in Scottsdale are as nice) and we really enjoyed ourselves and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A VALENTINE'S DAY GET AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: CharlieGilbert_AZ
Reviews.Content: Being a local resident in beautiful Gilbert Arizona I never realzied that driving down a winding road and seeing all these beautiful homes that I would come to the end of the road and find an 80 year old historic hotel that was just full of class from the moment they took my car, everything in between, and when they brought me my car. I would recommend everyone at least visit this hotel that has so much to see and so much history that you could just spend the day there and have lunch out by the pool. It's a must try Sunday Brunch! They best I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Trip! Planning the next one...”
Reviews.Author: debrossha
Reviews.Content: After seeing the Biltmore on the Travel Channel a few years ago, we have been saving our "pennies" to take a trip out west and stay there for a few days. The Biltmore lived up to everything I saw on the Travel Channel... The grounds are beautiful, rooms were very comfortable, spa and services fantastic and several wonderful meals at Frank and Alberts, and the two smaller cafe's on site. We had a very relaxing stay and as a final note, I believe every single person on the staff at the Biltmore, landscapers to wait staff to front desk, had a smile or hello to offer us... We loved it and can't wait to return. Thank you Arizona Biltmore for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: LaliBird
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went for a weekend to relax. We had a great time. We had the all-inclusive package which was a great savings. We loved the spa - had massage and facial. Food and service was good at restaurant. Grounds are beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay @ Biltmore!”
Reviews.Author: CultureWarrior
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Ocatilla wing -- large room, great bed and nicely furnished room. Bathroom isn't huge, but has great soaking tub and good amenities. Ocatilla includes a club level service for breakfast and evening appetizers -- although these rarely last more than 30 minutes. The hotel grounds are gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: dave112216
Reviews.Content: Our Server at Frank and Alberts was amazing. Mandi went above and beyond to help out my wife. She had a headache and she went and bought her advil. She didn't have to do anything but she did.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to eat on the lawn rent a cot outside, but stay away!”
Reviews.Author: sbolhack
Reviews.Content: The grounds of this resort are spectacular. In fact, if you wanted to camp outside all night, this would be an unbelievable choice. However, the condition of the rooms and the service are horrible. Our room had only three sets of towels for four people, one of the sinks did not drain, and the shower did not drain. You ask yourself that at a five star hotel, what systems do they have in place where these issues are missed. Did the cleaning service really clean the rooms with stopped up sinks and shower and never notify anyone or did they just not clean the rooms? They never asked us if we wanted a bellhop to carry our bags to the journey to our rooms. This is not good service even for a motel 8. The meal at Frank's was also disappointing; the service was great. They clearly had no systems in place. People were complaining about not having their drinks served with the answer that we were really busy (it was Valentine's Weekend); meals were clearly being left under the heat lamps without being served on time. My fish dinner was returned. It was the first time that I actually had to use a knife to cut into the fish as the heat lamp stonified my fish. If I were the chef I would be yelling. The substitute hamburger was like a hockey puck; again ordered medium and the victim of the heat lamps. If you must see this place, then just go have a drink at night outside and enjoy the grounds. But stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Best Concierge/Bartender”
Reviews.Author: Beadelight
Reviews.Content: Traveling as a single lady it is nice to feel comfortable dining solo. I stayed several nights and ate on property most evenings at their bar-restaurant and talked with Olga who was making awesome martini's and great conversation.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed With Service”
Reviews.Author: mthor53
Reviews.Content: I have never left a review here before, but this time I feel compelled to do so. We were really looking forward to staying here and wanted to love it. But that was not the case. We were in Phoenix for business and leisure, and we picked The Biltmore because of its reputation and location. We have stayed in luxury hotels comparable to The Biltmore and have never experienced the indifferent service this hotel provided. The grounds are beautifully maintained and the suite was large and clean--no complaints there. However, the atmosphere in general is cold. We cut our 5 night stay to 4 nights and will never stay there again. We were promised the opportunity of an upgrade upon check-in which never happened. The clerk was indifferent at best. We had to call housekeeping two times for towels, there was never any ice, no turn down service, and had to ask for toiletries to be restocked. It was as if once we checked in we didn't exist. We were also promised complimentary goodies in our room upon check in--there was nothing. Also, be prepared for a hike to your room from the parking lot. It got worse one night when there was a wedding and valet parking "reserved" the majority of nearby parking spaces for themselves. I started watching the staff and I noticed that their demeanor in general was not welcoming. I didn't see many smiles. We just checked into the Enchantment Resort in Sedona and it was a 180 degree difference. They are incredibly friendly at Enchantment and could show the staff at Biltmore a thing or two.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seanbreck
Reviews.Content: The fact that all the presidents stayed here says a lot, this was a wonderful Valentines weekend experience with my wife, the Bar and restaurant was excellent and the staff was over the top, one of the best pools in AZ and was well worth the money, so much history in the Hotel you really feel special staying at a resort like this! Five Stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: PG32
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad hotel. It's just old. I was really looking forward to staying here but left underwhelmed. The service is worthy of a Waldorf but that's where it ends in my humble opinion. The rooms were spacious but dated. The grounds were nice but not overwhelmingly beautiful. This is a very solid 4 star property. The history of this storied property is interesting. If you can catch a rate go ahead and check it out. This hotels' biggest asset is it's past though, so please adjust expectations. The Biltmore area of Phoenix offers quite a variety of high-end distractions. It's a nice place to visit. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING PLACE !!!”
Reviews.Author: Francois_travels_Mtl
Reviews.Content: I had seen the Biltmore in art magazines but being there in person was a totally different experience. They advertise as a Frank Lloyd Wright inspired hotel...and, believe me, it is. Everywhere you look, you really are in the man's world. If you like architecture you'll be in awe during your whole stay; every detail has been thought of....amazing. Take a long slow walk our the hotel grounds, you'lll get to see all the pavillions. Tips : If you choose to park your car yourself, in the section to the left of the main entrance (where the condos and townhouses are located) you HAVE TO come back all around the main building and enter through the main entrance and lobby; we did not think of doing that, took the short cut through the pool section and went in by a side door... So, around the main building, you go in by the main door, first you get a peek and two of FL Wright's Midway Gardens statues outside, then the famous 6' high glasswork (inside) and walking to your right, you get to the main - exquisite, redone by architects of Taliesin West in the 70th, following a fire - lobby. Our room was on the third floor in the main "historic" building. They said it was an upgrade for Hilton Honors members, we had also booked as CAA/AAA members. Our total cost of 427$ included one night for 2 people, small king size rool, amazing terrasse - front of the building, free (but slow) internet access in room / terrasse, 2 free drinks at the Frank's bar, a few extras and tax...Worth every dollar !! The next morning, we had breakfast at their Albert & Frank restaurant : great food; this newer building reminded us of FLW's japanese work...worth a visit. Also, if you like FLW's work, you have to visit Taliesin West while in Phoenix / Scottsdale : it is beyond anything we had imagined it would be. François, Montreal, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Awful service....rip off place.”
Reviews.Author: mgross75
Reviews.Content: Don't make the mistake and stay here unless you want awful indifferent service and outrageous charges. It starts with an additional $28 "resort fee" for wi-fi service and no coffee in the room or any other place in the morning except by going into the restaurant. I had requested a quiet room. The room in the main building was over the bar which rocked til mignight and there was an outdoor party behind my room with a loud band and firecrackers til 10:30 pm. When I called the front desk they told me that I could come down and get some ear plugs. Apparently that is what they do as the clerk acted like they have to give them out all the time. The termiinal at the airport would have been a quieter and better place to sleep. No one in management called to apologize or provide another solution. Don't bother going here and try the Westin or Palms instead. This place is old and over rated. You will regret it. The room cost $400 and the place does not care about their "guests."

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great housekeeping,great grounds, great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: libbysue
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Biltmore and were very pleased with the experience. The historic hotel was beautiful , as were the well kept grounds. Our oversized room had french doors that led to a large balcony which over looked a quaint courtyard and also had a view of the distant mountains. In the cool evenings, we were able to sit outside around one of the several firepits. The flowers and fountains were located throughout the resort. Service was great , as was housekeeping. We would highly recommend a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Housekeeping Dept. at the Biltmore does a great job!”
Reviews.Author: mpmfire
Reviews.Content: We had left some packages in our room and the manager of housekeeping (Jeremy) and his department were diligent in searching over several days for the items. They did finally locate everything and were courteous and professional in all aspects of our request s- from recovering the items to having them shipped back to us. "Above and beyond" customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel. Would stay here forever!”
Reviews.Author: Netty13
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Arizona Biltmore a number of times and have never been disappointed. The rooms are elegant and clean, the pools and grounds beautiful and the whole atmosphere is calm and tranquil. This trip, the Biltmore Grill had just been remodelled and we happened to check in the first night it was open to the public. The wait staff were a little confused and it took a while for us to be seated, but the food was great. The staff at breakfast were much more on the ball. We were lucky enough to get a room leading onto the Paradise pool, with the swim-up bar. Delightful. And the room service pizzas are fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “A sophisticated hotel with some rough edges”
Reviews.Author: adanacsim
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with beautiful grounds and, on the surface, a very sophisticated place. The reality, however, can be disappointingly less. Starting with the staff: since the grounds of the hotel are especially pretty we asked the registration desk clerk for a room with a nice view and she assured us that the one she had for us had a great view. When we got to the room we found that it overlooked the hotel laundry, a road and a fence (some people must have curious taste when it comes to views). When we complained to a different desk clerk, he took matters into his own hands and upgraded us to a lovely suite overlooking the Paradise pool. Similarly, the waiter who served us our first breakfast was especially accommodating, going over to the (more expensive) cafe to get us some food that was not presently available in the restaurant. The next morning our different waiter was so clueless and useless (how hard is it to bring over coffee and toast?) that we decided to eat outside the hotel after that (try the adjoining golf club restaurant -- it's much better and cheaper). Finally, there were several conventions in the hotel and it was very noisy and very crowded in the public spaces, which clashed with the natural beauty of the hotel and its grounds. Bottom line is if you're lucky and get the right people to attend to your needs, and if the hotel is not so crowded, you're very likely to enjoy your stay. If not, in view of the cost of staying at this luxury hotel, you're not so likely to be pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy front desk service - nice overall resort”
Reviews.Author: mas90guru
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a short (two day) trip to the Biltmore to attend a corporate event. While the grounds and rooms were very nice - if a little confusing to navigate at first - what really turned us off was the front desk. The resort appeared to have been fully booked for the days that we were there - so upon checking in it was annoying (but understandable) that we had to leave our bags until 4pm when a room would be ready. The restaurant and catering staff were all fantastic and friendly. The bellman and activities people were helpful. We had issues in two places. First, our company provided us with a credit to use on the resort. When my girlfriend booked a massage she was told one price. When she went back the price had suddenly shot up by $15 with the explanation of "oh, you have resort credit" -- in other words don't worry about it... Secondly, and more importantly, within about 15 minutes of checking out my girlfriend couldn't find her iPhone and believed that she'd left it in the room. The front desk gave all sorts of hassles about assisting her with checking on this. Part of the explanation that they gave was that she wasn't on the room reservation (corporate). However I'd point out that this isn't the Motel Six in the middle of skid-row. The front desk staff should take ownership of this type of problem. Eventually after some pleading the front desk reluctantly called up to the floor we'd been staying on and asked if anyone had seen an iPhone. No dice. Believing that the phone must have been left on the bed my girlfriend again asked to go up and check. Nope. Next she asked to see a manager. That lit a fire under the front desk who suddenly decided to send a bellman up with her to check the room. When they got into the room the beds had been stripped (where she thought she'd set her white iPhone down and left it by mistake). Luckily the bellman took control of the situation and went out to find the maid. When the bellman returned with the maid he asked her if she'd found a phone while cleaning the room. I'll let you guess what the maid pulled from her pocked. It was the iPhone --- and worth noting that we'd all been calling it in an attempt to detect where it was by the ringer. Last time we'll stay here. Thank you to the bellman who actually did their jobs.

Reviews.Title: “Airport Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: sedonadweller
Reviews.Content: Sky Harbour Airport closed for light rain conditions late(10:PM) on the 21st of January. No rooms were to be found anywhere in Phoenix. The kind Desk Manager at the AZ Biltmore listened to our desperate needs and opened an important room for our brief stay that evening. Their courteous actions will make my decision to book the Biltmore in the future a definite gaurrantee! Thank you, Desk Girls and all, including security people, for a well needed rest I will always remember! Bill and Dorie!

Reviews.Title: “Super Chef”
Reviews.Author: lindamkz
Reviews.Content: I would like to compliment Chef Todd Sicolo on his excellent culinary delights as well as his delightful personality. I was at the Biltmore on a business conference where over 600 people were fed at the same time. The food was always hot or cold as required, presentation was beautiful, taste was excellent and variety was always a pleasant surprise! The staff always went above and beyond to see to our every request. Linda Alumbaugh, Baton Rouge, LA

Reviews.Title: “Great service, lousy prices”
Reviews.Author: HankF99
Reviews.Content: Grounds, gardens, pools, everything is immaculate and interesting. My room was a bit dated but pretty good, certainly a comfortable bed but ancient shower, very ancient heating/cooling system. A few issues, one they ruined a suit jacket during dry cleaning (button gone and sleeve lining torn) and two they charged (without warning) $32 for (literally) a 5 mile ride in car service (after refusing to call for a cab as I requested). Oh yeah - it was $32 each WAY, which I discovered after the fact. (Arguably, I should have asked, but assumed it would be reasonable). All high end resorts are money pits and this one no different, I suppose, at least you have really sweet setting and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “service”
Reviews.Author: JonathanAustin
Reviews.Content: My first stay at the Arizona Biltmore. It is a nice, but very large hotel. I most wanted to note the great service I got from the bellman Sean at the beginning of the stay due to the suite that I was offered was lack luster ! Through Charles - MOD and Sean the situation was quickly and well corrected. Sean could not have been better in having my back and looking out to make sure we were ok. AS well on the way out. Aaron another bellman - was also great welcome and handling of bags and cars and made departure rather easy. The hotel has a grand reputation, but some of the staff are not aware of what that means sadly, thus the reason I am making note of the few I was pleased by. A note of thanks. During a time of

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: tomdenverDenverCO
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore hotel is a wonderful place. The buildings are beautiful and the grounds are very well maintained. The feeling of the place is of seclusion and luxury. The design is very comfortable, if you are a fan of great design you will love all the great details and beauty of the buildings. The food was very good and the service and staff were all excellent. The rooms are nice but a touch on the simple side-in keeping with hotels design. Very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Architectural eye candy with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: tachyonbb
Reviews.Content: Amazing architectural detail combined with a first rate staff makes any stay here an enjoyable if expensive experience. The tense atmosphere of today's world washes away into relaxed comfort when you enter this oasis. Make the time to take the history tour, it is worth it. Walk the grounds at night and appreciate the wonderful subdued lighting. In addition to above average rates, there is a daily "resort fee". Room service is exorbitant and even soft drinks/water are very expensive. So plan ahead.

Reviews.Title: “The Biltmore is more than a resort.”
Reviews.Author: pjtutt
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Biltmore several times it is always a pleasure to return. You are always treated as if you are family returning for the holidays. We just spent the New Years weekend at the Biltmore and would like to mention that we were very pleased with everything from the time we arrived until we departed. From the help we received from the concierge's desk ( especially Jordan ), Rhonda's wonderful personality in Wright's bar ( her personal attention is unsurpassed ), Chef Todd Sicolo's personal advise to our teenage son who whats to enter the culinary field and best of all Nate Anseth ( Villa and Ocatilla Executive Lounge Manager) personal help in arranging our reservations. They are all the best. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Special Place in the Desert”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkSStraveller
Reviews.Content: Compared with other hotels in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area, the Biltmore has an amazing balance for ALL! We spent time during the holiday season, you never felt overwhelmed with people around you no matter where you were. Staff was excellent, they were professional, always accommodating and pleasant., especially the service at the Frank & Albert Restaurant, Olga and "Carlito" were amazing! Olga's suggestions were very good and she made us feel like we were visting family who really enjoyed having us over!!! Great energy and knows how to make her cocktails!!! Carlito you are there by her side!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection under the sun”
Reviews.Author: PRexec
Reviews.Content: Picture this. The sky is a deep blue, the air is fresh and crisp, the sun is coming up over the mountain and you're sitting in front of a roaring outdoor fire eating oatmeal and sipping Starbucks coffee. That's how every morning started when my husband and I spent four glorious nights at the Arizona Biltmore. We're huge Frank Lloyd Wright fans, so staying in this Wright-inspired Arizona landmark made it all the more fun-- and impressive. The hotel offers free 90-minute history tours where you can learn lively and facts about the Biltmore during its early years. Our tour guide, Laura (who works in accounting) was terrific. We were lucky to stay in one of the cottages original to the hotel which, although 80 years old, were beautifully renovated, spacious, and absolutely charming. There are many other room options that seem equally appealing, including a stay in the original hotel with its magnificent architecture, decor, and appointments. Everywhere you look, there's something to feast your eyes on-- from the magnificent back-lit stained glass panel at the hotel entrance to the signature Biltmore blocks gracing every building. No decent review would be complete without commenting on the food at the Biltmore. The new Frank & Albert's casual restaurant offered delicious and creatively prepared fare at a good price. You could spend your entire hotel stay dining at the hotel and we practically did! Really, there didn't seem any reason to try other restaurants-- the food at the Biltmore was that good (not often the case with other hotels). The staff at the Biltmore were friendly and helpful. From the extremely courteous and friendly desk staff and concierges to the hardworking housekeeper who cleaned our windows every day (yes, she actually wiped down the glass panes inside and out), the people couldn't have been nicer. The restaurant staff was courteous and well-mannered, providing A+ service at every meal. If this review sounds a bit gushy, that's because I'm truly in love with the Biltmore as a place to stay in Phoenix. As much as I love trying new hotels, it will be hard to resist coming back to the Biltmore time and time again. I'm confident they'll be around offering impeccable service in a charming historic setting for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations on every level”
Reviews.Author: LynnDVancouver
Reviews.Content: Choose the Biltmore because of it's history, was a little worried that the rooms may reflect in the age of the building. Our entire family was impressed at the blend of the rich history(make sure you take the history tour offered by the hotel) and modern amenities were presented. The rooms were modern, newly refurbished, spacious with extremely comfortable beds, huge granite BR with 4 shower head showers and soaker tub. The 8 swimming pools were clean, warm and beautiful.. Stayed in the Octilla building, which provided breakfast, snacks, appetizers and dessert, great value and well worth it for a family. The staff were outstanding in their helpfulness and friendliness. Will be coming back for future stays in Phoenix, well located in the city, but no need to leave the grounds, which are immaculate and stunning! It lived up to its name of "Jewel of the Desert"

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dimed to Death”
Reviews.Author: Philigirl
Reviews.Content: I spent Christmas at the Biltmore and it was nice. I've been there twice before while on business and wanted my boyfriend to experience what made me love the place. The staff is always very nice and I am always placed in spacious rooms and even upgraded. The place has a lot of history, interesting decor, and is very conducive for relaxation. It was cold (50's F) so we did not use the pools or jacuzzi but they looked very inviting. What I don't like about the Biltmore is how they nickel and dime you for everything. Everyday you pay a resort fee charge, you pay to park, for room service there is a delivery fee, a service charge fee, and I believe the tip is taken out. One morning and the only morning that I ordered breakfast in it costs $85.00 for 2.The next day we had an earlier morning tour and stopped in the cafe for 2 coffees and 1 croissant which costs around 16.00 (huh?) I really don't mind spending money, however, the Biltmore is just a bit ridiculous. You kinda feel stupid when you get the bill. I like being able to travel the world and I can do so because I watch the pennies. I don't know if I'll be going back. I would still recommend because it is something to experience just be sure to spend your money off the property.

Reviews.Title: “If you have food allergies...beware!”
Reviews.Author: bellamom6
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying, I have severe food allergies, as does my 7 yr old daughter. This being said, travel anywhere is always a preplanned issue. I always call any resort to make sure they can meet our needs ( mostly for daughter) and IF they cannot, we look elsewhere. We always, always, check and double check everything as she carries and EPI pen for shock from allergies. We are local here in Scottsdale AZ. When I read that the Biltmore was doing cookie decorating for Christmas, I was excited. For $25, should be an amazing time right? The Arizona Biltmore as far as I had always known, was known for 5 star service, right? Umm, no. So as always, I called ahead and asked if they could do gluten free and nut free for my daughter. I explained the severity of her allergy and said if they can do it great, if not, we would not book. " No problem" "we handle this ALL the time" I was told. So booked we did and a VERY excited 7 yr old to decorate cookies on Christmas Eve for Santa. We get to the Biltmore and were told the kids would not be making the cookies ( dough, cutting out, ect) they had already done that and they would be decorating them. So we took a tour of the kitchen and were led to the "decorating" area. I asked right away where my daughters "special" cookies were. " We could not make them as the Gluten Free had almond meal, so they would have nuts". What? I make gluten free @ home ALL the time and honestly, it is very easy to do without the nuts. Translation, they did not want to deal with it. I then asked WHY no one had bothered to tell us this as they had no problem taking my AMEX and they had my phone number. Tears swelled in my daughters eyes, as once again, she would be left out. I asked could they do "safe" rice crispy treats? "Yes I was told". Now, in the height of flu season here in AZ and cold season, you would think ( ha ha) that they would practice more cleaner food handling. For $25, you could buy plain old cookies and decorate yourself in a more clean environment. Everyone shared everything, it was quite disgusting actually. Kids licking their fingers and then grabbing the decorating things out of the community bowls that we all shared. Kinda makes you wonder how clean the kitchen is @ the resort, no? Back of my mind I am thinking $25 bucks down the drain, and these VERY expensive rice crispy treats are going in the trash. So, when we left our germ fest, I mean cookie decoration, we stopped @ Whole Foods. Now, when we left, my daughter was saying she was "itchy". Not so uncommon this time of year as it is the desert and dry. Upon our arrival @ the store ( 5 mins) she was covered and I mean covered in hives. Total allergic reaction to sometime @ the cookie extravaganza. Thank goodness we travel prepared. I immediately called the AZ Biltmore to complain and demand my AMEX be refunded. They treated it as no big deal. The manager could have cared less. Our Christmas Eve was totally ruined by a little girl being pretty sick. This could have all been prevented had they had been honest. The first person who called me basically admitted they dropped the ball and did not take proper precauctions even though I was told they did! Any parents traveling with kids with gluten issues or food allergies, I highly, highly recommend ANY Four Season. They have to date bend over backward to always make me and my daughter feel safe and enjoy their yummy food!

Reviews.Title: “Two star service at five star price”
Reviews.Author: stevem9999
Reviews.Content: Service was poor, not what we expect from a Hilton Waldorf collection hotel. Rather than cite all the examples, let's just say we cut our stay short and left a day early.

Reviews.Title: “First class staff in a first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: eancel
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the elegant and beautiful Arizona Biltmore. Our rooms were clean, well equipped, and quiet. Best of all is the staff, especially the security staff. A few hours after checking out, I remembered, in a panic, leaving my jewelry in the room safe. The security staff, in particular David and Joel, kept in touch with me until they were able to retrieve my jewelry without intruding on the privacy of the new guest in that room. The staff is first class as is the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, friendly, amazing architecture!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinFool93436
Reviews.Content: Stunning grounds against rugged desert peaks, exquisite Frank Lloyd Wright inspired architecture, and 5-star service made our visit very pleasant. The rooms are a tad on the small side by modern luxury standards, but adequate and very nicely appointed. The towels are delightfully soft! I would have liked to have a coffee maker in the room, although there seem to be plenty of breakfast options on the grounds. Concierge Kevin was attentive, helpful and friendly, as was all the staff I encountered.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the Arizona Biltmore and especially the service provided by Olga Vybornova at Frank and Alberts restaurant”
Reviews.Author: jcergol
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore was a very relaxing and elegant resort. Very good service. Nice restaurants and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for family vacation”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleJoeZ
Reviews.Content: Great choice for family vacation with grown children, but probably great with younger children too. The all inclusive Octilla is well worth it. The food was excellent and the head chef was very attentive to our daughter's food allergies. He called multiple times to check on things and visited our table regularly as well. The facility is gorgeous, and is a classic built in the 30's but entirely updated and perfectly maintained. There are lots of available activities on site as well as in the area. And it is within driving distance of the Grand Canyon, which is obviously amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing combination of location, food, price, and service.”
Reviews.Author: ronchefdoc
Reviews.Content: This was a thoroughly enjoyable visit, from start to finish. The surroundings are magnificent: an oasis in the middle of the Sonoran Desert. The staff was incredibly knowledgeable about the hotel the area. Do not miss the historic tour of the hotel. A side trip to Taliesen West is a must. The food at the hotel is superb. However, if you tire of that, the concierge is able to recommend a plethora of tasty alternatives, ranging from the relatively inexpensive (although trendy and incredibly lively) Cowboy Ciao's, to the extremely upscale Donovan's Steakhouse and Mastro's. My preference is the hotel's delightful outside dining, fire pits, and wonderfully accommodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: rickh59
Reviews.Content: Extremely nice place to stay but very expensive. Room was spacious with a shared balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: lineavega
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ocatilla part of the Arizona Biltmore and all I can say is wow. The rooms were spacious and beautifully decorated. The executive suite for which you have access as an Ocatilla guest was outstanding. Again, beautifully decorated and well stocked with beverages and light fare througout the day, but the most important part was the concierge staff. Carolyn and Leo were so sweet and always very helpful, as well as super personable. We made sure to stop bye and say good bye before we left if that gives you any indication just how great they were. The whole resort is top class and the only negative comment I have is that for such an elegant resort, the pool cushions on lounge chairs were way too "used" looking. This should be brought up to par with the other details that as I could see were all in line. We had a wonderfully relaxing weekend.

Reviews.Title: “First class property with grounds and food exceptional”
Reviews.Author: AssociationLead
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to airport and travel is made very easy. Hotel is world class with the grounds and the food five star. Rooms are just ok but how much time are you in them anyway? Golf course is average to below average in our opinion. Real golfers will want to go off property. We had over 350 business people there for a meeting and the staff was top notch, with Jeremy leading the team and the one you should ask for. Scott the chef was outstanding and very creative. Hospitality at its best!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic event experience”
Reviews.Author: fun4everybody
Reviews.Content: My work hosted an event at the Biltmore and the staff and hotel went above and beyond not only to make sure that my company had what it needed to make the event successful but to make sure that the guests who attended the event, had a pleasant, enjoyable and memorable experience. This is why we have continued to host our events at the Biltmore for the past 6 years and will continue to into the future!

Reviews.Title: “best services”
Reviews.Author: nsfrank
Reviews.Content: having just returned from a long weekend at the arizona biltmore i would sum up my experience by saying it was fabulous. from the food to the accommodations in ocatilla to the spa services and the staff, our stay was one of the best experiences. the spa itself could use a facelift as it looks old and worn, but the services and professionalism of the staff are some of the best that i've experienced. the staff in general were very helpful, curteous and follow-up on all requests. the new octilla rooms were spacious and spotless and the services that go along with the accommodations were fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: EllinD
Reviews.Content: Concierge and wait staff were above expectation. Hotel grounds were beautiful! SPA was exceptional w/friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Historic but better for a visit not a stay”
Reviews.Author: phdtravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an interesting example of Frank Lloyd Wright architecture. But its more like a museum so go for a walk round. In in terms of staying there overnight it is just not that attractive. Low ceilings and small windows that don't show the views - typical FLW trademarks. The rooms are large but but a average and the pools aren't great too. There are much nicer hotels in Phoenix for the price. Small and terribly expensive restaurant - had to drive to the nearby mall for dinner!

Reviews.Title: “History and Pool”
Reviews.Author: dfkk
Reviews.Content: Price - US $250, double Cleanliness - excellent. Quietness - very good. Comfort - very good. Location - excellent. Friendliness - excellent. Breakfast - none. Classiness - fantastic history. Room included - shower, bath, TV - no coffee making. Big room and lots of pools.

Reviews.Title: “***** Excellence”
Reviews.Author: slmpas
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Arizona Biltmore was an excellent experience. The entire staff offered outstanding service, fantastic meals, and superb accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Food”
Reviews.Author: macdaddy63
Reviews.Content: I spent four days and three nights at the Biltmore with 600 other attendees and it's safe to say everyone had a great experience. The rooms were comfortable and the food was fantastic. In fact, over the past 20 years of business, I cannot recall a hotel's food that even came close to the quality of the Biltmore's for the size of our group. Great job Biltmore staff and management.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service that exceeded many fine hotels' service level.”
Reviews.Author: Maribeth
Reviews.Content: From the first evening, when I required a special meal at a large business function, due to Celiac Disease, the staff at the Arizona Biltmore proved that hospitality is not dead. Kathy Day and John the Catering Manager had a special gluten-free meal prepared that was delicious and beautiful ...and they provided it with a smile. Kathy then returned a jacket I left at the dinner to my room. Nisveta, a member of the housekeeping staff, delivered articles I'd inadvertently left behind to the second room I inhabited, due to my business travel turning to pleasure travel, with my husband and son arriving. And Travis at the front desk made that transfer seamless. Olga, the concierge, beckoned Nathan, the notary public, when we needed an item notarized. Nathan made a "house call" to our room, with his stamp, since my son was not feeling well and needed to sign some documents. Just an unbelievable level of service, delivered by happy employees. A pleasure, in beautiful surroundings!! THANK YOU. We WILL be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: Shawnee45
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note to thank Dan Bauman for his above and beyond service during my most recent visit to the Biltmore. As always everything was amazing, but his personal and courteous service deserved an additional thank you!

Reviews.Title: “An historic hotel and a very comfortable resort.”
Reviews.Author: DCAttorneyMcLean_VA
Reviews.Content: I stay here every year on business and the resort has been consistent over the years. The architecture and history of the place are fascinating. The resort amenities are nice if you like that sort of lay-around vacation, but nothing exceptional. I strongly recommend the new rooms in the Ocatilla Wing. The rooms in the main building can be much too loud, and some of the other rooms can be a little worn out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Services & Food”
Reviews.Author: GioLee
Reviews.Content: What standing out here is the host at Frank and Albert's lounge. She is outstanding, friendly, funny and very informational too. Olga is the person you want to see while you stay in this hotel. And she is everywhere in the hotel. She is at Concierge desk sometimes and at the bar the other time. But go talk to her while you are there and she might buy you a drink too. The food is excellent here, I ordered just a hamburger for my late arrival. and it turn out the best burger I ever had, it is fresh ground beef (vs frozen patty) and cooked it to medium (the way I ordered it). Just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, wonderful grounds for entire family to enjoy!!!”
Reviews.Author: dexymama
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at this hotel, and would definitely come back again! The staff was kind and the service was terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Refined experience with service excellence - without complexity or conceit.”
Reviews.Author: travelhoundcanadian
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Oct. 11-17 2009 as a leisure customer. The physical draw to this property is obviously compelling. Anyone who understands the background of this hotel, knows the architectural history and lore. Not only does the careful preservation of this unique aspect deliver - the unpretentious prestine flavour of the grounds creates an atmosphere that I have yet to experience at any other reseort - and I have been to over 50 resorts. The physical product remains consistent with the over physical nature of the property. Well, thought out attention to detail without the intensity. A few areas of wear and tear expose some cracks in the walking concrete paths around the resort. Probably a tough thing to keep up, but it is noticeable in comparison with the prestine feel of the grounds. I stayed at the "hotel within the hotel" - the Octatilla experience. For me, as an experienced traveller, this is worth the upgrade. The room design feels like a 500+ square room with the best bed in the hotel world. The sleek, slim TV wall mount, great desk working area, and plenty of storage all well designed to leave lots of floor space for a very open feeling room. The Octatilla bathroom contains his/her sinks with plenty of counter space (I did not travel with my wife, but I know she would have appreciated the counter space), nice soaker tub, complete with "Zen" bath salts and a separate stand up shower. To top off the physical ambience I was lucky enough to have my own small terrace. With 90 degree weather every day, the terrace was a great feature. The hallways were well lit and aesthetically pleasing - again without the intensity or the "trying to hard" element of say W hotels or some other resorts. The room product was very clean. The Octatilla comes with access to an executive lounge. The physical space here is once again well thought out and designed. A great blend of outside terrace seating (with standard tables and relaxing cushioned seating) mixes with inside board room tables, comfy living room sofas and also restaurant style seating. Two LCD panel TVs which help add to the atmosphere without the sense of intrusiveness. The lighting and decor makes me want to take a lesson in design! The lounge also has two computers and can be used for printing and boarding pass documentation. Octatilla also has a more private pool that literally sucked the stress right out of me. Day beds, regular loungers and Cabanas all available and easily accessible. Service- While the physical product is extremely compelling, the service experience what among the most genuine I have ever seen. Somehow the culture of this hotel transcends beyond the Waldorf Astoria expectation. The service staff seem genuinely happy to work there. The staff in the Octatilla executive lounge absolutely made my stay a memorable experience. They seemed genuinely interested in me and what I needed...again without a sense of intensity or insincerity. In fact, the day prior to my check out, they took the iniative to call my room and inquire what arrangements I required to better assist the departure process. The food offering at the executive lounge was quite substantial with a very healthy breakfast offering (important to me), and unique and creative evening hors doeuvres. They supplied some nuts and snacks in bowls throughout the lounge. The only thing I would suggest here is that I saw bare hands of other guests go into the bowls - yikes! The centre piece lounging area of the resort faces camelback mountain. The seating design and atmosphere set here was quite enjoyable. I had dinner here two nights. The ambience was unmatched with the firepit conversation areas and glow lighting. However, I would suggest offering a slightly more extended food offering in this area, although I appreciate that the intent is to have a lounge offering. The main pool was also quite stunning physically and I liked the layout. The daybed and casita rental appear tempting, but I didn't see any users. The food service staff was exceptional, but I also wish a slightly more extensive food offering was available. The main dining restaurant was closed, but looked quite interesting to eat it. The most pleasant surprise of this resort overall was the refined, unpretentious service matched with the unique but also unpretentious design and feel. I will bring my family back for the adventure experiences (hikes, mountain biking and lots of yoga). The fitness area is among the best I have seen for upscale resorts and clearly was not an afterthought. Free weights, lots of cardio and plenty of room in this well naturally lit facility made working out easy. One can also do some laps in one of the many pools. I am running out of room for more detail on the service package, but I will conclude by commenting on the location. Easy access from the airport, to sporting events and to some of the Scottsdale night life. I would return to this resort with my family, but I would also consider using some of the hotel's very unique and cool meeting space for business meetings. See you again Arizona Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “excellent high end hotel”
Reviews.Author: weakglovehand
Reviews.Content: a beautiful well appointed classic hotel. the grounds are very well cared for and are worth the price of admission. the food is all top quality and expertly prepared. wait staff is equal or better than what you'd expect from a top line cruise ship. you will spend alot of money here, but this is a high quality hotel, and there is a definate value in the expense.

Reviews.Title: “The spa is amazing”
Reviews.Author: SueArow
Reviews.Content: As a traveler focusing on spas I can happily say: the spa at the arizona Biltmore is one of my favorites. The staff are pleasant and helpful. There are a few fantastic persons working at this spa and one particular reflexology massage from a gentleman names Les stands out.

Reviews.Title: “80-year-old desert beauty still a gem!”
Reviews.Author: MKM10023
Reviews.Content: A class act all the way. Superior accommodations and gracious staff made our all-too-brief stay totally memorable. Gorgeous grounds, terrific lobby and common areas, fantastic pool & spa, glorious history, etc. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WallyC2
Reviews.Content: The service, location, and overall feel and sense of history that this property combines make anyone that stays here feel special. We were lucky enough to get a corner room with a HUGE outdoor balcony, and it was a fabulous trip! We love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of History in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flagstaff0
Reviews.Content: The history of this hotel makes it a unique place to stay. Every president since Herbert Hoover (excepting Barack Obama) has stayed here. Wrights, the leading restaurant at the hotel, was closed when we stay. We ate at another restaurant on the premises. Food was good, though I wouldn't say excellent. Drinks were pricey. The bar area is elegant and outside firepits make for cozy spaces at night. The room we were in was spacious, though more elegant rooms are available throughout Phoenix and Scottsdale. Check out the Wrigley Mansion while staying at the Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “No worries, few decisions, zero pressure”
Reviews.Author: dobrienma
Reviews.Content: We left our little one at home and spent a week at the Biltmore. The weather was fantastic, the property flawless and the relaxation complete. We stayed in the Ocitilla building, which has a nice little concierge room with coffee and lattes all day, breakfast items(limited) in the morning, as well as beer and wine in the evening with appetizers, then deserts at night. We upgraded when we got to the property to an all inclusive plan that added lunch and dinner into the mix, at Frank & Alberts or the poolside dining. On the one hand the menu was maybe not quite varied enough to eat every meal for a week on property, but it was nice never having to handle the logistics of going off property. All in all we both agree we'd do it again the same way.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place but we were treated poorly.”
Reviews.Author: evieryland
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to stay here for vacation. The architecture and grounds are just unbelievably beautiful. I finally got the opportunity but was so disappointed in the quality of the amenities in the room. The furniture needed to be refinished and although we were told we had a great room with a view- the view was blocked by a giant bush and it was a far walk from the main hotel. Also the staff was very unconcerned about making our stay pleasant and even (embarrassingly) yelled for security on my husband when he lost his key and was knocking on our door. They actually asked him if he was sure he "belonged" in the hotel. There are too many smaller complaints I won't get into but when we were checking out, the front desk agent asked me how our stay was, and when I replied "Less than satisfactory:" She simply said "Oh, I'm sorry to hear that." and handed me my receipt. Perhaps she hears that response often. I wish I could say nice things about this place, because it is so beautiful, so I have to recommend that you visit it and take pictures of the architecture and gardens, but don't stay here- especially if you are looking to relax.

Reviews.Title: “The best family friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ssaa0919
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at the Builtmore on several occasions. There is always something for kids to do. My kids love the smores outside, movies by the pool, the play room and the outdoor playground was great for my 2 year old! I dont feel like I am a bother when we need something. The staff is awesome! We will continue to stay here for years to come. I would reccommend to anyone with younger kids.

Reviews.Title: “Love the classic beauty in the desert.”
Reviews.Author: CindyCLasVegas
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here on and off for business since March and not only does the staff greet me personally by name every time I walk in the door, but they accommodate all of my sometimes demanding requests. We have used the property for meeting space, catering and business dinners and each event is done with perfection. I've also had time to use the spa and all of the recreation facilities and the amenities are all beautiful. The classic Frank Lloyd Wright building really sets this hotel apart from your typical Arizona resort. And the staff here really goes out of their way to make you feel special. I've have valets deal with broken down Avis cars of mine personally! Where else does that happen?!

Reviews.Title: “No Wow factor - except for the bill”
Reviews.Author: roger39
Reviews.Content: This hotel is appealing to three distinct markets. Firstly it appeals to those wishing to stay in buildings of great architectural interest.The Arizona Biltmore is one of the few hotels influenced strongly by perhaps Americas greatest arhctitect, Frank Lloyd Wright.It is all a matter of personal taste I would guess .Some might see it as an example of brooding magnificence. Others that it looks rather like a tired old prison. Anyway it is impressive and is in an upmarket location.. But the hotel has to attract more than just a few architectural afficiandos. It must compete in the Phoneix area with some of the most modern and most luxurious hotels in the USA.So this Queen of the Desert has gone down market. During the week it hosts hordes of the badged - Course and Conference attendees. whose low corporate rates must be amply compensated by their high bar bills. And at week ends it goes f for parents who want to lose their kids at the week ends.It fills its pools with partying pubescents . And this all shows in staff attitudes. Our party checked in three times for three different rooms.Not once during these procedures were we addressed by name, or welcomed,or asked if we needed baggage assistance,or told we had a nice room or wished a pleasant stay etc. Clearly check in staff have to be efficient as they process the masses. But they seemed not to realise that the poor independent traveller who has no munificent corporation,IRS, or alimony provider to help pay their bills would welcome the occasional smile in recognition of the fact that he/she are also paying guests..We may not be very important for the hotels bottom line. But the staff need not make it quite so obvious. The room? Standard good sized Hilton fare. One table , two armchairs, two chest of drawers, flat screen TV, small fridge.very comfortable bed. Standard bathroom, no walk in shower,no separate WC. All a bit worn but all quite serviceable. Just not exceptional. Public rooms are again quite impressive as are the pools and gardens. But everything costs extra.No coffee machine in the room,Ice machines carefully hidden away where only the staff can find them.No free newspapers.Normal disgraceful resort charge of 28 dollars whether you use anything or not. Self Parking is permitted providing you pay 18 dollars for the privilege and are willing to walk the mile or two from your parking space to your room. Every US president since Herbert Hoover has apparently stayed in this hotel. Not in our rooms I bet.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the Biltmore!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravelerAZ
Reviews.Content: Drive in with my attorney friend as a passenger to the valet in front of the resort. As the valet was opening my door I was moving my I-Touch to the center console of my car (just to be safe). Upon leaving Wrights restaurant, which was way overpriced for the quality of the food our group received, my friend and I want back to the valet to retrieve my vehicle. After tipping the valet a generously and getting ready to drive away, I opened my center console only to find my I-Touch and cash missing. After and hour of searching my vehicle and filling out a report with the valet manager, I was told that the hotel would make things right with me. After having to file a second claim from Hilton's fraud department, I was told that they would check into the claim and respond within 4-6 weeks. Again, as you could imagine, I was not pleased about their readiness to address the problem. 6 weeks to the date of the claim, I receive a form letter denying my claim, saying that Hilton Hotels is not responsible for any damages or theft . On my behalf, my attorney friend contacted the General Manager of the Biltmore. After another lengthy conversation with management, he was told that either he or I would be contacted the following business day to resolve this matter. That call never came. I feel that the Arizona Biltmore no longer cares about their valued guests. They have lost my future business!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful oasis”
Reviews.Author: FemaleBizTraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and was in one of the Ocatila rooms. This resort is spread out with different buildings and Ocatila is their club-class offering. There is a wonderful lounge there with friendly staff and lovely food throughout the day - I would recommending upgrading for this alone as it was so comfortable. I did not have much time to lounge around the pools, but each building has their own pool and there is one larger main pool. The individual pools seem to be quieter and well maintained. I dined in their new restaurant, which does not seem to be featured on their webiste, called Frank & someone?? It was pretty informal, but the food was good I had dinner there and breakfast. For dinner I actually had a couple of starters and this was ample, but I am used to smaller portions. Overall a really lovely hotel and great place to return to for a relaxing evening after busy working days.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional service especially at breakfast”
Reviews.Author: re21
Reviews.Content: Our waiter, Thomas Burns, was the most curteous and considerate waiter my colleague and I had waiting on us. He went above and beyond and exceeded our expectations.I truly belive that Thomas should be the example and the perfect ideal in these issues that all perspective wokers shoul strive to emulate.He is a valuable asset to this Hotel and obviously should go very far in his carreer because of his humble inteligence and people skills....respectively submitted....Rene St.Laurent rph/dnm/ccn Tiverton, R.I.

Reviews.Title: “Chef Todd is a genius”
Reviews.Author: bigwig2010
Reviews.Content: I have been attending the annual Lodging Conference here for many years. The current management has done a lot to improve this dessert gem including the new Ocatilla Wing. But the real gem of this resort resides in the kitchen in the name of Chef Todd. The food was really over the top, which is not easy to do when you're cooking for a business conference of 1200 people. The scallops were scrumptious. The lamb chops divine. And oh those chocolate soufflés. Not to mention hydrogen infused bananas with hot chocolate sauce. I'm salivating just thinking about it. Frank & Alberts (the new restaurant) is much improved as well. Go for the Fish Tacos or the vast array of delicious pizzas.

Reviews.Title: “Leaves a lot to be desired.”
Reviews.Author: BereniceGilbert_AZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently had a weekend getaway here and were very disappointed! The hotel staff was neither friendly nor helpful. The food/drinks were way overpriced. We booked a couples massage and my husband was uncomfortable at how small the waiting lounge was. There were about 20 of us crammed in a room that only seated about 5! Then they took us back to our massage which was in a normal guest room set up with 2 massage tables. To top it all off we could here housekeeping vaccuming and roomservice while we tried to relax during the massage!!! Never again will we stay here. I highly recommend the Hyatt at Gainey Ranch or the JW Marriott Desert Ridge. The JW Marriott is by far the best stay!

Reviews.Title: “What a night!!”
Reviews.Author: Mesagal13
Reviews.Content: I live in the valley but decided to get away for a night of relaxation with my girlfriends. I'm so glad we decided to stay at the Biltmore in one of their Villa Suites! Not only was the pool amazing, there was so much room in our Villa that we never had to leave the hotel! Also, a HUGE thank you to Curtis who took care of getting us to our room along with any other requests we had! The next time we need to "get away" we'll definitely look to the Biltmore!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great architecture. Great food. Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: MJMLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the AZ Biltmore many times, but the new management is stepping up their game.
