The Ocatilla Club in the former Arizona Wing offers a club lounge, continental breakfast, snacks, appetizers, cocktails and dessert as part of their package. Also, the deal included lunch and dinner at either Wright's or Frank and Albert's. Frank and Alberts occupies a beautiful new Frank Lloyd Wright inspired dining room that is New York hip and more casual than Wright's. Exec chef Todd Sicolo has done wonders. Everything from the food to the menu text to the plating has an architectural bent. The wait staff was unbelievably gracious and the new restaurant had only been open a handful of days. But it ran like a well oiled machine. Be sure to try: the duck fat poached French Fries (insanely good), Fallingwater cocktail (refreshing and sophisticated), the four flights of mini sundaes (a child's delight built for adults), the vanilla ice box cake, the fried chicken (amazingly moist), the Waldorf Salad (a great reinterpretation of the classic) and FAB pizza with a crispy semolina flour crust that brings to mind Nancy Silverton's pizza here in LA a Pizzeria Mozza. A great stay and wonderful service in an architectural masterwork. Pools for kids, cocktails for adults, golf and tennis nearby, privacy if you want it. The management now needs to work on the spa and gym to bring them up to the level of the restaurants, lobby and rehabbed rooms in the Ocatilla Club. We took a group of historians and architects here two years ago for a conference and they are still talking about their stay at the AZ Biltmore. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Just about Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jjags
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over this past weekend (September 11-13). I was on Phoenix for business and came in a few days early to relax. We got a great rate on Hilton.com for a room in the Octilla building- this came with an upgraded room, breakfast and cocktail hours with food etc. I myself and the friend I was with travel often for business and pleasure. We have both stayed in many nice places (4 Seasons, Ritz etc) and we both agreed this hotel ranks right up there with any other place we have stayed. The room was beautiful- the grounds were PERFECT. You could walk around for hours just looking at the plants, cactus and flowers. If I have one thing to criticize it would be service at the pool. The pools are very nice- well kept up. The furniture could be nicer and they could have the towels in more locations. It was a little bit of a pain to get towels. Esp. true is you are not at the main pool and you want to take a swim after 5. We had to use towels from the room. One other thing. The gym area was great. Very nice. They also offer a lot of good classes and clinics. They are pretty pricey. Thought the hotel could have done a better job on pricing those. Service at the hotel was top notch. Everyone was very nice and helpful. We did eat at the new restaurant Frank and Alberts I think it is called. It was very, very good. We went for lunch. We started with sharing the tomato salad and then I had the fish tacos and my friend had a flat bread with figs and chicken. Prices were good considering you were at a hotel. Bill was under 40 for two entrees and an appetizer and everything was tasty. I went from staying here to the Phoenician for my business event. That hotel was nice but fairly formal. I would not rush back to that hotel if I was on a leasure trip. If you are looking for a great vacation spot look no further. I loved it and will go back again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We had wonderfully relaxing time at an amazing resort!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagotoArizona
Reviews.Content: My husband & I went for Labor Day weekend and stayed in the new Ocatilla wing with its own concierge floor and very spacious and beautiful newly redone rooms. Were were also fortunate that the new resturaunt "Frank & Alberts" recently opened. The atmoshphere is wonderful and new menu and food was fantastic. I have been back several times to the resturaunt alone. On Sat. afternoons at the pool bar they have a fun salsa experience. However, even more important was the service. There was not one person we encountered that did not make us feel special and isn't that why people take a weekend off to get away, relax and feel special? This resort is so full of charm & history - you must experience it for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: frankolizeth
Reviews.Content: I spend three nights at the Biltmore over Labor Day weekend. I had the most amazing time. This hotel is absolutely beautiful. It has beautiful gardens, undescribable architecture, and a historical importance that I have yet to see anywhere else in Arizona. I was fortunate enough to book the all inclusive acatilla package. The accomodations were excellent. What I enjoyed the most was having access to the executive lounge. They provided breakfast, complimentary appetizers and alcoholic drinks as well as deserts. In addition, I was able to eat at Frank and Alberts restaurant. This restaurant just opened with a new menu featuring organic entrees. The food was delicious! My husband and my two young boys had an amazing time. I recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates history, rich architecture, and the best pools in town. The hotel staff were very nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, historic venue and overall a great experience.”
Reviews.Author: dwrkvr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a week at the Biltmore in Phoenix, Arizona. Our first contact was with the desk personnel and concierge. The front desk people were genuinely happy and seemed to enjoy their jobs. After checking in and with my wife due to arrive in less than seven hours the concierge in the main lobby found a florist and birthday flowers and roses for the airport were delivered with time to spare. The rest of the week was spent in the newly renovated Ocatilla wing with a separate concierge staff. During the week they handled several reservations for dinner, hot air ballon ride, and tours of local attractions. In seven days at this hotel we NEVER met an employee that didn't go out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. I would recommend the historical tour of the hotel itself. We plan on returning again. Best experience in years.

Reviews.Title: “Timeless elegance.”
Reviews.Author: easterndixie
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Arizona Biltmore (an extended stay this time)...and I'm sure it won't be our last. Timeless elegance, effortless service and attention to detail... perfect ingredients to be transported to a simpler time with all the modern conveniences, including the best hotel fitness center we've ever experienced. All conveniently located to golf, golf, golf! Definitely one of our favorites to be revisited and recommended time and again!

Reviews.Title: “Always pleasant to go and great service”
Reviews.Author: Chicago60604
Reviews.Content: We were recently at the Biltmore for a night and for a special birthday dinner for a relative. the biltmore has beautiful grounds, is wonderfully kept up and is exceptionally pleasant and relaxing-even in the heat of August. When my bag did not quite make it to Phoenix with me, the staff made a very special trip to get the bag at the airport so i would have it before the dinner that night. It was above and beyond the call of duty but was also done with true helpfulness. The food and the service at the dinner that night (for 14) were very special, exceptionally good, and very nicely served with consideration of the pacing of the function. We have done this before at the hotel and the biltmore has never disappointd.

Reviews.Title: “Experience could not have been better...(unless it was free....)”
Reviews.Author: lsd300
Reviews.Content: Our (twice extended) stay was simply terrific: the physical plant, the food, the service. The concierge service was extra special: Nick, Olga, Becky, Jordan, and Kevin (among others) knew their stuff and shared it with great patience and good humor...all had killer restaurant suggestions. Bailey at the front desk was just great, along with her colleagues. As an architect, I appreciated the building's history (and the tour) and have enthusiastically talked the place up to everyone who will listen.....Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool place. Worth it to check it out in the offseason.”
Reviews.Author: Boogie6868
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Phoenix last week for work and have stayed in most of the resorts but never the Biltmore. I really liked this place. It has a ton of character and pretty grounds. The architecture is interesting (and I'm not really into architecture) and the rooms were nice. These compound kind of places are nightmarish for business travel because you're a 10 minute walk from your car. It also makes it a process to get out to go somewhere for dinner, but it was fun to stay somewhere that was different. The staff did a nice job. They weren't as bow and scrape as they are at places like the Ritz but that isn't my thing. There are 8 pools and one is all set up with full service cabanas you can rent. I stayed in a room at the Terrace something which had its own pool that nobody was ever in. Be sure to notice the "resort charge" which was $28/day when I went. I see some people complaining about that but this is still a cheap rate for a great hotel in the off season. No wireless. Food/drink are expensive on site...$17 martinis at the bar. I may not go again just for convenience sake for work but would definitely go for a spa weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Tacoma5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this gorgeous resort several weeks ago and fell in love with it! The grounds were beautiful, the service impeccable and the food was superb. We loved the rich history of the resort and enjoyed looking at all of the old photos and newspaper articles that are so tastefully displayed throughout the property. It truly is a special place and we will definitely return in the future. Thank you for the memories!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: terbergirl
Reviews.Content: Overall a nice stay with comfy rooms, however I was a little disappointed the slide at the main pool closed at 6pm.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't live up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: LisaCea
Reviews.Content: Diamond award stay. Booked standard double queen room and was upgraded to Ocatilla. Nice big room with big bathroom, pool view, so far we are impressed. Saturday afternoon pool was PACKED, but we were still able to find seats at the bar and lounges. No problem with towels. Bar menu was good, nice Greek salad, drinks were reasonably priced for a resort. Service at the bar was fine, a chef came out and did a salsa demonstration and gave samples to all who wanted. It was part of the Biltmore's 80th birthday celebration. So far so good..... right? .....not. Two teens we brought were VERY unimpressed witht he water slide and complained of bordom for the entire stay. The dive in movie that was promised and the kids were looking forward to didn't happen. As happy hour rolled around we went to use our key to get into the executive lounge (that is supposed to come with the Ocatilla upgrade) and lo and behold, it won't work. So I make a call to the front desk and was told since we recieved the room upgrade we were not entitled to the executive lounge too. BS! I went to the front desk and had a chat with the supervisor and was given new keys and access to the lounge. We had a glass or two of wine and a few snacks (all accurately described above) and headed back to the pool area for a light dinner. We didn't feel like getting gussied up for the fancy restaurant. Apparently we showed up about 20 minutes before closing time (8PM on a Saturday night!) and the waiter took 15 minutes in an almost empty place (only one other table occupied) to even come offer drinks. We ordered some chicken wings and salads and sandwiches which took another 25 minutes to arrive at our table. The wings were completely burnt to a crisp. My daughter and her boyfriend, both veteran fine dining establishment employees, were agast at both the quality of the food and the service. After a complaint to the server, the wings were taken off the bill, but too little too late. We were offered free dessert too but know better about ordering more food from a kitchen after complaining. You never know what you are going to get Forest. The resort is absolutely beautiful, the grounds, the views, the art and the history are impressive to us as 17 year Arizona residents. Don't waste your money staying or dining there. Maybe it was a skeleton summer crew in Phoenix and the service may be better there in the "season". I'll never go back. If you want to see the place and have a drink at Wrights bar, walk about the property for a few hours, you can get a feel for the place it used to be. Its nothing like that anymore. Very very dissappointing after all the hype.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Trip”
Reviews.Author: Tamisu
Reviews.Content: Recently my friend and I traveled to Phoenis to stay at the Arizona Biltmore as I had been told the Hotel was fabulous. This was an understatement. The hotel was Beautiful and the service was impeccable. It was probably the best hotel stay i've experienced in a very long time. We hung out by the pool, had gret food at the Cabana Club and The Wright Restaurant, took in the pool views from our exquisite room in the Ocotillo Wing and spent way too much money in the awesome shops. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to have a great relaxing experience and meet lots of locals. It appears to be the place to go. Also...the beds were so comfy my friend and I didn't want to leave them for the pool...but we did.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, wonderful, amazing, and fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: SRMW1972
Reviews.Content: I absolutely can't say enough good things about the Arizona Biltmore. I only stayed for 4 nights but wished I had booked for longer...much longer!!! We stayed in the new Ocatilla part of the hotel, and it was beautiful. Leo, Carolyn, Kim and all the other staff in the lounge were awesome! Super friendly and so much help. Leo booked my dinner reservations at Wright's (great place to eat), and Carolyn booked a hot air balloon ride for me. During the entire stay, I never once encountered a rude employee. Everyone was super friendly. Enjoyed an aromatherapy massage at the spa, and Linda was wonderful. Courtney worked at the gift shop and she was super friendly and helpful. Rented a cabana one day and it was relaxing and the cabana girls were superb. I saw 6 of the 8 pools while I was there and loved them. Also took the hotel tour and it was most interesting. I'm sorry that I didn't get the tour guides name but she did a fantastic job. Helen was so helpful at the Pink Saguaro Shop when I was having so much trouble deciding what to buy. The grounds are beautifully maintained and the rooms are so luxurious. Our spacious bathroom was granite and had a soaking tub with mineral salts provided. The lobby is beautiful and such a relaxing place to people watch or read. I was not looking forward to the summer heat in Phoenix, but it didn't bother me at all. I'm a terrible writer and know that I am not giving this resort the justice it is due. I seriously cannot say enough good things about it and the employees there. I found this resort through the Waldorf-Astoria collection. I love staying at the Waldorf in NYC, and two years ago read about the Arizona Biltmore in an email. When I looked at the website, I knew that I must go! I seriously did not want to come back home but anticipate a return visit for a much longer stay! Leo, you are an absolute doll and thank you so much for everything you did! :) Hope to see you again!

Reviews.Title: “An incredible experience”
Reviews.Author: eugene63wisconsin
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with the whole experience. The grounds were impecable, the rooms and decor were very impressive. I found the food to equal any 4 to 5 star dinning in my travels. This will be my choice of stay in az.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Clear Bed Bugs! Also Very expensive not worth it”
Reviews.Author: ngagedesign
Reviews.Content: My wife & I Stayed and broke out with bed bugs. very bad!!! the only thing they offered was another room or to change the sheets. I wanted a refund considering we were itching the whole time. Also if my wife had not been in a conference there we would not have had stayed. details are as follows: ExcuCab overpriced [--] Sodas $5 (get discount cab to grocery store and buy sodas and lunch items to substitute mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times at the Biltmore!!”
Reviews.Author: perezam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biltmore for the first time. The customer service was excellent from the moment we stepped onto the property. The food was excellent and the pool is huge!! The cabanas were spacious and drinks were extra cold! I have stayed in many hotels but this one tops them all. Rooms were very clean and very comfortable. Staff was great!! I recommend this for anyone looking for top notch service!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: gerrymontiel
Reviews.Content: Honesty, one of the best trips ever and the prices were reasonable. The hotel staff were beyond belief and the pool, food and hotel rooms were great. I will definitely come back when I'm back in town.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: lvnick
Reviews.Content: I have to say from the moment you arrive, the AZ Biltmore shines, from the friendly and helpful outside staff to the food and beverage staff. The food was amazing not only at Wright's restarant, but the pool as well. I would highly recommend the Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, overpriced, terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: Bella_Badger
Reviews.Content: This was defnitely the worst hotel we had stayed at on our two-week vacation. The resort itself is full of nostalgia and history. The Frank Lloyd Wright architecture is amazing, and the lobby is beautiful. Many famous people have stayed at the resort in the past, but that must be its only selling point today. The room we stayed in was dirty and shabby. The lampshade was frayed, and there was a hunk of wood missing from the closet door. The bathroom had penmarks on the wood around the counter, and there were two different kinds of mildew on the tub grout (the black kind and the slimy pink kind). Ick. On the second day, we actually caught a SCORPION scurrying across the bathroom floor! We put a glass over it and informed the front desk, and were merely told, "My apologies, I will have maintenance remove it." The rest of the stay was spent checking under our beds and in our sheets to make sure there weren't more hiding in our room. There were several pools available, and we spent most of our time in the smaller pools that were away from the main hubbub. The smaller pools were surrounded by broken and faded lounge chairs and had no towels available. They could also use a good scrubbing. The main pool could only be described as community pool meets spring break. There was lots of noise and commotion, small screaming children, and lots of younger couples and singles. It was definitely not an atmosphere conducive to rest and relaxation. Many of the frazzled lounge chairs that were scattered around the pool were reserved for those paying extra for the cabanas, though we only saw a few that were occupied. Towels were hard to find, and at least once we had to wait for them to be replenished. The actual service was the worst part of our stay. It was as if the employees had been instructed NOT to smile at anyone. Upon arrival, we were given a map to our room and a key. No instruction as to the amenities available, location of the pools, spa services available, etc. The first night, we headed to the bar and had to wait forever to be served. The second day, we ended up walking out because no one ever came to serve us (although employees walked back and forth past us several times). They looked busy, but a simple, "I'll be right with you," would have been appreciated. We instead walked next door to the on-site cafe for 3 bottled sodas, 2 beers and a cookie for a total of $40. The employees were odd, with simple requests (extra towels, an extra hotel magazine, etc.) being met with looks ranging from confusion to utter annoyance. As for the area, it was difficult to get in and out of the resort to find restaurants or shopping, even with a GPS. We did find ourselves in a less than desirable part of town several times, and resorted to traveling back to the area in which we stayed at the beginning of our trip (Fairmont Scottsdale--Excellent Review!!). In conclusion, if you are younger and are looking for a place to hang out, but don't have high expectations with regards to service or cleanliness, this place may be acceptable. If you are an adult looking for a clean and comfortable place to relax and get away from it all, stay far, far away from this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull for the whole family, what a blast, did not want to leave!!”
Reviews.Author: atnaak
Reviews.Content: My sister and I wanted to visit some where warm! We could'nt take it any longer! Living in Michigan (me) and my sis in Wisconsin we decided it would be AZ. I have heard wonderfull things about the Biltmore Collection and we decided that's where we were going. Wow what a great choice! We went the 1st weekend of May 2009. We spent 3 nights and did not want to leave. There was a good amount of people there and we had a blast! The grounds were outstanding and the views were awesome! More than enough for the our 2 kids to do! (ages 8 and 10). The cost of the food was a little high, but wow did you get a lot! And it was wonderful! Our best part of the trip was the care and service that we received from the staff. We had a blast at the main pool! There is a beautiful swim up bar and lounge area you can sit at, and it does not smell like many resorts that I have been to, very clean! We had a blast at the Salsa Demonstration that was presented by the Chef at pool side. There must of been 8 or more different types he made! I was very impressed at the Frank Llyod Wright architecture. Our room was poolside and what a must have with the kids!! Out the door and away we went, how fun! Please take time to walk around the resort and see everything, it is amazing, but it may take you about 1 to 2 hours to see it all! We were located close to everything we wanted to do out side of the Biltmore, food, shopping and Mt. climbing. We will back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It & Will visit again”
Reviews.Author: jktravelerWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my sister 10 y/o neice and 8y/o son visiting family. We stayed in poolside room. The kids had endless entertainment. Food was fabulous. Salsa demo & tasteing at swim up bar was excellent. The chef offered to provide recipies if you e-mailed him. Beautiful property. Fitness center very accomadating and well equipped. Friendly staff. Close to shopping, hiking, and airport. We plan on going again in Oct. and staying in the Octilla section without kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in an Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: budgie-TA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I ended our recent vacation in Arizona by staying for three nights at the Arizona Biltmore. We had pre-booked a room in the Ocatilla Club block as this included access to the Concierge Lounge. The hotel takes a little time to adjust to as the architecture is rather unusual and greatly influenced by Frank Lloyd Wright. The block we were in (previously known as the Arizona block) had recently been refurbished and offered really superb accommodation. Everything was new and we had a large HD flat screen LCD TV in the room which was super. The Concierge Lounge was one of the highlights of our stay and Carolyn and her colleagues went out of their way to be friendly and helpful throughout our stay. (They even helped us check in online for our return flights to the UK and printed out our boarding cards as well!). We ate breakfast in the Lounge, could have tea, coffee, or soft drinks all day, complimentary beer and wine, pre-dinner snacks, and post-dinner dessert, all included in the room rate. We did have one meal in Wright's, the main restaurant, but this was a little disappointing for the price. (There are plenty of good local restaurants a short drive away). We were slightly upset that the pool at the Ocatilla was being renovated (and we had not been advised of this when we booked) but there were several other pools. The Paradise pool was the main pool and quite busy (towels only available here), the historic Catalina pool was fairly quiet, but we discovered the Saguaro pool which we had completely to ourselves for two whole afternoons. The hotel was celebrating it's 80th anniversary and we went on a fascinating (and free) historic tour of the hotel which lasted about 90 minutes. The AAA rate for the room which we had booked via the internet was $152 per night including the resort charge. With taxes we paid $170 per night, which we thought was excellent value considering all the extras we had through the Concierge Lounge. The booking stated that there was a daily charge of $12 for parking, but we were never charged this. This hotel was great and a little different from the normal chain type hotel accommodation. It is a great location and very well maintained. I would not want this to be my only experience of staying in the Scottsdale/Phoenix area, but it was certainly an experience not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I thought it would be”
Reviews.Author: brixton77
Reviews.Content: I just spent three days there on a business trip. I was disappointed. The hotel sells membership to the locals, so the main pool/spa becomes insanely crowded on the weekend. Because the pool was packed with people who weren't even staying at the hotel, I really resented the 28 dollar resort fee. The pool felt more like a public park than a resort. There were screaming kids everywhere, and their obese moms drinking pina coladas. It was Ohio in the desert. Just an awful scene. That said, the buildings are very pretty. Frank Lloyd Wright did not design it, but one of his students did, and it is a very pleasant imitation. As others have said here, it is getting a little worn. So, if you are looking for a family vacation, this might be a good hotel. I'd skip it if you are on business or looking for a relaxing resort experience.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: abmemories
Reviews.Content: Thank you Arizona Biltmore for a wonderful week! The new accommodation in the Ocatilla WIng was amazing! In fact, with the delicious food included in the deal we didn't need to leave the hotel at all....and the Staff in the Ocatilla Concierge Lounge became true friends! Carolyn O'Shea went out of her way to make our stay memorable...thank you so much Carolyn! What fun we had! Leo Despot (whose birtdhay it was) prepared our boarding passes with such professionalism and friendliness! What wonderful staff - we made new friends of these folk and felt we were truly cherished as guests. Such a marvellous holiday - we can't wait to return - it was worth the 10 hour flight from London and the connecting flight to Belfast. We can't wait to return - what wonderful memories! Carol Anderson Northern Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Historic Frank Lloyd Wright Gem! A+ Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PLRamirez
Reviews.Content: This Frank Lloyd Wright Hotel is not only historic but extensively well-maintained. The bungalow we had was amazing and the service is unparalleled. The views, location, restaurants and property are absolutely incredible. Yes, it's a bit expensive, but worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: RitaWesthampton_NY
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Arizona Biltmore for several days in June. The service was wonderful and the accomodations were surpurb. The staff is very well trained in giving the hotel guests the most superior service, and everyone at the Biltmore went out of there way to make sure that my stay was better than I ever expected.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff to die for...”
Reviews.Author: greenbqueenb
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at the gorgeous 80-year old jewel in the desert, the Biltmore staff ensured that my every need was met. And they did so with an unusual charm of manner. Even if a problem I experienced had nothing to do with the hotel, they did their best to deal with it almost as if we were friends. Maybe that's what 80 years of experience does; in any case, the most pleasant staff and a delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding facility and wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: Conf-Coordinator
Reviews.Content: I coordinate several conferences each year and the Arizona Biltmore has been the most fantastic hotel that I have had the pleasure to work with. The conference coordinator, Jeremy Vasquez, was absolutely wonderful and worked closely with us to ensure a successful event. The entire staff was friendly, helpful and available to assist in any way. The AV staff anticipated our every need and went above and beyond! Thanks for such a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Displaced_City_Girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a spa weekend with a friend. The hotel is gorgeous. Our room was beautiful. The bathroom is as big as most hotel rooms and we ate breakfast on the patio each morning overlooking the impeccable grounds. The service is excellent. The fitness center is one of the best I have encountered in any hotel. The spa is dreamy. This is really a family hotel with a lot of kids activities during the day and kids are all over the pool. If you are looking for a romantic getaway or a singles scene, this really is not the place for you. Since, I am married and was completely only looking for a little relaxation it was fine. There are only three cons about this hotel and they pale in comparison to the pros. It is out in the middle of nowhere. It will cost you $80 to go anywhere. Also, hotel only has one real restuarant, with about 10 options on the menu, which is problematic since it is not easy or cheap to eat all of your meals off premises. There is a pub type place, but when I am traveling I want to experience good cusine. Had we stayed one more night, our dinner options would have been problematic. The food at the restaurant was amazing though. FInally, the locals hang out at this spot. They come early, take up all the umbrellas by the pool and a few aggresively/annoyingly hit on all the women.

Reviews.Title: “The best meeting we have had in 15 years...”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoH2o
Reviews.Content: Our organization recently had the opportunity to bring together a number of our authorized dealers from across the country and our support personnel for a meeting at the Arizona Biltmore. We considered a number of properties before choosing the Biltmore. In these challenging economic times, we certainly understood the need to find an economical way to hold a meeting but we also knew that this meeting was going to be one of the most important meetings we have had in our company's long history. It was therefore vital that we choose our venue wisely and make good use of our limited resources. I am thrilled to let you know that the Biltmore far exceeded our expectations in terms of service, attention to our needs and professionalism. From the moment we arrived to the date of our departure, everyone in our group was treated like royalty. From the initial sales department contact to the planning with convention services to the handling of our final billing - the Arizona Biltmore's staff delivered on their promise. In the more than 20 years I have planned corporate meetings, I have never been more at ease on site than when I was at the Biltmore. I was certain that things would be done as promised. From catering to audio visual support, our needs were met and I would absolutely recommend that you contact the Arizona Biltmore for your next important function.

Reviews.Title: “Joe Beer Can can afford a Resort Stay and Feel Special”
Reviews.Author: BrianAZ
Reviews.Content: I wanted to book a special day for my Wife's birthday. I have a limited budget, and since we live in Phoenix, generally speaking the hotels here are reasonable during the summer time. Working with the conciege, she helped me with my limited expenses and made it work. She made sure that our room had "birthday amenities" that made my wife feel very special. The property feels as if you are on an island away from Arizona as the grounds were filled with beautiful blooming flowers. The service exceeded our expectations. The staff was continually opening doors, smiling, and wanting to be of service.

Reviews.Title: “Impecable Service, Food and Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TeresaMeyer
Reviews.Content: Returned recently from Regional Meeting at the Biltmore. Without a doubt one of the best meetings I had due to the hotel's service, food and beverage and staff! Their creativity and attention to detail. You can not find a better hotel in the valley for a meeting or for any type of event. I want to share how the banquet and Convention Services and Culinary team wowed us! Our group is a very well travelled group and we all said this was the best meeting we ever had.. The new room product was beautiful and the grounds of the resort were so well kept up as usual. They have put together a well staffed team and took care of every detail. There was nothing left unsaid what they would not have done for us and did it with a smile and asked us what else they could do. Thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Relaxing Sojourn to Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: GreatlifeArizona
Reviews.Content: I am a native Phoenician but do not live there presently. In growing up visiting this hotel with relatives, it was lovely to again visit this time as a guest. The staff are superb -- very relaxed, helpful, and extremely professional in demeanor. The grounds are lovely although Arizona has increasing problems with grackle birds and the Biltmore is no exception. The largest pool is salt water and has a great slide for adults and kids alike. Other smaller-scale pools and spas are also available across the property. Room service personnel ride bicycles keeping the grounds quiet, safer for children and presenting a "green," fitness reinforcing mindset for your stay. The hotel organized live acoustic music on the main lawn on the last night of my stay; marshmallow roasting and free beverages were also available which worked out well considering the weather was unseasonably cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great in the Arizona Heat”
Reviews.Author: danfromtorrance
Reviews.Content: In order to have a good time be ready to use the pool to cool off from the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, peaceful and accomidating atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: kateebaum71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. Our purpose was to "get away" and relax. Our experience (first at this hotel) was just that. Our room was perfect. It was spacious and clean. It seemed as though it was brand new. The bed was incredible and the extra things throughout the room were nice: little cactus on shelf, the sparkling white robe and slippers, the bath salts and candles, the big TV...I could continue. We happened to run into a Mr. Jeremy Beck, who was the director of the housekeeping crew and let him know how happy we were. Our dining experience in the Write restaurant was wonderful and fun. We got a kick out of the water/bread gentleman named Martin. He was charming and made us smile with his "Good evening" both nights we were there. We also asked him to take our picture and he did so and was just super cute about it. A charming man. The whole food experience was also something to talk about. We ate pork chops and then the steak with mushrooms. Superb. I especially loved the tomato salad and my sweetheart loved the onion soup. I could go on and on. The bottom line is our stay at the Biltmore, in the Occotillo section of the hotel, was terrific. Everyone was very helpful, our room was perfect, the pool was refreshing and the service was top of the line. Thank you. We will return. Kate Baumgarth

Reviews.Title: “Happy Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaJensmom
Reviews.Content: We returned from our 2 night stay at the Biltmore last night. It was one of the best stays that we have had anywhere! The rooms are fabulous. The facility has a casual, comfortable elegance about it and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Even at dinner - we mentioned that it was our anniversary to the very helpful staff member who made our reservation and we had at least 3 of the staff wish us "Happy Anniversary!" and then they presented us with a beautiful Chocolate Souffle complete with "Happy Anniversary" written on the plate in chocolate. The summer rates at the resort and Wright's, their premier restaurant, even made all of this very reasonable. I would definitely recommend The Arizona Biltmore to ANYONE, even the most picky of people will be pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: BahiaGirl1
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay. Our room had a view of Squaw Peak Mountain and it was so nice to go out on the deck in the morning to enjoy the beautiful scenery and quiet. The pool was out of this world with a great swim up bar and pool slide. Everything was immaculate. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Can't wait to go back here for another wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience for Group Event”
Reviews.Author: kstone13
Reviews.Content: This hotel just recently hosted our company client meeting. The hospitality and service were one of the best I have experienced and I have been doing this for quite some time. The hotel went above and beyond to make sure that our guests had the ultimate experience. All of our needs were handled in the quickest manner and never did we have to ask twice for anything. The Chef was so creative with all of our functions and our CSM was thorough, insightful and ready to lend a hand for anything or everything! I would recommend this gorgeous property to any group that is looking to execute a great event! Another great thing worthy to comment is how close this hotel is to the airport. A short ride for the guests and a beautiful property!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic get away”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixAznative
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Biltmore for our anniversary and had a wonderful time. All the staff at the resort are very professional and friendly. The pool staff was accommodating and on top of the service. Our dinner at the Wright's restaurant in the resort was amazing. The chef even made a couple changes to a dish that I requested. You have to try the soufflé!! We plan to return next year for our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: damian17
Reviews.Content: Thanks for the perfect vacation Arizona Biltomore! A beautiful room, attentive staff, frozen drinks by the pool and spectacular weather made for an incredible vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Biltmore Will Suck Every Penny Out of You”
Reviews.Author: wynnesmom
Reviews.Content: I went as part of a conference and stayed for three nights. The rate was $199/night which was high, especially for June in Phoenix. There is also usually a $25/day resort fee (basically, for the pleasure of using the pool). The taxi from the airport was $23 (they will try to convince you to take the hotel town car for $33 when you leave). I also had to pay a porterage fee of $12 even though I didn't use the porters once. I bought a chicken burger by the pool for $16 (not including tax and tip). A medium coffee (not a latte) in the hotel cafe was $4. Drinks in the bar are also incredibly overpriced. The hotel has an (almost) monopoly on your money since nothing is within walking distance. You can take their hotel town car for $10 + tip to the local mall to find a restaurant if you are so inclined. My room had a sweet musty smell that bothered me every time I walked in from the outside. Each room had a nice flat screen tv and renovated bathroom which slightly redeems the hotel, but not quite. Further, every person in my group had to have their bill corrected to remove the $25 daily resort fee (which was supposed to be waived). It was like the hotel was hoping we wouldn't care since we weren't individually paying for the hotel. Totally unethical, and given that it happened to everyone I talked to, doesn't seem like an honest mistake. I've stayed at a number of hotels that I've rated highly. However, for value, cleanliness, location and service, this one does not make the grade. Given that my company was paying, my feeling this way should say a lot. There's no way I would ever return if I was paying for it and would NEVER recommend it to someone else.

Reviews.Title: “A friend for life and a magnificent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ElPasoWright
Reviews.Content: What a magnificient stay. We came for two days and ended up staying two weeks. Every aspect of our stay was more than we would have expected. The entire staff was friendly and the concierge service was immpeccable. Carolyn our Concierge host was so wonderful and helpful with places to go for food and fun. We feel as though we made a friend for life. We were able to relax and feel at home the entire stay. From the valet, to the front desk , and in to the spa: it was simply amazing. We look forward to coming back to the Arizona Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “Architecture buff's delight”
Reviews.Author: margi0518
Reviews.Content: There's nothing to compare with the atmosphere in this Frank Lloyd Wright inspired property built 80 years ago. Don't come if you desire tons of activities and the glitz of a newer resort, although the pool area was full of activity on the Saturday we were there. Renting a cabana for the day was worth it for four adults and two babies. Service at the pool was excellant - just wish the pool bar and restaurant had stayed open later. Check your computer generated bill before leaving. We found a daily charge that even the staff couldn't figure out. They quickly removed it and actually gave us some credit for the fact that I was ill for part of our stay and hadn't been able to use any of the resort facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Wow--What great service!”
Reviews.Author: firegalarizona
Reviews.Content: I recently took a girl's trip and was thrilled with the friendly service and great deals at he Biltmore. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a wonderful getaway. We stayed in the Ocatilla rooms and enjoyed wonderful appetizers, breakfast and happy hours. The service was terrific and made us all feel very important! While checking in, we had friendly and helpful service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful, Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: KaJohnson
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Arizona Biltmore for a company recoginition trip and my stay was AMAZING! The hotel, staff, etc. was wonderful. Everyone was great starting from the front desk to the houskeeping staff. I really enjoyed my stay and will make sure that I stay at the Biltmore for all of my trips to Phoenix. I loved it and the amenities were awesome (love the spa)! Could not ask for a better trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: catelyn
Reviews.Content: My firend and I stayed at the Arizona Biltmore last weekend and although the hotel and grounds are very nice the services that were offered were overpriced and just so-so. We had paid our bill in advance through Expedia. The room and beds were comfortable but the furniture was rather old and worn. Be sure and wear good walking shoes as at this resort you will do alot of that. There were only 2 restaurants Wrights ...pricey and Starbucks...also pricey $10 for plain coffee and a muffin. The Grill was closed due to renovation. The Cabana poolside grill was reasonable but we usually away in the daytime it closed at 7:00 pm. Wear good walking shoes to get to your car as the parking garage is about a quarter mile away and we were charged $12. a day for it. Finally my friend noticed there were almost $200 in pending charges on her debit card that she was not notifyed would be beforehand.

Reviews.Title: “Never again will I stay at the AZ Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: Nem3422
Reviews.Content: Service was horrible at the pool and I couldn't even get a BandAid when my girlfriend needed one. Not to mention, the employees eye-balling my girlfriend the entire time. The guy told me that I had to buy them at the gift shop if I needed them. The food at the restaurant was good, but way overpriced.... just like everything else there. The location is horrible, especially if you can't rent a car. It cost me $100 just to get into Tempe and back, so I would not recommend this place if you plan on leaving the hotel campus. The thing that really made me angry was seeing the bill at the end of our trip. One thing that they don't disclose to you before you get a room is that there is a $28 room fee (plus $4 in taxes) for each day you stay there to cover the hotel amenities. For a 4 night stay, I paid $128 for room fees! Ridiculous!!! Trust me, the hotel is very pretty, but definitely not worth the cost and the hype. DO NOT stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Accomadating Beyond Reproach”
Reviews.Author: BostonPetvet
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Biltmore where our company held its annual National Sales Meeting and our group could not have been more happy. Yes, the drinks and food that individuals purchased outside the meeting were expensive but the staff could not have been more accomadating or pleasant. Lots of planning goes into a meeting of 300 but there still will be last minute requests, on the fly changes and unforeseen needs that the Biltmore staff handled without batting an eye. There response was always - "we'll make it happen". The banquet food we were served impressed all, the grounds are beautiful and the scenic backdrop of the mountain is worth staring at as you sip your morning coffee. Sure some of the older rooms are not as nice as the newer Villas but with 8 pools, a staff that is eager to please, a convenient location to the airport and an interesting history, our sales team found it a great place for a meeting and many commented that they would return for a visit if they had the chance. Are there nicer more lavishes resorts in the Phoenix area? - certainly but you will be hard pressed to find a property that will do more to make your stay pleasant and enjoyable. For us, it was certainly the Wright choice.....

Reviews.Title: “OK if you can get a Great Rate - Otherwise find another nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: PatnJenCaveCreek_AZ
Reviews.Content: We got a fantastic rate at the Biltmore (under 100) for a Saturday night stay. The hotel itself is very beautiful to look at with the unique archetecture and beartifully landscaped grounds. It is definately something to see once. However our meal at the main restaurant (Wrights) was just OK, nothing special. Drinks in the evening at Wright's bar was a very nice place to enjoy the main building and watch all the people. However, once you left the main lodge things started to fall down. Our room while large and with a balcony was a little dingy and needing updating. Also the bathroom was tiny which I don't understand since there was plenty of room to expand into the sleeping room. Also the balcony was filthy. At a five star resort I expect everything to be clean including the balcony. The other thing you do get with an 80 year old hotel--thin walls and no water pressure. Lastly the hotel was at capacity that weekend and the facilities were not there to handle a capacity crowd. There were not enough pool chairs let alone room in the pool to move. If the hotel has a certain guest capacity then they should be able to provide all the guests the same level of service regardless of how many people show up. The hotel did not live up to its reputation for Luxury and elegance that I expected. So ultimately I was glad I got to see this grand old dame but would definately not pay the on-season rates they advertise. Phoenix is full of great resorts and you can do better than this one.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous and relaxing, no issues.”
Reviews.Author: doremifa
Reviews.Content: The Arizona Biltmore staff was extremely accommodating, it was a wonderful stay. We stayed 4 days for a birthday celebration and the hotel did many many things to make it a very special experience. The room was clean and very comfortable and the food was great. I would stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Ecellent Service”
Reviews.Author: hoppy4409
Reviews.Content: Holli, Our hostess for several meals was extrmely professional and attended to all our needs. You should consinder yourself fortunate to have such an employee. Mark W. Hopkins

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service at the pool!”
Reviews.Author: quirkychristine
Reviews.Content: We just visited the Arizona Biltmore for a "girl's" weekend and had a wonderful time. We spent the first day lounging by the pool and were instantly treated to exceptional service by Aaron and his staff. They went out of their way to make us feel welcome, attended to our every need, and even convinced us to change our plans for the next day and spend a second full day with them by the pool. In addition to the great treatment at the pool, the staff also didn't even hesistate when we asked for late night "room service" on the patio outside the lobby (enjoying the great weather). When asked what was on the menu, the response was "whatever you'd like." All in all, a wonderful weekend. We will definitely be going back again!

Reviews.Title: “Not so impressed.”
Reviews.Author: sundevil_9
Reviews.Content: I wasn't really impressed with this hotel. Due to the price and the hype, I expected something grand, and although the grounds are beautiful, the service and rooms left something to be desired. My first 2 nights I stayed nearby at a Homewood suites for half the price and the room was equipped with a kitchen, bedroom, 2 flat screen TVs and free parking. The 3rd night I had to move to Biltmore for a wedding. The Biltmore had an extremely comfy bed but that's all that impressed me. I was beyond shocked that the room didn't have wireless internet, and that after all the parking charges ($12/day, $27 over night) and resort fee charges ($28/day plus tax of course) I could have stayed at the Homewood Suites another night. Plus I didn't really find the staff accommodating (aside from valet, which was very helpful) and they seemed annoyed to be there. Now for the last 2 days I am currently trying to get ahold of someone who can help me figure out why this extra $10 charge popped up on my credit card, after I had already checked out and signed my bill. Seems to me Biltmore thinks it can rely on the beauty of its grounds - I won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “The service of few made up for disappointing room and service of others”
Reviews.Author: cvmike
Reviews.Content: Attended corporate conference in April. Growing up in the hotel business I always appreciate 'observing' hotels and resorts as a guest. Valet and Bell Staff were genuine and cordial and check in was quick and professional. My room was in the Paradise wing. The Paradise wing is dated and so was the room. On the positive side, the room was spacious and quiet. On the negative side, the beds were way to soft and 'lumpy', the shower/tub drain was broken, the water drained slowly in the shower, the LAN wire for internet service was frayed and inoperable, the doorknob into the bathroom was completely broken.... I was amazed this room was put into service, (Biltmore, the room is 2205) My trip to the pool after my arrival was disappointing. After ten minutes and no server approaching I flagged down someone and asked for a menu. He told me he wasn't my server but could bring me a menu. Ten more minutes went by and I had to flag someone else down. She told me she also was not my server but would have someone come over. Finally when someone came over to take a drink order and I asked for a menu I was informed that they had just stopped serving food! She did apologize and was able to scrounge up a bowl of chips (but no salsa).....for which I was charged nearly $5. Despite all mentioned above I loved the layout of the property. It is spacious and exellently manicured and maintained. Other than the pool, the entire staff at this property is great. The banquet staff was teriffic and the food was very good. They helped overcome the negatives. Of special recognition was the server at the Wright's bar, Jami. Jami was professional, efficient and fun. She remembered our names form the previous evening(s), remembered our preferred beverages, and most importantly, was a sports fan that knows the game of baseball. Her enthusiastic attitude showed and she is a true asset to the Biltmore!

Reviews.Title: “Service, par excellence”
Reviews.Author: zalmine
Reviews.Content: At the beginning of April, my 90 year old mother, my sister and I stayed for one night at the Biltmore. It was my mother's birthday. It was glorious, from the suite we had, to the dinner that night for her birthday, down to shopping at the Men's shop. My mother was in 7th heaven and I'll tell you why. It started with meeting Carolyn O'Shea at the Ocatilla Lounge. We really didn't have the time to use the Lounge but she went out of her way to make all of us feel welcomed and pampered. She showed us around the Lounge, gave us a couple of treats to try and then helped to get us reservations at Wright's for dinner that night. She arranged it. (We had reservations at another restaurant that night that we cancelled.) She was professional, kind, respectful and just the loveliest person. That was our introduction to the Biltmore! Almost everyone at the Biltmore was professional and wonderful to us even though we were staying just one night. Mario at the Men's Shop, Robert Wade (director at Wright's), Matt Case (manager at Wright's - we were very impressed with Matt), Paulina in housekeeping, and the manager in reservations (forgot his name) who set us up in a magnificent suite in the Ocatilla section when I first made these reservations. My mother and I look forward to visiting the Biltmore in the future. It was extraordinary and it's a birthday my mother will never forget. Thank you all!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Passover/ Easter Week Hassles”
Reviews.Author: piperturboarrow
Reviews.Content: First time our family stayed at this resort and unfortunately the last. When we booked we were told that there was a large Jewish family staying at the resort for Passover. Thought at the time it was an odd comment, until we arrived and found out it was a tour group of 750 people there to celebrate Passover. From check-in to about day 4 of our 7 day vacation our requests were generally answered with, "I'm sorry this or that is for our Passover guests". In particular I asked for a nicer roll-away bed for our son, but was told the full mattress types were for "our Passover guests." When we couldn't find a spot to sit at by the main pool, all were "saved" by 9 am, I asked to rent a cabana, but they were rented well in advance by this large tour group. On day 4 I asked to meet with the Manager or director of operations, I did this by calling the manager's office to set up an appointment. The Manager of the Front Desk did meet with me and was a very wonderful person and managed to convey my problems to the director of operations, who then upgraded my two rooms to a two bedroom villa and gave us a cabana for our use, even though two days prior I was told they were all rented out. I felt that I made a reasonable request to meet with the Manager or Director of Operations, but neither were available, even though I told the assistant I could meet at anytime. When a guest asks politely to meet with a Manger I was surprise and dismayed at the lack of response. For me that spoke volumes about their concern for my family and I as guests of the resort As good as their service recovery was, it still felt like a non-vacation, having to go to so much effort to be treated as a guest as important as the large tour group members. My suggestion would be to close reservations to everyone else and have the resort reserved for this tour group exclusively, because it was evident that they (the tour group) were the main focus of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Every Year”
Reviews.Author: glnstn560
Reviews.Content: Many of our friends and family come to the Biltmore every year for Passover. We all look forward to it all year long. The Biltmore does a wonderful job of taking care of our needs throughout the week. The food they prepare is AMAZING! We all get to enjoy 24 hour food and we all go home five pounds heavier, but its worth EVERY POUND! The grounds are STUNNING and the service is outstanding. The rooms could use some updating, as every year many visitors tend to have plumbing issues in their rooms. We always look forward to relaxing at the spa. This year however my only major complaint was my massage. I was picked up from the lounge late and still ended on time, and the entire massage my therapist talked all about how she is the "lead" therapist and how lucky I am to have her as she is the best there. I dont know about you but when I get a massage I like to relax, she did not make that possible in any way. The massage itself was so-so but the constant talking herself up as if she was the only good therapist in the world was quite annoying. The room itself was cold and all tile as well and had no ambiance of relaxation. I must mention however my wife LOVED her massage and her therapist. Thanks again Biltmore for an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Check before checking in”
Reviews.Author: bobsgirlrumson
Reviews.Content: Although the grounds were lovely and the history of the hotel was fascinating, there was one gigantic problem with this hotel.......If you are not celebrating Passover, do not under any circumstances book this hotel in the three days preceeding and succeeding this holiday or during it. When we arrived for our quiet first anniversary celebration, the first thing we see are masses of strollers and children running all about. Upon further observation, both visual and offered by the bellman, we were informed that the hotel becomes 90% occupied by the orthodox sect of Judaism at this time. For us, this meant incredible noise, children running everywhere, and worst of all, east coast manners of the parent clientele. Unbearable.........incessant cell phone usage, loud voices and general rudeness constantly.....There were no pools that were adult only and worst of all the children were often unsupervised and allowed to behave as they wished. Poolside, people would "save" chairs beginning at 9 am and then never sit in them until late afternoon if at all! There was also no towel service at the outlying pools unless calls were made. It was clear that management had either lost control or did not care to control the way people behave at their property. Certainly we wished we had been informed that a hotel we had believed would be a quiet romantic getaway had not been turned into a mass playground for hordes of children. I understand the sensitive nature of the foregoing and do not want the reader to feel we were being prejudiced, we are not. We are simply noting the behavior of what could have been ANY large group of people, not picking on one group in particular. I would not have wanted to share the hotel with 90% college aged spring breakers either. But I do feel it is incumbent upon management to somehow tastefully inquire as to the purpose of a person's visit and make sure it matches the ambiance the hotel provides. Having said that, our room was clean although the minibar was never restocked and on check out day, despite being granted late check out, housekeeping rang three times. The parking fees were annoying and self parking was too far and unlit. The location was great and the concierge helpful when asked for outside restaurant options. We loved the location of our room and had perfect weather.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Visit IF...”
Reviews.Author: ArmoredMBZ
Reviews.Content: ...You Don't Want to Have THE ABSOLUTE BEST TIME of Your Life!! ;) My fiance and I just spent 4 nights at the luxurious Arizona Biltmore Resort & Spa in Phoenix, AZ. We stayed in the brand new Ocotillo rooms in the Arizona Wing - and wow - the beds were amazing! I've never slept so good in my life!! Make sure you get a great view of the pool - you won't regret it! The staff was amazing - and the service was A++! My only complaint was that I couldn't stay longer!! (my vacation ended too soon!!) I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a romantic and relaxing vacation spot. PS: The hotel is only a few blocks from terrific shopping and dining! If you get the chance, check out True Food at the Biltmore Shops down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing staycation that feels like a vacation”
Reviews.Author: nadofan8
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from a four day stay at the Arizona Biltmore. It was a perfect relaxing and fun get away. The grounds of the Biltmore are absolutely beautiful and compliment the gorgeous Frank lloyd Wright architecture. My friend and I took our teenage daughters for a little spring break trip. We stayed in one of the cottage rooms. It was very comfortable and had a huge bathroom with a tub and a separate shower. We were able to use the well equipped gym everyday followed by a steam and sauna in the spa. It was incredibly relaxing to sit by one of the eight pools everyday while the girls swam. The poolside lunches were healthy and delicious. We were able to eat at Wright's restaraunt for dinner one night and really enjoyed the great food and attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “The Biltmore is beautiful and has great service”
Reviews.Author: roop90
Reviews.Content: The Biltomore is like arriving at an oasis. The grounds are beautiful, the outdoor seating is wonderful and the lattes at the cafe wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place that has something for everyone”
Reviews.Author: duke4ever
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, the rooms were great too. The rooms were spacious and the beds were extremely comfortable. We had a great view of Squaw Peak. The location was really good for our group. We had people arriving from all over the country for a wedding and we had easy access to the airport and the location is very central in Phoenix, which is a large city! The hotel grounds are very beautiful both during the day and when lit up at night. Definately an oasis in the city. I used the catering services to serve a meal to a group of 35+ after we took wedding pictures at the Biltmore and the food was both very tasty and served with lovely presentation. They did such a nice job and I could relax and enjoy the food and my guest before the 7:30 pm wedding at another location (it was a desert buffet ). Valet service was very effecient and helpful. The Concierge gave me the name of a terrific florist to use for my rehursal dinner and my flowers were outstanding for that event. The hotel was so helpful with getting handicaped rooms for two elderly couples that were in out party. I can't say enought about how the hotel, spa, salon, and all the people that work at the Biltmore made the whole weekend a very extra special celebration. Many of my friends had not been in the area before but loved the hotel so much they wished they could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay with superb facilities and great, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: tapestryencinitas
Reviews.Content: An historic hotel with great service and beautiful grounds. Great location to all in central Phoenix and short drives to other areas, such as Scottsdale. The staff is so pleasant and helpful with any questions. Our room was the standard or classic room, very nice, but the bathroom is a bit small. Very quiet where we were. There was a lot of hustle and bustle going on in the hotel, meetings, conferences, etc. The Spa is beautiful, and the canal is close by for a nice walk. The food was excellent in all the restaurants. A great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic , Historic, worth every dollar”
Reviews.Author: gleuny
Reviews.Content: This historic hotel is worth a visit. We stayed in the Arizona wing (valley bldg) which was recently renovated. We even had a terrace which is a nice plus. This Frank Lloyd Wright building design is historic and the entire resort stays in character. Some of the furniture was re-upholstered and rightfully so. The carpets, Flat Panel, and bathroom however are 21st century. The main pool is nice, so are the several smaller ones. The staff is very attentive, polite, and cater to every whim. I can't say enough good things. Had dinner in the main dinning room. The $35 pre-fix is the best bargain. Nothing is cheap here, but it's reasonable for a 5 star hotel. Mini-fridge will store some items, but this isn't the place to go to save money, this is a splurge. You may want to consider the 'concierge level' Aside from liquor, computer access, other amenities, they also provide all day snacks, lunch and breakfast. Desert at night. Worth the $85 a day if you plan on drinking several $20 martini's during your stay. Yes the $28 resort fee sucks, but it's better than being nickel and dimed to death at the Pointe Hiltons. As for the $15 a day self parking fee, don't tell them, they won't charge you. For the record, I got a sale price under 200 a day, the same price I paid at the Point Hilton Tappatio and Sqaw peak. Wish I stayed here all 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and History.... Doesn't disappoint!!”
Reviews.Author: biznessandpleasure
Reviews.Content: My family and I were a little skeptical about staying here after reading so many horrible reviews... but we were pleasantly surprised. Either things have changed drastically or those other people were outside the gates drooling to get in and therefore were trashing the place out of envy. We had a phenomenal time. The staff were friendly, the grounds were gorgeous and the views were breathtaking! I have stayed in many resorts around the world and this one has to be at the top of my list. We didn't want to leave and we can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Experience most memorable”
Reviews.Author: TastebudsNewJersey
Reviews.Content: General Manager: Aaron Beaver Servers: Ernie Mattson, Sharon Mc Grath, Brian Smith, staff at the Arizona Biltmore Resort & Spa, made our 3 day stay, one that we will not soon forget. There friendliness and attention to our requests, were all met which such enthusiam and professionalism. They were just awesome! The cabanas our group rented were an added bonus to our stay. We would highly recommend them to anyone visiting your establishment. With short notice, Aaron Beaver arranged and coordinated with the chef, an outstanding light buffet that was beautifully executed and so delicious. Thank you all for making our much needed get-a-way, a trip to repeat real soon! All the Best! Genevieve & Rowland Davies, III Brick, New Jersey

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: AMPuglisi
Reviews.Content: My girlfiends and I met at the Biltmore for a "spa weekend." We found the service to be excellent and the spa services superb! That made up for the shortcomings of the room. We were not able to check in until after the guaranteed 4:00 p.m. and when we did, we spent about an hour and a half waiting on amenities: robes, extra hangers, an iPod docking station that worked, maintenance to unstop our sink. The carpet was very worn and the lawn blowers at 8:00 a.m. were a little (a lot) annoying--as was the fire alarm that went off in our room at 9:00 a.m. But, it was difficult for us to get upset because the people working at the Biltmore were so nice. Eric at the front desk was great when we called about all of the issues in our room. Aaron at the pool made the best Sangrias we've ever tasted. And, our waitress at our cabana at the pool, Sharon, was as attentive as we needed her to be. In addition, Sheila gave the best facial I've ever had! We are already planning another weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “this was the nicest hotel she has stayed at in the world”
Reviews.Author: JamesTorres
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many luxury hotels throughout the world and when my Wife states that this was the nicest hotel she has stayed at in the world that is a strong statement. I would like to express my deep and sincere thanks for the hospitality and professionalism by everyone at the Arizona Biltmore Hotel, who welcomed myself and my wife Sharon on our recent vacation. It was very comfortable room with great service and top shelf meals provided by the chef throughout the hotel and especially in our concierge section. I would like especially to compliment the new Arizona wing. I want to specifically point out Carolyn, Amanda and Cody, who were very professional, polite, punctual and both served and helped both my wife questions and me with excellent service. I will certainly recommend the Arizona Biltmore and in particular the new Arizona wing with its outstanding concierge service to my colleagues and friends. Best regards, James and Sharon

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LClare
Reviews.Content: First off, I had a great time while I was at the resort and the weather was perfect BUT the room was truly awful. I have seen prettier rooms at Marriott's, Hyatt's etc. The mattress was so lopsided and I did request assistance in making the bed more level yet the staff at the hotel did not care. The Wrights restaurant was overpriced and the actually serving/portion size of the Waldorf salad was not even one cup. I truly was so surprised at the lack of detail to the decorating of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Completly BAD”
Reviews.Author: chrisdj
Reviews.Content: Room was dirty, stains on carpet everywhere. We complained and got another room It was even dirtier! Waste of money. The maid was knocking on door at 7:00 am!!!!! The should change thier name as it nowhere near a Biltmore level.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: caroleMichigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for our 43rd wedding anniversary. Our Room was awesome. We had breakfast in our room the next morning. Food was excellent and room service personnel were fantastic. We received a tour of the property by a staff member. He was very knowledgeable and shared some of the uniqueness of the resort, its beginnings and how it was built. Everyone we came in contact with was top shelf. We highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: apkiel14
Reviews.Content: Well kept beautiful property. We traveled with two young children (7 and 4) and we always felt welcome throughout the resort, especially in the club room during breakfast and in the evening for desert/wine. Concierge was always friendly and offered knowledgably advice on activities throughout the Phoenix area. Although it was cool in the morning and evenings, we were still able to enjoy the heated pools. Location was good … close to hiking and shopping. Staff was very friendly and personable. Great stay, we will defiantly say again if we are in the Phoenix area. Kids also loved the resort … ranks with Disney as one of there favorite places.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic serivce, great food and beautiful surroundings.”
Reviews.Author: nylorac22
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, with very comfortable beds. Soft as silk sheets and comforters. Attentive service. Would go back in a minute to stay in the wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch staff at the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: LAS64
Reviews.Content: This is our companies 2nd time in 4 months using the Biltmore. The staff is outstanding and as a meeting planner they really make my job easy and they sure do make me loook good! We hosted a Mardi Gras night and all the servers jumped in and wore masks for us which really made them part of the evening. From arrival to departure the event was flawless. Our customers had a great expereience and continue to rave about the fine staff at the Biltmore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds but rooms need a refresh”
Reviews.Author: bdaniels
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice for business and the grounds are beautiful, the food is good quality and the conference areas are nice. The weather in February can't be beat and there is something magical about the trees brimming with oranges. Unfortunately the rooms are very out dated - old wallpaper, cigarette burns in the draperies in a non-smoking room, 1970s furniture & bathroom. At the price point the rooms are really a disappointment although the beds are comfortable. If you go, don't miss the incredible cookies - they are some of the best I've tasted.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: buckeyerailroad
Reviews.Content: Personnel were friendly and attentive upon stepping out of the car and throughout the stay. Even groundskeepers and housekeeping initiated greetings in passing. Room was clean and well appointed, simple but smart. Landscaping set the tone for the enitre stay. This facility is meticulously manicured. Erroneous mini-bar charge was corrected without event. As is typical with many upscale facilities, mini-bar is over-priced and I never utilize.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, peaceful stay at the Biltmore”
Reviews.Author: itajkim
Reviews.Content: The Biltmore is a lovely, sprawling campus with wonderful lawns and common areas to relax with a glass of wine. The pool is fabulous, the spa is even nicer. We were upgraded to a junior suite which was huge -- complete with two outdoor patios. They have an hourly shuttle to take you to a nearby high-end mall.

Reviews.Title: “Arizona Biltmore is the Best”
Reviews.Author: Andromeda55
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the one-of-a-kind Arizona Biltmore. I can honestly say that the facility has come to acquire special meaning for me, on both a personal and professional level. The staff and service are everything you'd expect from a resort of this caliber. No disappointments there. Beyond that, the grounds, the architecture and the total "encapsulated experience" of gathering with close personal friends and colleagues within the Biltmore's environs....just takes your breath away. Thank you, for two exquisitely memorable stays!

Reviews.Title: “A desert gem”
Reviews.Author: JC60
Reviews.Content: We spent three great days at the Arizona Biltmore at a conference recently and thoroughly enjoyed it. The property is a gem: an historic Frank Lloyd Wright creation that is timeless and beautifully maintained. The staff is attentive, friendly and helpful. Prepare yourself: this is an expensive 5-star resort. But the value is there. It's one of the great hotel resorts in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, great beds, snotty service”
Reviews.Author: g8trgrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Biltmore in January as part of a promotional rate with the Rock and Roll Marathon. I had stayed before and convinced my girlfriends to go to this hotel for race weekend. A few drawbacks on service: As a Hilton Gold member, I had made one of our two room reservations and requested two beds in our room. I called about both rooms 2 weeks before our check-in and asked to gaurantee two queen beds for each room. The front desk clerk told me, quite snippily, that he couldn't gaurantee it, but it shouldn't be a problem because over 2/3 of the property had two queen rooms. I explained that this was a requirement because all four of us were running long distances - he said, no problem. Imagine my surprise when we checked in, and I was told that there was only ONE room available for us (at 1:00) with two beds; all other double rooms on the property were sold out. Despite the fact that NOT all the rooms were checked in, and we were standing there, the front desk would not, initially, find us a room with two beds for our second grouping. As it turns out, they did go through, room by room, for all the reservations, and found a single guy who had asked for two queens - and they switched his reservation - again, they said, the only one left in the property. Bottom line: If you really, really have a bed preference, you MUST have status to ensure that you receive it. I will also add that we were in the Arizona wing. Our rooms were large, though not the largest on the property (the whole wing looks bad from the outside, but the bathroom was the size of my first apartment and the beds were extraordinary, plus we had a balcony with a great view of the mountains). We hit up the large pool by the spa the first day, but despite the fact that all the cabanas were empty, there wasn't a single lounge chair to be found. Tip: get to the pool early if you want a seat, OR go to the pool at the Arizona wing, which is empty all day. Finally, for dinner nearby, go to Chelsea's Kitchen or Postino's - great fresh food that makes your trip to Phoenix unique. I'd go back to the Biltmore, but I'd be more picky about where I stayed AND make sure that I checked in as early as possible.

Reviews.Title: “class less at the biltmore”
Reviews.Author: hawkeye28
Reviews.Content: From start to finish the whole expierenced was disapointing. It seemed everytime you turned around they were charging you for something. overnight parking, maid service, you name it. The only place on property that didnt drop the ball was the pool service. They were excellent and the staff coldn't be anymore helpful. I came with my family for a weekend getaway and it was more like a very expensive let down. The front desk was more snooty than the guest, and forget about talking to any resturant managers about concerns. They are either unavailable or just dont care. So if you go to the Biltmore, only go to the pool if you can. They are great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Biltmore !”
Reviews.Author: LJBROCK
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for the Biltmore after booking a room there and became a little worried. We stayed one night for a romantic getaway on a Sunday night in January. We had a great time. Check in was easy and quick. We were upgraded to a king room, upstairs, next to the Catalina Pool. The room wasn't huge, but very nice. Yes, the carpet was a bit worn, but clean. The bed was comfortable enough, but we could tell it older and in need of replacement. Parking was never an issue. We were able to self park right in front of our room. We sat by the pool all afternoon. We choose to stay at the smaller catalina pool as the larger paradise pool was a bit crowded. The pool was clean, lovely and peaceful. The water temp was a bit too warm to be comfortable, more like a hot tub then a pool. But the next morning I noticed people in the pool despite the cool air temperature, so the water temp was probably perfect for that. I would imagine in the summer months, the pool is not kept that warm. We got breakfast from the cafe and ate outside next to the Squaw Peak Lawn. It was pricey, but nothing out of line for a place like the Biltmore. The coffee and food were excellent and the view from the patio beautiful. Service was great. All staff encountered at the Biltmore were helpful and provided great customer service. My husband used the exercise facility in the spa and said it was nice. We would definitely stay there again, next time for more then one night.
